title: Good Hotel
review: Lovely hotel with spacious bedrooms hotel very clean staff helpful and friendly  Underground parking but difficult to get out of due to space  Lovely breakfast plenty of fresh fruit and a great selection of food  Good location

title: Fabulous Hotel, excellent staff
review: Lovely hotel, location and underground parking (although it is a tight squeeze).  Bar / restaurant on site is very nice. Only stayed for an overnight stop. Very good value for money. Only small critic was the TV system.  Although stated international only English channel was Bloomberg! Thoroughly recommended

title: Good Hotel
review: Room was decent; bathroom looks like it was renovated but not updated. Few receptacles available for charging, Three larger-than-normal elevators (for Europe) hold 6 people and make movement convenient.

title: Fantastic find parking available
review: The hotel is very clean , rooms are large and well equipped and staff very helpful and friendly . It’s a 5 minute walk into town and 20 minute walk to alhambra palace . We booked a room rate that included parking which was very reasonable . Highly recommend this beautiful hotel.

title: Good location
review: Great location to visit the old town of Granada and the Alhambra. Room is spacious and quiet. Comfortable bed and nice bathroom. Not much English on tv and we somehow lost CNBC. Breakfast was good. We only stayed overnight.

title: Decent hotel
review: We stayed at this hotel for one night. The room was the smallest for three people. As is the case in all of Spain, we had huge coffee machine problems during breakfast. The room looked old and outdated.

title: Great location and friendly, welcoming staff
review: Excellent hotel near the city centre and close to public transport.The exterior and interior of the hotel are very well kept and clean.There is a swimming pool in lovely surroundings and a restaurant. There are great views of Grenada from the top floors and the lift is amazing-it is all glass and set on the exterior of the hotel so you get views of the hotel and Grenada. The staff are hospitable and very friendly and welcoming.There is no iron in the room but upon request they can provide one.

title: Nice hotel
review: Booked this hotel for the location - half way between the central and the football stadium. Found the room clean and comfortable and the staff were very helpful. Restaurant Qubba is also very nice and has a good mix of local and non local food choices. Would definitely recommend.

title: Holiday in Granada
review: Lovely hotel quite near the hassle and bussel of Granada, very clean, quiet and very pleasant place to stay.approx 20 minute walk to Plaza Nuava, and also Al Hambra. Which is definitely worth a visit, try to book before you go and miss the queues.

title: Beautiful Hotel
review: Saray is a beautiful hotel in a beautiful city. It's near to the city center and according to its facilities is cost-effective I think, standard rooms need renewing. If you go to Granada, this hotel is a good choice.

title: Good location, great staff
review: Stayed here for two nights as part of a road trip around the Spanish golden triangle. Good location, about a 10-15 minute walk to the centre (or 5 euros in an Uber) and has a really nice open air pool and bar area. The staff here really make a difference, nothing is too much trouble. From the greeting you get at the front desk to the service at the pool bar everyone is happy to help in any way that can. If I head back to Seville I would have no problems going back to this hotel.

title: Centric and comfortable
review: From the very entrance you can feel the sense of been transported to a mixture of cultures, the Arabic, the Hebrew and Hispanic. The space is general is very comfortable to the eye and gives relax to the observers. No complains at all about thee attention given by all the employees. The swimming pool area is nice. The have a mini bar in this area with very good prices. The room were I stayed is pleasent enough but I learned they have luxury rooms where you can spend a wonderful time while been in this historic city. They also have a restaurant where you can have an interesting variety in the menu. And great beers or wines.

title: Good Base to Explore Granada
review: My family, two adults and two teenage daughters, spent a week here at the beginning of the summer holidays.  We found the rooms to be reasonably clean with twin beds that could be pushed together or separated.  The rooms were air-conditioned and had a fridge, a big wardrobe as well as a table and two chairs.  The bathrooms were a little basic and tired, but that didn't affect our experience.  We made use of the gym which had two treadmills, two bikes, free weights and a multi-function machine.  The gym was air-conditioned.  There could have been more towels and more water but it was good otherwise.  We paid for breakfast and were glad that we did.  There was plenty of choice at the breakfast buffet and no limit on how much you could eat or drink.  There was something for…

title: Old hotel, great pool area
review: The hotel was ok. Most rooms are old and not like the pictures that show the renovated ones. The bathrooms very worn out. The beds are hard and madrasses should be changed. Housekeeping could have done a better job cleaning. The pool area is great though.

title: Dirty & worn out
review: Visited with a group of friends.  Immediately noticed worn out and stained lobby furniture.  When I checked into my room, the sheets had a large stain on them.  Hotel replaced them but I was unsettled by that.  Bathrooms were old.  Cracked and moldy tiles.  I would suggest they review their housekeeping and maintenance services.  I would not recommend staying here.

title: Unsatisfactory customer service
review: I wasn't particularly impressed with this hotel: the rooms were stuffy and mine smelt like a smoker had stayed in it. However, the most problematic part of my stay was with regards to room payment- on arrival the receptionist took a bank card as a guarantee payment but I was told it would not be charged until checkout. On checkout, it transpired that the payment had already been taken, causing me great difficulty as the money been taken from the wrong account. The attitude of the receptionist staff was unhelpful, to say the least.

title: Absolutely Disgusting
review: This hotel is dingy and gross. Our room key card deactivated multiple times throughout our stay. The pool ladder was broken and the cushions on the lounge looked dirty. Our non-smoking room reeked of tobacco. Our family was forced to stay at this hotel because the cancellation date was a whole month in advance and we didn't realize that until after we had passed it. We were originally planning to stay in a much nicer hotel that was closer to the Alhambra.

title: One of the worst hotels I stayed in Spain
review: I honestly can’t give any positive feedback. The rooms smelled disgusting every time you entered. The pillows were hard and uncomfortable. There were these cans of food that looked like it came from the 1800s. The breakfast was horrible. We could barely find anything to eat.

title: Old hotel just average.
review: Older hotel in center of city. Pools area needs major attention. Broken ladders and discolored old cushions on lounge chairs. Rooms are small ant there are few electrical outlets, none near the beds or desk.

title: Good hotel but poor view from room
review: I liked the hotel which was very convenient for the conference centre (the reason I was in Granada). I had a view of a brick wall from my room. The pool area was great even though I had so little time there. I thought the breakfast was a little disappointing

title: Room service food was terrible
review: Reception staff were miserable and unhelpful (expect one man when we were checking out who was polite friendly and helpful). Room was dark and had an unpleasant view of the conference centre and bins, which were very noisy overnight, as it seems lots of activity occurred there from noisy vehicles. Room service food was terrible. I called at 7.45pm and was told "no" I couldn't order anything (as it seemed the man could not speak English). I then rang reception and the women refused to help me. She sounded annoyed when I explained the situation and just put me back through to the same man. I had asked her not to do that and asked her if she could help as she spoken good english but she said " no, everyone here can speak English" and then just put me directly through to the same…

title: Quick stay in Granada
review: Stayed here as part of one of our stops in our guided tour through Spain. Hotel was clean, rooms were spacious although they felt a bit dated (see pics). There weren't many outlets in the room to charge electronics and the ones available were not close to the bed at all. The breakfast buffet had many options and the food was good, although it was kind of a madhouse. Service was adequate.

title: Lovely stay.....
review: We booked this hotel, primarily as we wanted one with a pool.  We were not disappointed.  This hotel is perfect for a short stay in Granada.  We arrived late, our room was ready.  Lovely spacious room, decorated all White with Moorish touches.  Lovely bath robes, slippers, and good sized towels. - it was clean, comfy, roomy and had everything you needed for a short stay.  We were on the 7th floor - so views as well.  The staff, service and all areas were fab.  The pool lovely, as it was 40deg whilst there, so a nice swim was a god send.  Only a shortish walk to the old centre of town, say 10-15 mins....but they arrange a taxi so quickly and to get to town or the Palace c. 5Euros.  Would definitely recommend this hotel.  We loved it.

title: Good location, spacious room
review: From the 7th floor we could see the Sierra Nevada mountains. There is nothing fancy about the rooms but it has everything you need and is located near lots of shops and restaurants so you can just walk. In room safe and fridge, extra blankets (but no extra pillows). Pool area is nice but water was cold in June.  Good for groups and nice enough for a short stay.

title: Visit the Alhambra Palace
review: Great hotel. Staff v friendly, v clean, large room and bathroom with complimentary toiletries. Only fault was although we were on the 4th floor road noise was still apparent nothing else at fault. Didn't have breakfast as we only have toast or croissant. Parking was OK underneath. The hotel is close to the city centre, no more than 5 minute walk, some alongside the river, so good access to restaurants, shops etc. Supermarket close by.  If you only want a light breakfast try Flamboyant, just a few minutes away.

title: Nice stay
review: We stayed for one night to attend to a convention that was held in the Palacio de Congresos. Nice room, spacious and quiet room. The rooms were clean as was the bathroom. Toiletries are provided and great service at reception.

title: Stunning
review: Amazing hotel for what you pay however parking is limited and not many parking places around. There is also limited food/takeaway options nearby unless you’d want to walk for an hour or so. The room was really large with comfortable beds and basic amenities in the bathroom.

title: Quiet Neighborhood
review: Large clean room. Nice bar area that also has outdoor seating. Located in a quiet area. About a 10-15 minute walk to main part of town. Only negative was low Water pressure for the shower. Amstel oro beer on tap was great.

title: Hotel Saray
review: The Hotel is well located. It is clean and tidy. The rooms are fine and cleaned well.  The Breakfast area is tired and its pretty standard food a bit above budget. The breakfast attendants can be a tad over zealous and unhelpful.  Overall the Hotel is adequate, and satisfactory.

title: Disappointed
review: We chose this hotel because it had good reviews on TripAdvisor. We very much regret staying there. Even in the beginning of May it is hot in Granada. After a long day of sightseeing we went to the pool to relax. There is only 10 (yes ten) deck chairs by the pool so don’t expect finding a free one. We looked for pool towels but found none. Asked for them at the reception but was told the pool was only open in the season (probably meaning July + August) so no pool towels. We had asked for a quiet room. The first night was in one faving the street. No sleep because numerous bus routes pass right In from of the hotel (and stop nearby) and petty goers pass by all through the night. Next day we moved to a room at the back only to be kept awake until 1 im the morning by a party in the…

title: Great hotel
review: Very good location, hotel is amazing, beds and mattress are of great comfort, staff are good, swimming pool was out of service as weather is not suitable as they mentioned the season start on June (visited on April) I think it’s nice choice to consider  Parking my rental car was crazy as no spaces in the car park and the street parking was almost difficult  Nice city to visit with lots of nice and cozy old structures

title: Nice hotel but needed improving on the services.
review: The hotel is nice and clean, but the stuff speaks poor english (sometimes very poor) and it could be definetly more helpful.  A 4 stars hotel is not just beacuse of the swimming pool, it is also expected a good service.

title: My Visit To Granada
review: The hotel is very good, we have stayed there many times and would recommend it to all. It is very near to the Centre of Granada so is very convenient. The rooms are clean and tidy and the staff are very helpful.

title: Good place to stay in Granada
review: Dear costumer, Thank you for your staying in Hotel Saray. We hope to welcome you in futures occasions. Kind regards, Costumer Service.

title: got pickpocketed in the bar and cameras weren't working
review: Stayed as a couple for a night. Room was spacious and clean. We appreciated that there were 2 chairs in the room. My wife is a germaphobe and does not want to lie on the bed before taking a shower. The chairs allowed us to rest for a while after seeing the sights of Granada and before we took a shower. Breakfast was the usual fare and the dining hall was huge.

title: Hotel Saray
review: The location is fairly good as you can walk or take a taxi to most places you want to go.  The lobby is large and staff are friendly.  There is a bar and restaurant on property.  Room service is available.  There is a pool.  Laundry service is available, if needed.  Entry to the room is by keycard which is inserted into a slot just inside the door to activate lights and air, etc.  Bathroom has tub/shower combo.  The shower head is adjustable up and down and can be removed so it is handheld.  It has a two sided mirror - regular and magnified,  There is tissue, hand soap, shampoo, shower gel, shower cap,q-tip and razor.  Also in the bathroom is a hair dryer, two glasses and a bidet.    The armoire has removable hangers (trouser hangers and regular), a shoe rack and extra blankets…

title: We stayed here for three nights
review: This hotel offers good value accommodation. The room has all you need for a comfortable stay and the entrance lobby has lots of space and comfortable chairs for relaxation. It's well located because it's near the bus stop for the airport and is only a short walk into town. I would definitely use this hotel again.

title: It is outdated !!
review: We stayed there for one night to visit Alhambra palace, staff were friendly and helpful, the room size was ok but beds looks old and uncomfortable, doesn't look like the pictures at all, you could hear next room people talking and baby crying, the location is not close to old town, as one of reviewer said there is not outlet close to bed and we had to use an extension,you get what you pay for .

title: SKIP IT!!!!
review: In a word - awful. The staff at the front desk is indifferent at best. Our room #201 was interesting to say the least.  Spacious enough but that's about it.  The beds were warped!!  Had no outlets by the night stands.  Noisy!  Had to stuff a blanket by the door to try and keep the noise out.  The phone innards were removed.  Couldn't get out of there fast enough - 1 night and gone! On the plus side, the restaurant is quite good and the serving staff was wonderful. Avoid it!

title: Disappointing!
review: At first the hotel looks attractive and efficient, but that’s deceptive. Communication necessarily has to be in Spanish. Getting a cup of hot water in the room necessitates a visit to the bar which does not appear to open before 11 am. Anyone coming after 11:30 pm, or before 7:30 am, will not get any service.

title: Stayed to visit friends in Granada.
review: Really friendly staff at check in despite not knowing much Spanish. Room very large. Very quiet. Really comfortable bed. Handy to walk into City. Some nice bars serving drinks and tapas nearby. Out of season so felt that not at full running. Would recommend to friends

title: Clean, convenient and inexpensive
review: The hotel was OK, rooms were clean and service fine.  As it was winter, it appeared that they were operating on half strength, so only the Qubba bar was open for food or drink.  Mind you the quality and service there is good.

title: Could Use Some Work
review: The hotel as a whole feels somewhat unfinished. The rooms, though unexpectedly large, have paper thin walls. The rooms were clean however and their was good WiFi throughout the hotel.  I will say that the food as this hotel (not the breakfast buffet, the bar or the restaurant) is very good. You have to try the local bean and ham dish which is phenomenal and exactly the kind of food we came to Spain for.

title: Great base
review: Within a few metres of the drop off/collection point for the airport bus, position ideal and easy walking into the main town and cultural sites. The staff friendly, very clean and warm which was essential as dropped to below freezing in the night. The bedroom we had allocated was a bit dated, but fine - believe there may be better rooms but as ours booked as an easy jet package, it maybe that had a cheaper room. Had breakfast once, standard European fayre, plentiful and cheaper if pre booked at reception. I would stay there again as good value, convenient and clean with helpful staff.

title: Meh
review: Booked it because it had a parking. When we arrived the parking was full so had to park 5 mins walking away. I booked a double bed. Got 2 single beds. The rooms are so perfumed you should hold your breath and open the window before doing anything else. For the rest it's ok-ish and the staff is friendly.

title: Money stolen from room
review: Stayed here with my sister and another friend. We had a double room with an extra bed. The room was quite small for three people. We wanted to stay somewhere that has a pool. Unfortunately the pool is outdoors and not heated so it was a bad choice.  The location is about 15 min walk to the centre. Taxis are readily available nearby.   The breakfast was the best feature if this hotel. There was lots of choice of both hot and cold items including smoked salmon. It was never that busy.  The worst part of my stay was having some money stolen from my room. I had some Saudi money (riyals) which I left in the room thinking nobody would be interested in foreign  currency. But it was nowhere to be found when we returned later that evening.   I would not come back to this hotel.

title: Stay In Granada
review: Very good hotel, clean and tidy. Staff very helpful. Reception very friendly.Central for most things. Easy to visit city centre, plenty of busses.Would recomend it for anyone.We will go again and enjoy Granada.

title: Room to improve
review: Biggest disappointment-no kettle in room! Have you ever. Hotel is nice looking but there are many shortcuts . No body cream. Hard towels. No tea/coffee or kettle in room. For this very reason I wouldn’t stay there again . Location good though. They just could do so much better. I hope they improve on what they’re lacking. Breakfast is okay though

title: Ok if you get renovated rooms
review: We stayed here as a tour group of 40+ people and eveyone hated this hotel. The exterior seems nice enough but as soon as you get inside you see it has poor lighting and colors making the place feels more like a motel. Also the furnishings are so cheap I honestly don't see how it is a 4⭐ hotel...... We stayed at 5 different hotels during our trip and this was the worst. Perhaps if you can get a renovated room it might feel a bit better, I guess.   The breakfast was quite good, maybe we had breakfast earlier so it wasn't so chaotic as others have described here.  Location is not center but Taxi stand nearby.

title: Excellent Location, Disorganized Breakfast
review: This hotel was very close to shopping and attractions. All was fine but breakfast was a madhouse since the single line was so crowded and not enough tables even required some to sit in the hallway at the coffee table.

title: Perfect place to stay in Granada
review: Our son lives in Granada so we are regular visitors and we always stay at the Saray. Very comfortable and well located hotel. It is within easy walking distance of the centre but is in a quiet area. The room we were given was well equipped with an enormous bed and everything you could want. Friendly and helpful staff. We will return.

title: Wonderful atmosphere
review: Wonderful hotel with great service and friendly staff.  But the aesthetics of the lobby and hotel made it a fun and special stop during out tour of Spain.  Located close to all the major attractions one might want to see.

title: Great little hotel, near where you want to be
review: I loved this hotel; smallish swimming pool, but a nice relaxing swim before dinner.  Hotel is near enough to where you want to be you can walk.  B'fast was great, staff perfect.  It's the kind of hotel you just want to have often.

title: Nice
review: Only stayed one night. Everything was nice and clean. Bed was 2 singles put together. Not what we are used to but it was comfortable. Breakfast was okay but we had dinner here and it was very nice. Smorgasbord with lots of selection and very tasty.

title: 3 day stay
review: Saray is a good choice if you want to stay close to the city centre but away from the hustle and bustle. Beds were nice and ac was very good as well. Wifi is free and good enough for Netflix. The room was quiet but you could hear the draining water from other rooms. Biggest disappointment was the breakfast buffet. Canned fruit??? Fried eggs very oily but there is a nice cafe close by so go for that instead.

title: Beautiful hotel and Alhambra Suite is perfect!
review: Amazing beautiful hotel! Friendly reception staff. Alhambra suite is well worth the money! The private terrace , the fabulous jacuzzi bath, everything was perfect! Huge beds (4 poster) were very comfortable but not king size so we used both. Bathroom is amazing with two gold sinks! Lovely white sheets, towels, dressing gowns and slippers. Superb for a romantic break! We will stay there again

title: Saray Review
review: I received excellent service from a very friendly staff. The accommodations were very comfortable. I would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again if I were to come back to Grenada, Spain. Wonderful breakfast bar1

title: Past its prime - but decent/basic option to explore Granada
review: Don’t expect luxury (not a “palace” as the Arabic name implies - certainly not in this day and age), but the hotel does the basics right. Location is about 10-15min walk from Granada center and 15min taxi ride from Alhambra. So while not in the city center, good location to explore the city from.  Parking is available, but as Spanish as they come - be ready to maneuver tightly. And if you have a big car... good luck!  The restaurant Qubba downstairs was a pleasant surprise despite a slightly underwhelming decor, we had very good carpaccio and solomillo.

title: Nice hotel, not right in the center, but good if arriving by car
review: The reception and public areas are nice. The room (superior deluxe in 6th floor) was renovated and pleasant, although not very large. The location is OK for someone that arrives by car, as the hotel has parking.  Regarding arrival by car: Please note that your GPS system (e.g. TomTom) might guide you to pass in front of the Congress Center ... but that street is not open for private cars .... then you need to make several trials until finding a path that leads to the hotel. The hotel could inform guests about this on their website. The elevators offer a good view of the city. The center is about 20 min walking. Not far from the hotel there is a DIA supermarket and a cafeteria (Flamboyant) that is a good option for breakfast.  The parking is expensive though (18 euros per day).…

title: Good Hotel
review: Good hotel however the rooms are a little outdated.  Nice view of the mountains.  Customer service was excellent.  A little far from the town. However we took the local buses. Taxis are also very cheap. We did the Al Hambra tour and were picked up by the tour company.

title: Good location, rooms are old and need updating
review: Was an okay hotel. Rooms were very old and need updating. Location was good and walking distance to most everything. Breakfast sucked. The worst part was that they had NO IRONS. Called the front desk and they said they don't have any. Was forced to wear wrinkley clothing and couldn't even take any photos because our clothes looked horrible. Don't recommend. If you have to stay here, bring a travel sized steamer with you.

title: Great hotel & location
review: Great hotel, near the centre city. Impressive architecture, pool smaller than photos make it appear. Reasonable prices at 1.08:1 GBP. Helpful staff. Restuarant food was very good, albeit limited in size and atmosphere for a hotel of this size.   Plenty places to eat externally.

title: Not bad
review: Dear Martin, Thank you very much for choose Hotel Saray and share your opinion.  It is a pleasure to know that you have enjoy your stay, our staff treatment and restaurant food, our great pool and the location, just a few minutes walking to the city center. We hope to welcome you soon. Best Regards, EC - Customer Service

title: Nice, central and familyfriendly
review: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel. The reception staff was very friendly. Our room was clean enough and we didn't have any problems aside from a broken hairdryer which was solved within 10 minutes. Breakfast was very nice with much choice. Breakfast area was maybe a bit gloomy without natural lighting. Hotel has a 90's feel about it. Pool area is clean but since there are lots of buildings surrounding it, you have to aim for a spot with sunlight in the morning and evenings. Not enough sunbeds sometimes. Pool is smaller than we thought from the pictures and a bit chilly. Taking into account that this is a city hotel, the pool area is a nice extra though. There's many Spanish people staying in this hotel. Location is great, on walking distance from the town with lovely places…

title: Great hotel, very reasonable for hotel with pool
review: A good hotel with a nice pool.  The man who welcomed us is very nice and gave us a room that was ready, as we showed up too early.  First: nice hotel room, nice surroundings, very close to the city center. 15 minutes walk to Alhambra and Albaizin - district.  The woman working in the kiosk, and the staff working in the breakfast is ok, but their behavior makes us remember this is a 4 star hotel - not the service you will get in 5 stars hotel. Also a bit boring breakfast place in the basement. Normal brekfast, a bit boring - and its not cheap.  Good coffee from machines.  Pool: very nice but too few sunbeds.  The pool serves beer, some drinks, coke chips, several dishes and ice cream. When I asked the woman in the kiosk for a glass of cava she said «no». Strange. The hotel must…

title: Lovely hotel but be warned about the swimming pool...
review: We thought the hotel was a good price and a nice walk into town. We booked it for the outdoor pool and ended up disappointed, however. As we had a busy schedule, we wanted to spend our mornings by the pool before heading out to do touristy things. The pool opening times are 11am-8pm so we could not do this. When we did manage some pool time at around 5pm one evening, there were children everywhere shouting and throwing things. I think the hotel needs to tell families to control their kids as non-familes also want holidays! I wouldn't go there again due to this but the hotel is nice for the price.

title: Great Hotel, Ideal Location
review: The outdoor lifts are the first thing you notice when entering this hotel a nice touch. The rooms are clean good size with good amenities. We were lucky to get a room with a view of snow capped mountains in the distance. The hotel has a great outdoor swimming pool area. The hotel is in a great location easy walking distance to town centre, shops and restaurants. Breakfast was good with plenty of variety.

title: Great!!
review: Dear Guest, Thank you very much for choose Hotel Saray and share your opinion.  It is a pleasure to know that you have enjoy your stay, above breakfast buffet and room, our great pool and the location, just a few minutes walking to the city center. We hope to welcome you soon. Best Regards, EC - Customer Service

title: Comfortable pretty hotel
review: First time we have an hotel with pool in any of our Europe Tours.  And we enjoyed it! This don't look like a tour hotel. It looks decent, have a great bar and a great pool. Also near Granada downtown. Safe area and excellent service. Good prices and the room was great! I recommended.

title: Excellent and well located.
review: Dear guest, Thank you very much for choose Hotel Saray and share your opinion.  It is a pleasure to know that you have enjoy your stay, above breakfast buffet, our great pool and the location, just a few minutes walking to the city center. We hope to welcome you soon. Best Regards, EC - Customer Service

title: Almost Average
review: Lots of other reviews claim this hotel to be average. I would almost agree with them but for two things. Firstly, visiting in early June, I expected there to be a swimming pool, but it was closed during our stay. Secondly, I think for the price, you should expect above average, and there was nothing about our stay that made me think this hotel was good value. From the pretty stale breakfast, to the small bathroom and the slow reception service we were disappointed. Apart from the nice lifts and the decent location, nothing was anything more than average or poor.  I would not recommend this hotel.

title: Great service
review: First I would say that I give the hotel a -4, but still a four. When we arrived at the hotel we expected the pool to be opened but it wasent. The pool is opened from 15th of june - 15th of september, however the staff was serviceminded and we received a better room. The room (301) was very beautiful and no sound from the street, only from the room behind the bed when they pulled the wardrobe doors.   The bathroom was fresh but missed a lock on the door, a toilett brush, no bathrobe, no slippers and had a short showertube. The reason for the no bathrobe or slippers may be that the pool was closed.  There was a safety box in the room and a minibar (with expensive prices). I missed a water kettle and the possibility to make some coffee but you can buy high quality coffee in the bar…

title: Average Hotel
review: We were primarily in Granada to spend the day in the Alhambra. As this was completed, we checked into the Saray, which is a newer, modern appearing hotel. Of importance, staff were friendly and accommodating, the room adequate and the bed comfortable for a good sleep to return to travel in the morning. This hotel was generally what we expected from an average place. Compared to other places we stayed during our trip, we felt that the breakfast here was marginally adequate and our room view was of another building.  Consider your objectives when considering this and other hotels in the area.

title: Definitely worth a visit
review: Wonderfully decorated hotel with a beautiful swimming pool area. Unfortunately we only stayed one night during a group tour of Spain. As visiting The Alhambra was the real reason for staying in Granada, we did not get a chance to really enjoy the hotel. Our room was well equipped and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was very good. Would return to this hotel when next in Granada

title: Loved the location
review: Dear Richard, Thank you very much for choose Hotel Saray and share your opinion.  It is a pleasure to know that you have enjoy your stay, above breakfast buffet. We hope to welcome you soon. Best Regards, EC - Customer Service

title: Average
review: We had booked a junior suite and car parking for a weekend In Granada. Car parking is essential if you bring your car, it’s expensive but the city car parks are even worse. It’s a nice clean hotel kind of Moroccan typical Andalusian feel to it. The room was well equipped and a good size bathrooms well nice with everything you need apart from an iron. Ok that’s not a problem the hotel can send one up no they don’t they don’t have an iron in the hotel you have to put stuff into the hotel laundry and that takes hours. I felt really sorry for the wedding party that were running about trying to iron clothes I believe they bought one from a shop. Breakfast for buffet style good selection and average quality. The check in process seemed to take ages and I signed 4 different forms very…

title: reasonably priced class hotel
review: For about 90 Euros/night in double standard room, this hotel offers confortable rooms with a capsule coffe machine, a fair breakfast buffet, and beautiful furnishing in all common spaces, compromising confort and classical charme. Staff very friendly but more oriented to sell services than giving  sincere advices. Just out of the city center, yet located in a relatively beautiful area

title: short break away to see the Alhambara Palace
review: Delightful hotel, modern, clean, spacious. Delicious breakfasts. We were extremely disappointed to find that the swimming pool was closed until June 15th. We experienced temperatures of 28 degrees on our May visit and would have dearly liked a swim to cool off. We are both experienced swimmers and regularly swim. However, they did not let us swim.

title: Lovely hotel, helpful staff, good location
review: The staff are very helpful, food good and reasonably priced. City is within walking distance. Room a good size fior a city hotel.  Bathroom needs an update, clean and functional though.  Car park in underneath the hotel and very difficult to manoeuvre into parking spaces, and spaces need to be pre booked.

title: Beautiful hotel
review: Dear guest,  Thank you for share you experience at Hotel Saray. It is a pleasure to know that you have enjoyed your stay at our facilities, above the location and staff treatment.  We hope to welcome you soon in this wonderful city.  Best Regards,  EC - Customer Service

title: GREAT HOTEL
review: Stayed here for 3 nights in may it is a really nice hotel in a great position. it has a lovely pool area and rooms are clean and a good size. staff are nice and the food from the bar is very good.. Granada is a brilliant city to visit and when you go out in the evening you do not need to go for a meal as every bar you go in and order a drink you get a great bowl of tapas free.

title: Clean, good service, nice location
review: Dear guest,  Thank you for share you experience at Hotel Saray. It is a pleasure to know that you have enjoyed your stay at our facilities, above the location and staff treatment.  We hope to welcome you soon in this wonderful city.  Best Regards,  EC - Customer Service

title: excellent place to stay
review: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in April 2018. Nice location within walking distance of small coffee shops and tapas restaurants Incase you want to skip their buffet breakfast which I did. Parking on premises is available but at a price. Rooms are clean, beds are comfortable. Agents at guest checkin spoke English well, were knowledgeable about local sites, cafes, taxis, and prices and very helpful to us as tourists. Enjoyed my stay .

title: Disappointed
review: Dear guest, Thank you for share you experience at Hotel Saray.  It is a pleasure to know that you have enjoyed your stay at our facilities, above all the breakfast, location and staff treatment. We hope to welcome you soon. Best Regards, EC - Customer Service

title: Clean and quiet. Lovely breakfast buffet
review: We were very comfortable staying here.  The hotel has a very nice location with several really good restaurants within walking distance.  LOVED the external glass elevators!  The breakfast buffet was very nice.

title: Very pretty hotel - give it a 3.5
review: My wife and I were here on a tour.   Most beautiful hotel on this trip - entrance is a sight to behold, glass elevators so you can look out, and the lobby area had beautiful displays of art works.  The bad side:  I think most of the money was spent on the outside.  The twin beds are more like cots.  Room is adequate.  No hot water heater, and no electrical outlets near the bed, which would be nice when using the laptop and trying to charge it up, while watching TV. However, there was an iPhone for usage if we needed it, which we didn't need.  Nice touch! Next morning, after breakfast, there were 5 of us that took the elevator to the to 6th floor for our hotel room, ready to leave fairly soon.  The elevator stopped on the 5th floor, would not go any more; pressing alarm,…

title: Hotel Saray Granada
review: Staff very helpful and pleasant, hotel room modern and clean. Good facilities nice bar area to relax offering bar food which we found ok, we didn’t eat from the restaurant which offered a more extensive menu. The hotel is in a good location for walking into the main shopping and eating area. The hotel has car parking spaces but is limited so book one when booking the room.

title: Lovely Moorish Designer
review: Dear Guest, Thank you very much for choose Hotel Saray and share your opinion. It is a pleasure to know that you have enjoy your stay, above all the staff treatment and the bar area where you could relax. We hope to welcome you soon. Best Regards, PM - Customer Service

title: Lovely hotel in a lovely city
review: Good size room, clean and welcoming. Good staff and good service. WiFi available in the room. Good location in busy area . Easy to get to sites. Continental breakfast. Decor mimics  Moorish decoration.

title: Great stay
review: Dear Guest, Thank you very much for choose Hotel Saray and share your opinion. It is a pleasure to know that you have enjoy your stay, above all the staff treatment and the location, just a few minutes walking to the city center. We hope to welcome you soon. Best Regards, PM - Customer Service

title: Not a four star experience
review: The noise from the street is terrible. I’m hard of hearing but from my third floor room could hear so much traffic! The beds are like sleeping on a rock. Bathroom is not very clean. We could get a bellman to help bags. Not a happy camper.

title: Almost a 5* rating!!
review: This was my first visit to Granada and recommendations here tempted me to the Hotel Saray.  I flew in from London, arriving at the airport around 6pm.  There's a bus service that takes arriving passengers into the City.  It took about an hour, stopping several times on the way, but the bus does drop passengers about 100m from the Saray.  The bus stop is called Palacio de Congreso, a cultural location where I was attending a concert, and why I was in the city.  The hotel lobby is impressive and spacious.  Check-in was quickly and pleasantly handled by Rocio.    I was given room 014 on the ground floor.  It's a spacious room with a good size bathroom.  However, it was matters to do with the room that stopped me giving a 5* rating for this visit.    Firstly, the bedside reading…

title: Lovely stay
review: Modern clean room with coffee machine. Excellent service especially  Sonia at reception was very helpful, she gave us some very useful tips and advice.We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 night stay there. Good breakfast with lots of choice.

title: Will not choose again
review: Dear guest, Thank you for share you experience at Hotel Saray. It is a pleasure to know that you have enjoyed your stay at our facilities, above all the breakfast and staff treatment. We hope to welcome you soon. Best Regards, PM - Customer Service

title: Very recomendable
review: The check in gave a feeling of how it was many years ago. No feeling of welcoming just an interruption in their job at the desk. But it’s because the mess during breakfast we can’t recommend this hotel. Most tables was full with half eaten plates. They no not take the dishes so sitting with this around you lose your appetite.

title: Nice value.
review: The hotel is located at a 10 minute drive to The Alhambra or to the Sacromonte. The facilities and furniture are a bit outdated however rooms are clean. Friendly staff. Average breakfast and dinner was good. There is a small supermarket at a five minute walk from the hotel.

title: Surprisingly Good
review: Came here on a Globus tour of Spain and wow were we surprised at what we found. First off the hotel has a pool!! And considering the fact is 90 degrees Fahrenheit at 8pm its a welcomed addition. Hotel bar is on point and the food was surprisingly good. AC was on blast from the minute we opened the door and we appreciated it. Would be the only place id stay if we came back to spain.

title: Really nice hotel, fun pool, friendly staff
review: Really nice hotel, clean rooms, the decor is 70's style but it's nice! Nice big bed, really nice pool and outside bar area. Nice bathrooms, great location. Would definitely stay here again! The desk staff were very helpful and friendly.

title: Not a 4 Star Hotel !!
review: We spend 2 night at this hotel and booked family room. This is just a 3 Star Hotel, no coffee or tea in the room. Breakfast is just ok. Nothing much to eat for vegetarian. However,Staff is really friendly and helpful. Alhambra Palace is 15 mints by Car .

title: Lovely hotel
review: Pretty average hotel, very kind staff that helped accommodate us with our Expedia reservation issue. We dealt with Pepe and Rocia and they were both very wonderful to work with! Def recommend this hotel for a nice, comfortable stay!

title: Good value for the money
review: Ok, the room was a little bit old style and could need some refurbishing. But at the end of the day we were only sleeping there one night. For our little visit the hotel was just fine. everyone we met during our stay were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was not bad at all. The outdoor pool area looked amazing, and must be fantastic during summer season. We saw the beautiful snow covered  mountains in Sierra Nevada from our room. Nice!

title: Save your money
review: We stayed here for 3 nights during our Granada visit. First, if you are put on the 7th floor where our room was located, cancel you booking or request a room change. Rooms on this floor looked like college dorms with terrible furniture and decor. The bathrooms were not usable and the bedding felt stiff and old, and the carpet was probably from the 1970s.  Calling front desk from the room was a joke, no-one ever picks up and you end up going down.  For over 200 euros per night, I regret wasting my money. Would have been better off in a hostel for that quality.  Never again.

title: Comfortable and Convenient
review: We stayed her in October. Lovely hotel. Nice room. Efficient lifts! Lots of space and nice decor. Friendly helpful staff. Easy walking distance to central Granada. Car parking on site. Swimming pool was still open and wonderful to enjoy the loungers during a particularly hot October but the pool was cold. Very good value for the price.

title: Saray hotel, Granada
review: Fantastic place: high quality building, clean nice large room. Breakfast was the best of any I had in a hotel. It all looks very upscale. Conveniently close to downtown. More remarkable - it is remarkably cheap. Highly recommended.

title: Great Hotel
review: The ambience of this hotel was great.  We had just finished the tour of Alhambra and when you entered this hotel, you could see that they had tried to bring some of the features of Alhambra Palace to this hotel.  loved the entrance and the pool

title: Stay review
review: I stayed at the Saray hotel for 3 days in October. My room was spacious,  clean and newly remodeled as advertized. I stayed on the third floor. All the staff was very friendly. The breakfast was delicious and had a very nice variety,  The only issue I had was not receiving a wake up call on the day I requested, and then receiving a call on the following day without requesting it, but at a different time.

title: About average for Spain nothing amazing
review: Bottom tier rooms are average. No coffee in room. Beds are average. No real complaints.  Things to do are a 10 minute walk which is good Lots of food choices. Upper tier rooms are very much nicer. Overall hard to go wrong.

title: Saray October 2017
review: We stayed three nights. One problem after another. The safe did not work and had to be repaired. The Matresses on the beds were very hard and uncumfortable. My wife had back ache in the morning and then discovered that a spring was sticking up. We reported this and they offered to move us on the last night, but we had turned the matress and did want to repack and move. On checking out we reminded the man on reception about the matress. He shrugged his shoulders and we got the impression that the matrees would be on the bed for many more customers. They had three lifts. The first day two working, the second day one working and the third two working. The breakfast was not that great and generally the hotel was not good. Add to this the extortionate parking. Then would not…

title: Nearly but not quite
review: This is a well situated hotel within walking distance of central Granada. It is well maintained and the rooms are large, clean and well furnished. Breakfast was extensive and was well replenished by the restaurant staff, who were friendly helpful and efficient, as were the housekeeping staff. The only criticism is of the reception staff who were surly and unable or unwilling to assist with our enquiries regarding National day, which was during our visit.

title: Painfully slow lifts
review: So they have 3 lifts, of which one was out of use. The other two weren't very useful though. They close the doors the second you select your floor, leaving other people waiting to get in the lift getting squashed. On going up, if more than one floor is selected, then once the first selected floor is reached, all other floor selections are lost?! The lights go off for the other selected floors, and I tried once not re-selecting my floor and sure enough, the lift went back down.  There were 2 buttons between 3 lifts, so maybe the broken life shared one button with another lift. However this means to get a lift you need to press both buttons to maximise your success. Except once you get a lift, then other lift will eventually stop, with nobody to get in. Repeat on several floors…

title: An unexpected oasis in Granada
review: Extremely good value (off season). Spacious hotel room with great comfort. AC worked well. Superb pool area except for the sparse availability of sun beds. A 5-10 minutes peasant walk to the city center. Professional staff. Typical firm Spanish beds.

title: Elevators are a serious problem
review: While the hotel is all right the poor elevators make this a bad choice if you are caught in a group or many people are queuing for it. An alternative if you are above the fourth floor is to use the elevator which provides access to the pool as less people know about it. This is an older hotel which needs some updating. I would not recommend this to my friends.

title: Beautiful, but in dire need of some maintenance
review: Room was big and nicely furnished. But as soon as I got in the room, there was a really loud hum from the breaker panel just inside of the door. Asked the host at the reception to come have a listen, and he sent for their maintenance person. They did offer me a room change, but I really just wanted to go to sleep, and they only had rooms on the first floor available to move in to, close to the street. The noise did get a bit less with all the lights off, and they did promise to fix it the next day, but no further improvement happened. So for the remaining nights, I ended up flipping fuses myself at bedtime. In retrospect I should have done the room change, as the other issue with this hotel is their elevators. One hardly ever moves and turns out to only react to the inside floor…

title: Great first impressions
review: Entering the foyer into the cool, spacious, tiled and wooden lobby was most welcoming after the heat of the day. The typical Andalusian style quite made a first impression. The glass elevators whisked us to our room which was very spacious and complete with wardrobe, laptop safe and fridge. Four pillows to choose from was a treat, and the King bed was firm but supportive. Bathroom shower over a full bath may/may not suit all customers. The outdoor pool looked very attractive and inviting. However, it proved to be rather too cold and our restricted time meant we could not use it anyway. The corridors looked well used with (bag?)scrape marks along the walls, certainly needing attention.  Breakfast could only be described as adequate and visually lacking in appeal which was a…

title: Nice. Location
review: Simple but good hotel.The elevator is old so not very comfortable. Nice location and easy to drive to the location.Breakfast qouite good.The hotel was exactly for our purpose. I will recommend to my friends.

title: Good hotel for Granada
review: Ideal hotel that's 15 min walk to the center of Granada. In a quiet location with a great pool area. We were lucky as it was very hot and we relaxed by the pool in the afternoon after doing the sights. Reception area was impressive and bedroom on the 4th floor was very spacious. Would return and recommend. Reception staff very friendly. Only minor negatives were the corridors looked dated and had to wait ages for lifts as the 3 were never all working.

title: Clean, spa ious rooms,  helpful staff
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for choose Hotel Saray for your stay at Granada. It is a great pleasure to know that you have enjoy at our facilities, above all the great location to the city center. We hope to welcome you soon. Best Regards, Patricia Moya (Customer Service)

title: Do not accept a room above the 5th floor and forget the breakfast
review: Front desk staff always available to help out wih local directions.   Hotel within walking distance of many attractions.   Leave car in parking garage if you have one.  We explored buses & taxis.......GREAT CITY.   Weather was great we got to enjoy outdoor pool too.

title: Great hotel for Granada
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for choose Hotel Saray for your stay at this beautiful city. It is a great pleasure to know that you have enjoy at our facilities, above all the staff treatment. We hope to welcome you soon. Best Regards, Patricia Moya (Customer Service)

title: Large central hotel
review: We arrived with a 3 night booking and were put in a room on the 7th floor. The room was like taking a trip back to the 80s! We doubled checked the website and realized that the pictures we definitely not the same as the reality. We then went down to reception to request a different room that we were denied as the hotel was fully booked. They could upgrade us to a mini suite but we would have to pay the difference! In the end we stayed in 80s room for one night and we had a different room the next day. The 80s rooms are on the 6th and 7th floor.  In the morning we decided to go for the buffet breakfast. I ended up having one piece of toast and butter. All the food was really bad quality, the only fresh fruit was watermelon and pineapple that wasn't ripe. The scrambled eggs didn't…

title: Nice Hotel. Good Location
review: The Saray is a very pleasant hotel within an easy 15 minutes walk of the city centre.  Nice, clean, spacious room and friendly, helpful staff.  We didn't eat there so cannot comment on the food though the prices of everything seemed OK.  One of the reasons we chose it was for its pool.  The pool area was nice and there were plenty of sunbeds but (and here is the only adverse comment) the water was freezing which was surprising since we were there in September when it  should have been at its warmest..  All-in-all I would highly recommend the Saray.

title: Good Choice
review: Dear Guest, Thank you very much for choose Hotel Saray for your stay at Granada. It is a pleasure to know that you have enjoyed your stay, especially the pool area and the staff treatment.  We hope to welcome you soon at our facilities. Best Regards, Patricia Moya (Customer Service)

title: Long weekend in granada
review: We enjoyed our stay here.  Hotel staff very helpful & informative.  Room was a good size, comfortable bed & updated shower.  We loved the 15 minute walk over to the Cathedral area which is much more crowded w/tourists.  Nice to come back from sightseeing & relax by the pool.  Yes, in August pool was crowded, but hang out & some chairs become available.  Snack bar right by pool makes it convenient.  We drove to Granada & were able to pre-pay for their underground parking facility. Would definitely stay here upon a return to Granada.

title: Great Hotel all round, but check your bill on departure
review: The hotels web site tells you check in is from 14.00. We arrived at 12.00 and thought we would drop off bags and go for lunch, the gentlemen on reception asked for a moment and spoke to someone on the phone and surprised us by telling us our room was ready and we could check in there and then brilliant ! The room was on the top floor but there are numerous elevators, the room was clean spacious, the bed was comfortable, bathroom and shower were on par with some of the best hotels I have stayed in. Staff were very friendly and approachable, all in al a great stay. I can't comment on the restaurant we ate out every night .

title: Delighted by this hotel
review: Great Hotel, about a 15 minute walk into downtown Granada. It is in a nice part of town and there are some nice places to eat and drink nearby. The staff all round where great, the rooms comfortable and clean and the breakfast was excellent. The only thing that spoilt the 3 nights we spent there was on checkout when I got the bill. I had prepaid the accommodation, breakfast and parking so that was paid for. On top of that was the bar bill which also was no problem. What I did notice though was that the way the bill was set out that they double charge you tax again on the room per night. This has already been paid originally and it is shown quite clearly. It took 20 minutes with the girl on reception until she realised what I was trying to say and apologised and immediately…

title: Bad! Very bad!!!
review: We spend the weekend in Granada and we called directly to the hotel to book the room. We specifically told the to give us a room away from family and kids bc they used to wake up earlier and of course make a lot of noises. Well the did what they wanted and of course the kids were not well behaved and bothered us. It's not bc they didn't had more rooms available, bc the hotel was not full. Also the service and the people who worked there were no nice. I was before in this hotel years ago and it was ok that was the reason we went back but for sure I don't recommend. I will never go back and I use to go to Granada a lot.  Never again!

title: Oldest room on the first floor
review: It looked like the renovation had taken place over the whole first floor except for room 114! This is the room we've stayed in for 2 nights. Service was good. Breakfast was good with lots to choose grom

title: Great hotel bear town centre - lovely pool
review: We booked this last minute and so were not sure what to expect  Is situated quite centrally but in a quiet residential district There is a Moroccan feel to the architecture which gives it a feel which is authentic to the area The rooms are nice and the pool area is great. As per the other reviews, there does seem to be a shortage of sun loungers but we always managed to get one quite quickly . Drinks on the poolside were very reasonable which is an added bonus We only had the breakfast on one day which was ok but nothing great and didn't try any of the other food options  Was reasonably priced and I think it did have the feel of a 4 star hotel and so was very good value

title: Fantastic value
review: The saray offers really good value. The rooms are basic but clean and offer standard amenities (tv, fridge, desk) and there is a great pool with a bar and restaurant. About $70 per room. It looks far from the city center but you can walk there in about 30 min or take a cab for 5 euros. Alhambra 7 euros. Lots of good restaurants nearby too. One drawback - no services next to the road for luggage or cabs.

title: Satay August 17
review: Not really 4 star. Decent location (15 mins from the centre). Pool good but can get crowded so don't rely on getting a space at siesta. The rooms are good but not 4 star. We had to move as there had been a smoker in (Not allowed).

title: Fine hotel
review: Hotel Saray is a fine hotel. It is nothing fancy but then again, the prices are low! We stayed in a junior suite (supp of €30 at the desk) and we had a spacious room and spacious bathroom! The pool is nice but more sunbeds are needed and table service would be nice with a menu that offers some good snacks.   All and all we enjoyed our stay!

title: Ok for the price
review: Nice, clean hotel with good size rooms. Bar and Night staff are very friendly. The pool area is very busy and even though there are rules signposted, they arent followed or controlled by the staff. We saw people wearing normal clothes jumping in and out of the pool from the 'bridge'. There is no lifeguard and even whitnessed a todler nearly drown and have to be saved by another swimmer who happened to see. The baby had sunk to the bottom of the pool and I bet the staff havent got a clue that it happened. So not very relaxing. Also some minor issues in comparison such as very squeeky door handles on the bathroom doors which is annoying at night. Also we could very clearly hear if the room above or next to us flushed the toilets. « Show less

title: Good Hotel
review: This hotel is apparently dedicated to people coming to the congress next door or to groups.  The location of the hotel seems a little of but actually is is not off, because you can walk to almost anywhere except Alhambra that is a little bit far.  But restaurants supermarkets and few touristic places are in between 5 to 12 minutes walk.  The personal is very nice and will do effort to help you.  The breakfast buffet is good and carries some Spanish specialties such as churros and cheeses and chorizo.the room are comfortable even though the A/C is not the most efficient.  I like the fact that the room had a Nespresso compatible coffee machine.  It was a junior suite and I do not know if available in all rooms.  It is very pleasant to have your coffee the way you want whenever you…

title: Anna
review: Perfect hotel for us. Yes large but caters for conference centre next door. Huge rooms, comfy beds, v good air conditioning. Best bit is pool not busy even in August. Just bliss after the heat of the city. Easy to walk in but also v reasonable cab rank really close as sometimes just too hot to walk in and back. 100 per cent recommend for easy place to stay and pool is an oasis away from 42degree heat currently in the City !!

title: Granada Trip
review: A little disappointed that there was no reply to my email prior to my trip about organising tickets for the Alhambra, which we missed out on.  Hotel lovely and clean. Pool area great for relaxing after a trip around the city.

title: Good value, nice pool area but thin walls
review: Good hotel, nicely decorated. The swimming pool is pretty, deep in the main part. Rooms are ok, but in our room (4th floor) we heard other guests nearby... Location is not exactly in the city center, but not far (5-10min walk).

title: Nice modern hotel with moorish style decoration
review: This hotel is is centrally located with high standard rooms and a lovely garden and pool area.  We had room only, but did pay for breakfast on two out of the four day stay. It was a bit pricey, but the range of food available in the buffet breakfast was huge and you didn't need lunch.  The reception staff were helpful. Very good hotel for a city break in Granada.

title: Vacayy
review: Their service was great. The night shift are very welcoming whilst the morning shift just aren't as friendly; they just want their job to be done. Very great atmosphere from the gym and the pool however, the hotel has no locks. You read it right. Once you enter your room, their is no lock to secure yourself neither there is a lock in the toilet. Weird, I know.

title: Nice hotel
review: Nice hotel and centrally located to shops and restaurants.  The pooled looked "inviting" but we didn't have time to enjoy it.  The staff was friendly and helpful. Our breakfast was good and they offered a good variety.

title: Food spot to stop
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for share you commet about your experience at Hotel Saray. It is a pleasure to know that you have enjoyed your stay at our facilities, above all the location of the Hotel and the buffet breakfast. We hope to welcome you soon. Best Regards, Patricia Moya (Customer Service)

title: Nice rooms. Horrible breakfast
review: Stayed here with Globus   It has a beautiful exterior and lobby that pays compliments to the Moorish history of Granada. The rooms are comfortable and reception staff friendly.  The hotel has a refreshing pool and is located a few minutes walk from the main shopping streets of Granada. There is also a supermarket about 5 minutes walk.  The breakfast was unfortunately very lacklusture. All the hot food was cold and the coffee machines only served half a mug. Which in the end ended up being enough because the coffee itself was horrible.

title: Fine hotel in a good location
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for share you commet about your experience at Hotel Saray. It is a pleasure to know that you have enjoyed your stay at our facilities, above all the Moorish decoration and the staff treatment. We regret that you did not enjoy the buffet breakfast, we work every day in the composition of it, but we take note about it.  We hope to welcome you at your next visit at Granada.  Best Regards, Patricia Moya (Customer Service)

title: Great stay and location
review: We stayed here as part of a Globus trip and found it to be a fine hotel, with a variety of restaurants nearby, plus a city bus stop nearby. The room was clean and spacious, but the bed, like many in Europe, was made by pushing two twin beds together - not ideal when you are used to sleeping by cuddling with your partner. The breakfast buffet was very good with lots of fruits, breads, cheese and meat selections.

title: Good city based hotel
review: Dear Guest, Thank you so much for share with us your experience at Hotel Saray. It is a pleasure to know that you enjoy your stay at our facilities, above all the location and the comfortable rooms.  We hope to welcome you soon.  Best Regards, Patricia Moya (Customer Service)

title: LOCATED IN A QUIET AREA
review: The hotel is located in a very convenient location for either tourist or local dining, the rooms are nice, big, clean and very comfortable.  We also enjoyed the pool.  If parking in the garage, it is very tight, designed for small cars, but we did manage with our larger car.

title: Saray Hotel Cordoba
review: Very good 4 star rating hotel, atmosphere and Moorish style décor. Friendly and Helpful staff, good location for easy walk to city centre, stayed  4 nights in comfortable 4 star quality rooms . Car Parking in basement at additional cost.

title: Lack of gym which was the reason we booked
review: Good location - we were able to walk into town, and to the alhambra.  One gripe was that the booking.com website suggests there is a working gym which was the reason we booked it.  When we arrived the staff told us there was no gym.  By the time they worked out there was a functional gym but they hadn't been told it was too late for us to use it.  Swimming pool was good.  Room was clean and comfortable.  They discounted the parking fees due to the gym mixup.

title: Great value
review: This was a great value hotel for visiting Granada and The price even included parking and breakfast. The staff greeted us warmly and were very helpful with directions. We would definitely stay here again.

title: This is a great hotel
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for your great comments about Saray Hotel.We are happy to know you enjoy your stay with us, above all the pleasant treatment from staff. We would love to welcome you back in your next visit to Granada. Best Regards,  Patricia Moya (Customer Service)

title: Great hotel
review: We stayed for 3 nights in two rooms. Rooms were just like on the pictures, clean, neat, nice. The beds are comfortable we slept like babies.  The breakfast is average I would say, nothing extraordinary, we ate good.  Friendly and helpful staff. We really liked our stay here.  Free wifi is good and fast.

title: Very nice hotel
review: We enjoyed our stay here  It was located near the Palacio Congresso where my husband was attending a conference, so it was perfect for us, but it would have been great even if we had not been attending a conference.  The city center was within easy walking distance, or  the LAC bus which goes directly there was just around the corner.  The service was very good and friendly, and the pool area was lovely. They also furnished an excellent buffet breakfast with a good variety which was included in the cost of our room.

title: Great Hotel
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for take a few minutes of your time to share your experience at Hotel Saray. It is a pleasure to know that you have enjoy your stay at our facilities and you have relaxed at our swimming pool area.  We hope to welcome you soon!  Best Regards, Patricia Moya (Customer Service)

title: Walls thin. Clean
review: Had a great 4 night stay at Sarah Hotel, whilst visiting Granada.  The room had everything we required, great breakfast, service from staff was good, and even looked after our cases after checkout as we had a late flight, they were unable to extend our room until the end of the day as they were full.  Would recommend this Hotel if you like walking to the city centre which is about 25 mins away, which we felt was a plus.

title: Good choice
review: Medium sized room and bathroom. Clean. The bed is fairly hard which seems to be typical of Spain. Walls thin because I could hear snoring in the next room. Not nearly enough electrical outlets. Fast and free wifi. In walking distance of downtown old Granada which was nice. Large safe. Large bathtowels. Smallish window in our room which overlooked other buildings. Breakfast was not good, eggs were cold and the bacon was hardly cooked at all. They did have hot chocolate, though.

title: Location and staff
review: In quiet zone not far from city center -less than 10 minutes of relaxing walking- Near bus and taxi stop. Kind service, good food and really hight clean level: in rooms and in common zones. Good service level in a modern arabic athmosfere. We will repeat our choice in our Granada next visit.

title: Great services
review: Very welcoming and good service (Thanks Pepe at the front desk), great room and bathroom (bathtub), pool area, breakfast. We had a good deal for 117€ a night, for a 4 star. Very close to Airport bus shuttle (2,9€) and accessible to downtown main places to see

title: Ok stay, Performing under its true potential
review: Dear Guest, Thank you very much for your great score. We are very pleased to know you have such a good experience in our hotel and town. It would love to welcome you back! Best Regards, Laura Fernandez. Customer Service

title: Solid Hotel... Not great though.
review: Ok stay, the team at Saray in Granada could really make more of this hotel. Everyone was friendly but no one really seemed to enjoy doing what they do and that's really too bad. Performing under its true potential for a hotel with good infrastructure, nicely designed to fit into Granada and litterally around the corner of the Granada Convention Centre. Had a terrific lunch dish (suckling pig w/ grilled vegetables) in an otherwise deserted restaurant for lunch.

title: Our Stay for 2 days - Dec 2016
review: This was part of our 21 day tour of spain, Portugal, and Morocco.  It was our 3rd last night of the trip, so we'd experienced some great hotels at that point.  There wasn't anything wrong with this hotel.  Solid design, good staff, and great amenities... The pool area is very nice actually.  However the location wasn't the best.  Maybe a 10 minute taxi ride to the city centre, and there are so many sights to see in Granada, and this hotel isn't really walking distance from any of them.  My only other concern was the the room decor was pretty dated.  I mean they were clean, and sizeable, but needed some updating to justify this as a luxury hotel.  All in all, not a bad place to stay, but I'm sure there are better options.  Location is the number 1 drawback here!

title: All you get is a room
review: We stayed at this hotel as part of our 10 day trip to Spain and Portugal. We arrived in Granada by bus at the train station. There is no direct train from Madrid due to track construction work. Hotel is only a 7 euro cab ride from the station. Even though the hotel is not in proper downtown, it is only a 10 minute walk to the main square. Cabs are cheap and easy to find from the hotel. Granada is a small town compared to Madrid.     Check in was easy and the front desk staff were very helpful. They got us a cab at 6 AM in the morning within 3 minutes.    The room and bed were comfortable. Hotel has a restaurant and we didn't eat there. There are many choices in the surrounding area.      We took a cab for 8 euros to Alhambra. It took about 10 minutes to get there in the morning.…

title: Great hotel, great location
review: Excellent stay here within walking distance (20 minutes) of the centre of Granada and the Cathedral.  There is a bus stop within about 5 minutes to take you to the centre too.  Huge rooms, great facilities, friendly staff and very clean hotel and rooms.  Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking to visit Granada and not use the car!  Our deal included the parking and breakfast and the car never moved from the garage in the three days we were there.  Public transport is reliable and safe.  We got a Granada card that includes admission to the Alhambra and 9 bus rides.  Worked very well.  Breakfast in the hotel was a huge selection, almost American style in the size of it.  Some of the hot food did get a little cool on the buffet and we did ask that it was…

title: One of the best places I've been in
review: The room was very clean and the smell was refreshing, I like the interior design also , and the staff was friendly too , I think in future if I plan to visit granada again I'll stay in this hotel , thank you

title: Saray - Excellent value for money
review: We wanted somewhere to rest our heads whilst in Granada to see the Alhambra and was delighted to find this Granada city centre hotel with all its amenities at such a reasonable rate. Lovely spotless room, marvellous breakfast choices - only gripe was no tea / coffee making facilities in room. Close to A44 and with plenty of parking available in its own underground car park.

title: Very average experience in a beautiful city
review: Hotel itself is situated in a beautiful part of town, just minutes from the river and some nice parks to take a stroll in. There is a Mercado Mas just a few blocks away to get some essentials if needed.   Rooms are pretty standard and average. No huge complaints, but nothing stands out.   The terrible part about this was the food at this hotel. I know it doesn't make or break the stay, but this was borderline dangerous. We came here with Insight Tours, the dinner was pretty bad. At one point the banquet captain put out a tray of breaded chicken. A hungry crowd swarmed the dish at the buffet. I got a piece toward the end, one cut and you could see it was raw. My mother had a piece that was raw. Being hungry I went back to see if it was just those two pieces, nope! All raw. The…

title: Great Choice
review: Excellent first impressions!  Reception/Lobby beautifully appointed, staff professional and polite. We were located a spacious and well equipped room on the 3rd floor,  which came with quiet and efficient air con (much appreciated), fridge, large TV, safety deposit box, comfortable bed linen although the bed itself was extremely hard. Bright bathroom, excellent shower lots of thoughtful little touches. The whole of the hotel was spotless throughout. We booked breakfast which consisted of a variety of hot and cold dishes, cereals, usual pastries.  Only criticism was the scrambled eggs, which unfortunately, were always cold. The bar area was spacious and comfortable, bar staff were efficient / professional. Outside – lovely pool surrounded by a few fountains and a variety of…

title: Great Location
review: This hotel is in walking distance of the main part of town. Our room was not ready and the staff went out of their way to secure our luggage. The front desk staff avoided us when we returned and it was difficult to get them to communicate although their English was very good. Our room was very modern but had no atmosphere and was very blandly decorated. The beds were not very comfortable.  The breakfast was below average and not very well displayed.

title: Very atmospheric
review: The Saray Hotel is very unique. Great decor, modern room decor but the lobby is shades of Alhambra ! Within walking distance of the city restaurants and department stores. Free wifi, minibar and glass elevators.

title: Nice hotel, pleasant service, food ok but not great
review: Dear Guest, Thank you very much for your great comments about our hotel.We are very happy to know you enjoy you stay with us and we would love to welcome you back.  Best Regards,  Laura Fernandez

title: Average Hotel which could use some updating in rooms
review: This was a pleasant, friendly hotel.  We had both a group dinner and breakfast as part of our stay with Insight Vacations.  The food was ok, not very good or excellent.  There is a small pool and deck area that we did not use.  The room was nice, and the people at the front desk were friendly.  I would call this a good-average hotel.

title: How is this a 4 star hotel?
review: The pool area was okay, but definitely not as beautiful as showcased by the photos, but more disappointing was the room.  It could have used some updating as our bed was slanted, the furniture had marks and the floor was dirty.  On the plus side, it was an easy walk to the city center and in a quiet area.  At the end of the long day, the lobby bar was open for a night cap.  The staff didn't say a word to us, however, and we had to ask for a bill.

title: Nice place, not elegant, but nice and easy.
review: We stayed here for three nights while touring Granada, it was clean, it was well run, the pool was not as large as we thought, but again clean, and a nice respite after walking all over Granada.  The staff was helpful, the breakfast buffet was very complete, and over all easy to get places once you figured it out.  It was a bit off the beaten track, but, not really, it was just getting your bearings.  I would definitely stay again.

title: Nice hotel...
review: Dear Guest, Thank you very much for choosing our hotel for your stay in Granada and for dedicating some minutes to share your experience. We are very please to know you would stay again with us. We would love to welcome back in our hotel.  Best Regards,  Laura Fernandez

title: Exactly as billed
review: This hotel is very central...we walked everywhere in Granada from here.  Clean, decent sized room, nice staff.  Disappointed with the swimming pool...more of a plunge than a swimming pool.    Otherwise very decent place

title: Great hotel
review: A convenient, comfortable hotel on the edge of the old town in Granada. Good size rooms, good service. Lots of tour groups use it so you need to avoid peak times. We found that the breakfast menu is actually good value compared to some of the cafes in the old town.

title: Great facilities, good size rooms at great location
review: Dear Gino,  Thank you very much for your nice comments about our value and hotel location, confort, service and breakfast. We would love to welcome you back in our hotel. Best Regards, Laura Fernandez

title: Good hotel in great location let down by its staff.
review: Good clean hotel in great location. Bed was single and a bit hard. Some one had been smoking in the room and the room smelt. Fortunately I was able to open a window to air the room out.   Staff were not very attentive and were masters of ignoring customers at the bar.  Breakfast was quite disappointing and the quality was not that high.  It did have a small pool that was not heated and quite cold for early September.  If look elsewhere in Granada.

title: My wife's supprise birthday weekend
review: Exellent service, rooms were clean and the beds were very spacious, I didn't book the breakfast, but had a coffee downstairs in the buffet area. The food on display looked very well presented, and there was a large selelection to choose from, both English and continental. The staff were very welcoming, as we arrive early and allowed us acces to our rooms at 10 30 am. I would recommend this place to anyone who is travelling to Granada.Would book again but would stay longer and have the breakfast for only 11 euro's.

title: Perfect Location
review: Had a wonderful time at this hotel. Absolutely ideal location around 10 minutes or less to walk into the heart of Granada and maybe 45 minutes or so to the Alhambra. Also literally right next to a main bus hub (not a station but many buses leave from here, including to and from the airport for 2.90 Euros). The hotel staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, putting up with a constant barrage of questions and requests and dealing with every question with patience and good humour. Also, bonus points awarded for taking the time to converse with me in Spanish even though all of the staff spoke excellent English and my Spanish isn't particularly good. There was a mix up with the room (my fault) which they were able to resolve after the first night with minimal fuss, even offering…

title: Excellent HOTEL
