review: Great hotel and Great staff, everything was very good during my 6 nights stay.  The swimming pool is just amazing, it is definitely a place to go if you choose the hotel.  Breakfast is very good, all sort of food and very big buffet  Rooms are very clean and nice  All is very good

title: Good stay
review: Saray hotel has an excellent location. Close enough to the city to benefit from the restaurants and places to visit and yet not close enough to experience issues regarding noise or otherwise.   It is a calm hotel with friendly staff.   Pool is big enough, considering you are not in Granada to only swim. However, there are clearly not enough relaxation beds.   Breakfast is good but simple. Coffee and tea could be better and I would hope the hotel will spend some money to improve on that particular experience.   All in all, a good hotel.

title: A Comfortable Base in Granada
review: Generally a choice of hotel is made balancing a number of factors, for example location, cost, facilities and parking. The case of the Saray Hotel in Granada was no different. The hotel is of medium size and offered, importantly for us, a pool, a good bed and breakfast rate and a location within walking distance of the centre of the city, for us that is about ten to fifteen minutes.  The Alhambra was a little further away. The hotel did say that there was a bus that leaves nearby which would have got us there but, as we found in Seville, a taxi between four of us did not break the bank in getting us to the Alhambra for our, relatively, early start.  We used the hotel parking which was booked along with the room. The rate is 16.65 Euros per day. The car park is underground and is…

title: Good and luxurious
review: It has been a really nice stay, I thought that for being a 4 star hotel, would be worse, but the rooms are amazing, the same with the bathroom, the room service is preety good and leaves everything nice and clean. If I had to say something bad, I would point to the fact that the pool may be too small fot a hotel this size, and it is usually crowded. In general, our stay was amazing.

title: An efficient and welcoming staff for this hotel perfectly located.
review: A four stars hotel not very modern but tidy, with an helpfull and efficient staff members. Perfectly located to visit the city. Parking is available upon request. A small pool will allow you to rest after long days of visits. We hard a great time!

title: Luxurious!
review: Our family of 5 stayed here in May 2015. The grounds are immaculate and gorgeous to look at, and we enjoyed seeing the fountains and the pool. The lobby is grand and speaks of luxury, and the rooms are spacious and contemporary in style. The beds are comfortable, and the bathroom and shower area are very modern and luxurious, too. The staff was very helpful and friendly. This hotel is also within walking distance of a lot of what Granada has to offer. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

title: Not bad but also not as good as expected
review: The connected family room of Hotel Saray comprises of two rooms and was convenient for travelling as a family. The room itself is quite dark due to limited daylight. Size, bathroom and bed are ok. The reception and breakfast areas lack ambiance. We had inquired by mail a couple of days before arrival into trips to Alhambra without receiving any response from the hotel. English language skills at reception were quite limited so this may explain the non-responsiveness. Upon arrival all organized trips were full but we ultimately managed to get tickets by going to Alhambra ticket office at 7.30 AM and fortunately we got ourselves tickets. Hotel was okay for two nights but not more than that. The benefit of the location is that it is reachable by car without ending up in smaller…

title: OK Hotel at OK price
review: We stayed here for 2 nights and chose it because of the price and the fact it had a pool, although in the end we didn't use the pool.  Room was good and kept clean.  It was a good walk in to the main town area but we enjoyed the walk - we took a taxi to Alhambra because it was definitely too far to walk.  Staff on reception were very helpful but we found the car parking a little confusing, infact my husband took ages when he first dropped me off with the bags in trying to find the lift back to the main hotel.  The main negative about this hotel is the breakfast room or breakfast dungeon as it should be called.  It had no natural light and wasn't inviting or a nice place to eat at all.  Breakfast itself wasn't the best we had on this trip and I was glad it had come as part of a…

title: Ticked all the boxes
review: Booked relatively late - about 2 to 3 weeks before our stay. We chose this hotel for a stay in Granada as it was the most central hotel with air con and a pool we could find.   Requested nonsmoking room but it clearly smelled of smoke, hotel confirmed it was meant to be nonsmoking but gave us a new room with no fuss.   Easy,cheap and regular buses into the centre, would recommend getting the top up card to save even more.   Pool was a God send in the heat, gets busy in the afternoons though so not always guaranteed a sun lounger but nice to cool off after morning sightseeing. Had a lazy pool day on Sunday otherwise city noise makes it less relaxing but to be expected from a city hotel.  Had breakfast a couple of occasions, lots of choice, nice and fresh though for €11 each we…

title: Lovely staff, clean & spacious room
review: Room was cleaned everyday and cleaners always came back if you were in at the time, which was great. The room itself was very big and modern. Staff were always friendly and very helpful. There was always plenty of parking space in the hotel's secure parking. It was about a 10 minute walk to the centre of town, which for us wasn't an issue. It's a very simple route in to town. The area itself seemed very safe and we didn't have any problems walking back past midnight. There was also a couple of nice places to eat/drink around the hotel so you have both options. We didn't try the food at the hotel, but it looked ok.

title: Hotel Saray
review: Beautiful Hotel, amazing pool and decor.  One of the best hotels on this trip.  The Breakfast bar was amazing with all types of good.  The rooms are a good size, very clean.  The bathroom is great equipped with a bidet.

title: Good rooms, very poor breakfast. Better for business than holiday
review: If you're on business, this will be a good hotel with very nice spacious and modern rooms. If you want to enjoy the holiday spirit, look elsewhere. The pool are is OK, considering the location, but nothing special. Service is tailored to efficiency and masses of tourist, not to personal smiles. The main problem is what we call the "Breakfast Bunker". In the basement, without windows, with a low ceiling and totally packed with noisy tourists and crying kids. The noise is terrible. The stress, both with the visitors as with the staff is terrible. The coffee from the full-automatic machines is terrible.

title: Unforgettable experience
review: One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in and great value for money too! Amazing buffet breakfast that catered for all tastes, lovely pool area and delicious cocktails, spacious and well-equipped rooms! Would definitely stay there again.

title: Fantastic pool area
review: This hotel looks very grand and we particularly loved the decor and pool area. The rooms were spacious and had all needed for our 2 night stay. The location is hard to find if using public transport but after getting familiar with our location we found it very convenient and a pleasant walk across the bridge to the city area. The staff were very helpful.

title: Wahou!
review: Excellent customer service. Hotel very nice, clean and lovely. I definetly recommand ! Its perfect to go there with friends or his/her love.  The gardens are also perfect so as the swimming pool.  High quality!  Its really well situated so you can discover the city really easily.

title: Bad to slightly above average, but has it's advantages
review: If you were looking to book this hotel because you are Expedia or Orbitz VIP, don't bother.  I booked on Orbitz being one of their program's top tier members, but was not given anything extra or even noted by this hotel.  We were originally assigned a room on the 6th floor that was not renovated, with the A/C barely working at all.  Furthermore it was a twin room but they said there were no doubles or twins put together (common in Spain) at all.  After not being able to sleep due to the temperature of the room at 1am, I called down to complain and ask if there was another room available and they said the only thing available is another twin room on the first floor.  We went to take a look and it was also an non-renovated room but this time it was right at street level with the…

title: Most beautiful and exotic hotel!
review: On September,  2015, I joined a Gate 1 tour and stayed in Hotel Saray for only one day.  This hotel has a very beautiful and sparkling pool area,  with the mysterious,  middle eastern influence in the architecture.  It is a perfect example of the East meets the West!  When I walked into the pool area, a guy from Ireland, showed me how true and wonderful this statement is and I was feeling so Hot and breathless!----about the beauty this hotel has to offer!  Well,  please make sure that you come to the garden and pool area!  You will be truly surprised!

title: Super value for money
review: Really enjoyed our stay here. Very good rooms, excellent swimming pool, good location close to center as well as Alhambra and last but not least all for very reasonable prices Breakfast ok too albeit seldomly really impressive in these parts of the world on the bread side when coming from Northern Europe ....

title: Three day visit
review: We stayed here it was great the staff were most helpful food was good and the room was very good they looked after our needs and nothing was too much trouble. Pool was great and welcome after two months travelling location was also good we walked to everything we wanted to see

title: Beautiful Hotel, wonderful room
review: One of the nicer esthetically pleasing hotels on our trip through Spain with rooms that did not disappoint. Wonderfully large rooms with bathrooms to match, that were clean and well appointed. Unfortunately, I cannot remember for sure, but I do not believe there was a coffee maker in the room, so check with the hotel. There is a wonderful pool area, however it was to cool to use, though it looked very inviting. The hotel is not close to the center of town, though of course there is transportation nearby. The Alhambra is a short inexpensive taxi ride away. The breakfast had enough options to please anyone and the food was of high quality. We did not have much interaction with the staff, but we did encounter friendly English speaking desk personnel. We did not have a view, as it…

title: outside lifts
review: The lifts are on the outside of the building with glass so you can have a view on the way up.We were part of a group so unsure of pricing etc.Rooms were well appointed .Not located to close to much but 10 minute walk to the city square.

title: Short break, nice hotel
review: First impressions were that reception staff need to learn how to smile. I don't understand why this is so difficult for so many hotels. Hotel has an underground car park which is handy but is quite tight for space, not ideal if you have a large car! Book parking in advance if you intend taking your car.  Bed was very comfortable and room was clean and well fitted out. No tea / coffee facilities in room which was a let down. Minibar prices were not excessive though. Shame they didn't restock it during our stay.  Lobby bar was very good and reasonably priced for food and drink. Older barman there was very friendly and attentive.  This hotel is popular for weddings and functions and has a nice pool area. Some rooms could be noisy as the fire station is round the back. We were on…

title: Bad location, average staff
review: We stayed two nights in Feb, the hotel is located at the edge of the tourist destinations but not conveniently near the Alhambra entrance, or the Arab quarters and Albaicin. The hotel itself is however quite grand, bed and room sizes are extra largem the bathrooms are great too. We did not opt for breakfast (found it too expensive). We did seek some help on Alhambra tickets and how to get there etc. but were misguided or shown indifference. I recommend staying somewhere close to the Fountain square, where most of the action is.

title: A wonderful oasis in Granada
review: Dear guest,  We are sorry about the inconvenience of the distance from the Hotel to the Alhambra, but on the other side we are located in the city center and to access to the Alhambra Palace you need to take transport, so this is on the outskirts of the city.  We are grateful that you like our facilities and that your stay was comfortable, so this is our principal aim. We hope that you come back to this beautiful city soon.  Best Regards,  Patricia Moya (Customer Service)

title: Not a four star experience.
review: We stayed here one night in early May 2016 after our previous lodging, in the center of Granada, proved too noisy.  This hotel was like paradise in most respects, again, compared to other hotels we were in in Granada and elsewhere in Spain.  We got a package deal that included the breakfast buffet, and I'd say it was the best breakfast we had in 2 1/2 weeks in Spain.  The options were many, including yogurt, fresh fruit, hot and cold cereals, many pastries, toasts, ham, fresh fruit juices, and several of those great coffee machines that allow guests to choose the type of coffee desired and to come back as often as desired.  We didn't have a car so I can't comment on the car park situation.  Nor did we book through booking.com, so I can't comment on that.  We used the hotel's own…

title: Disappointing stay
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for your excellent comments about your experience at Hotel Saray. It is a great pleasure to know that we have get the expectations of our customers and they have enjoyed their stay at our facilities.  We hope to welcome you soon and make you feel like home. Best Regards, Patricia Moya (Customer Service)

title: Nice Hotel
review: This is a very stylish hotel, conveniently located for visitors, particularly to the Palacio de Congresos which is almost next door. The rooms are nice, with good beds, Service at the reception desk is very good. However, we did not have a good stay. We had asked particularly for a quiet room, but our first floor room had a connecting door to the adjoining room, so every word of our neighbours' conversation was audible. On the second day while resting at lunchtime, new guests arrived next door and opened the door and walked in! Reception was concerned and helpful and immediately gave us another room, but no help was offered to move our bags and a visit from a manager to apologise would have been nice. Like all hotels of this type they like to put on functions and the late…

title: Food
review: Gave Hotel another try and had the continental breakfast which was ok, tried burger in reception bar, and was very happy with it, staff was very nice too, rooms on the First two floors were better than others, obviously been refurbished

title: Great hotel, good location
review: Dear Mavis, Thank you for your positive comments about our food and staff treatment, we are very pleasure to know that we get the guest satisfaction.  We hope to welcome you again in our facilities. Best Regards, Patricia Moya (Customer Service)

title: Nice enough for a quick stop!
review: We stayed 2 nights while sightseeing in Granada.  Hotel was sited well for all main attractions (by foot) and has the benefit of a car park.  Very clean through out & comfortable room.  Only reason not given 5 is no tea & coffee making facilities in the room.

title: Engineer
review: Dear Guest, Firstly I would like to be grateful for your positive comment about Hotel Saray. As you mentioned we are located just a few minutes to the city center on foot. We are pleasure to know that you enjoy your stay at our facilities. We hope to welcome you again in future occasions.  Best Regards, Patricia Moya (Customer Service)

title: "Average"
review: We stayed 2 nights in The Saray Hotel whilst travelling round southern Spain. Upon arrival the first impressions were that this was a very well presented hotel but had a slightly dated feel about it. I imagine in its hay day this was pretty impressive. The pool area seemed well equipped and there was reasonable space around to relax. I couldn't comment on parking facilities at the hotel as I parked on the street which was painless enough. Just be am careful that you don't park in a designated resident parking area though. Reception staff were nice enough and dealt with any queries we had quickly.  The room itself had the same feel as reception, in that it had been a while since its last lick of paint but other than that it was ok. We could connect to the wifi and it was a good…

title: Good Location but Otherwise Pretty Standard
review: Visited together for a conference.  Hotel staff were very helpful overall.  In terms of the facilities, just a little disappointing for a hotel attracting four stars.  There are no real leisure facilities and off season the outside pool is not really useable so short of the bar or your room there is little else on offer. The hotel feels a little tired and the rooms are likewise.  A double room is actually two singles pushed together which is not ideal for couples.  The room didn't feel quite as clean as it should and our shower holder was actually broken which meant you couldn't stand under it.  Surely cleaning staff must have known but for what ever reason just chose not to report it.  We mentioned it when we left.  The breakfast offering was decent enough with the pretty…

title: Was not impressed
review: Dear Guest, Firstly I would like to be grateful for share with us your comments about your experience, thanks to it we improve every day. We regret about the inconvenience caused, so our swimming pool is ready for it use only in summer season, as well the pool services as the pool bar or towels. In the same way, we always try to please everyone of our guest but not all of double rooms have double bed, it is low availability.  We take note about the inconvenience with the shower and our maintenance manager has checked it. Our cleaning is the most appreciated aspect for our clients, so sorry if in this case we did not get the high level desired.  Additionally, we are pleased that you like our buffet breakfast and the staff kindness and predisposition.  We hope to welcome you soon and change your opinion at 100%. Best Regards, Patricia Moya (Customer Service)

title: Dated but OK
review: The room was for me and my wife. When I first seen the room it appeared to be satisfactory. Big bed, desk, small fridge, couple of chairs, nice bathroom, but looks are not what makes the room. The big bed was two doubles pushed together, so when you try to cuddle you fall in-between the mattresses. The room was a little stuffy, no air flow. Looked for the fan to move some air. However, only worked when heat is on. Called front desk about fan, man came to room telling us that they don't have cooling system since its cool outside. We were told to just open the window. Still no air flow, room was still stuffy and warm. Then one of the things I love about staying at a hotel is the shower. I can use all the hot water I want. Not so here. My wife had showed first and told me that the…

title: Not a star hotel by any stretch
review: Dear guest,  Firstly please accept our most sincere apologies, so in view of your comments we have not achieved your desired quality level. We always try to please our guests, but not all of our rooms have double bed, so we are sorry for cannot offer you one of it as you ask, but it is low availability. In relation with our air conditioning system, it is ready for cold when the exterior temperature is above the 22 degrees; we regret that this situation could be an annoyance.  Regarding to our bathrooms all of them have the shower with a regulation system of the water temperature, so the client can choose it. On the one hand, mentioned that our Hotel does not have iron in the rooms, so it can produce risk for our clients. But on the other hand, we have laundry and your garments could be wash and iron daily for our staff.  We hope to welcome you soon in this beautiful city and can change your opinion about our facilities, so everyone work hard every day to get the maximum satisfaction of our guests.  Best Regards, Customer Service

title: Nothing special
review: This hotel is very dated and desperately needs an update! I imagine it was great in its day. The room was stifling hot, the air conditioning does nothing, it was lucky we could open a window. The views however are amazing, as we were lucky enough to get a 7th floor room. It's just on the edge of town, I wouldn't call it centrally located. Someone else wrote on here that it has the parking garage from hell. This is pretty accurate, it's very tight. However it's been built and there's nothing anyone can do about that. Just be prepared for it.

title: Good location
review: The hotel is located right by the city center. The hotel is located by a fire station in a quiet part of Granada. We stayed in room 209. The room was hot. The air conditioner did not function at all. If you are married they put 2 beds together. So in the middle it splits. The bathroom is big. The shower is typical Iberian. It has no curtain or anything, so expect water to spray into the floor.The staff are friendly and have great suggestions to help out.  The breakfast was good. It cost 11 Euros per day for the buffet. This is worth it. The grounds are very attractive, it is arabic themed. The decor of the hotel is wonderful as well.

title: "Great Location"
review: Situated in a quieter part of Granada (next to fire station!) this modern Moorish style hotel is ideally placed, being 20 mins stroll to the cathedral and reasonably positioned for the Alhambra, but beware its mainly uphill most of the way. Lovely outside gardens surrounding a good sized pool, great choice at breakfast but the evening meal which was buffet style lacked choice and was  lukewarm. All in all a good hotel, with large sized bedrooms including free WIFI and best of all a comfortable bed.

title: Perfect place to stay for both city and mountains
review: Spacious rooms, very clean, friendly cleaning and service staff, comfortable surroundings.  Beautiful pool area, although put if season could still sit round the pool and enjoy the lovely surroundings.

title: This was rated 4 Stars I beg to differ. Yes location was excellent, so too was the fact that it was clean and tidy.
review: This hotel may have been out standing in the pass. It can be seen that it made its name! However, that's it, it looks worn out in need of urgent freshened up! We paid for bed and breakfast which included parking & free wifi. Location outstanding, parking risking as spaces are too tight!

title: Searching for Saray
review: We like to try new places, yet here we are on another visit to Granada. This time we decided to pick a hotel in the southern sector of the city, but close to the Genil River. I would add that Granada is not the most car friendly place and despite having just updated the maps on my sat nav, it took about 25minutes of ever decreasing circles to find our way to the hotel through the maze of one way streets. As a tip: look for the Plaza Rotary and take the Paseo Enrique Tierno Galvan exit off it. The hotel is to be found a short way along there, just behind the bus station and bomberos. The hotel does have its own car parking facility at a cost, or, you can circulate in the hope of finding a street parking place. Arriving a little after 2:00pm we found a slot just of the Paseo de…

title: A super hotel just a short walk from all the attractions.
review: From Sonia's warm welcome on our arrival to our departure three days later, we could not have been more pleased. Spotlessly clean, friendly staff, very good breakfasts and underground parking thrown in....hard to ask for more. The hotel is just a short 15 minute walk to the old town, shopping and cafe's for every taste. The pool was not yet open but it was certainly inviting and must be a delight later in the spring. Definitely worth a return visit.

title: Great Value
review: The hotel is in a great location, just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Granada city centre but close enough to walk to it and the surrounding attractions. We found all of the staff very helpful, cheerful and happy, it was a pleasure to stay at this hotel.  Our room was spacious with a large comfortable bed. There is a large TV on the wall however, the channels are fairly limited, but then who wants to watch TV when you are in Granada! The bathroom has a bath and a shower and so caters for all. The bath is long enough for a 6 foot plus lump to lay in, and after walking around Granada all day it was a pleasant way to relax away the aches and pains. Take the express breakfast, it's great value for money.

title: Birthday  treat
review: Staying  here for 3 nights, what a lovely  hotel 😆 very large  rooms😆 and spotlessly  clean 😆😆. The staff  are very  nice and  helpful 😆😆.. Nice selection  of food  for  breakfast 😆Beautiful  selection  of fresh fruit 😆😆. Something  for  everyone's  taste buds 😆😆. I would  highly recommend this hotel it is in a lovely  location. A big thank you.😆 😆 😆 😆

title: Would definitely stay here again.
review: We only had two slight negatives, firstly there were signs of tiredness in certain areas creeping in that a spruce up could fix, and secondly the main restaurant was closed when we were there, however it was early in February when the hotel was very quiet.  This was made up for by the standard of food in the bar and downstairs cafe.  Apart from that it was faultless as the staff were very helpful, especially the bar staff.  The food was superb (especially the burger) and the rooms were spacious and the beds very comfortable and big.  A good location just south of the river.

title: Ahh memories!! what a hotel
review: Lovely hotel bang in the city center. Mega helpful staff who spoke excellent english. Good rooms and free wifi. A nice quiet hotel where you can ubwind after a tired day of sightseeing. There are many nice things to do around and fantast(ic places to eat.

title: Great comfort at a good location
review: Located in city center but not inside the hustle bustle and so is highly recommended for those who intend a peaceful holiday. Good variety in breakfast though it is served in a basement and hence no views. Rooms are spacious and comfortable and nice and clean bathrooms. Taxi stand is just next to the hotel and for a good walker or hiker, Alhambra may also be considered at a walking distance.

title: Excellent City Centre location, warm, friendly service, great value.
review: Staying in southern Spain with friends who had never been to the Alhambra Palace.  We booked this at short notice. Very pleasantly surprised on arrival with the quality of the room and pool area also the warmth of the guy on reception. Lovely walk around the nearby city centre.  Great breakfast.

title: Saray, Saray!
review: Everything was amazing from beginning to end--great staff at the reception, bar, and at breakfast. The room was very nice, plenty of toiletries, good wifi connection.  Asked for directions or recommendations several times and always received accurate information.  Great location, great price, great place.

title: Nicely decorated and quiet hotel
review: The hotel is modern and quiet. Serves an excellent breakfast and is close to the city center. You mustn't mind driving around a bit to find a parking spot if you arrived by car, but parking is free if you don't use the hotel's service :-)

title: Really not whats advertised!!
review: Dear Mr Peter  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Antonio Campos Director

title: Very comfortable- great wifi
review: This hotel is great -- a short walk from the town, excellent wifi and good service. It was only €70 per night so it was really good value. We did not have breakfast but there are like loads of good cheap options locally.

title: Moorish style
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed  our location, service , wifi and excellent price   hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  CUSTOMER CARE

title: Excellent hotel, great location for conferences
review: It is an interesting hotel in Moorish style. Rooms are spacious, staff is quite hospitable. But it has strange system for breakfasts - if one of you want to have a "buffet" and the other -- just an ordinary breakfast (they have two proposals for a breakfast), you should go to separate halls.

title: Great value for money.
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for the review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay  As per you said we offer two different buffet breakfast , sorry if separete halls was an inconvenience for you We hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely, CUSTOMER CARE

title: Fantastic value hotel
review: I stayed here during a conference and enjoyed the hotel immensely. The room was very nice, the breakfast was excellent, and the location couldn't be beat! The staff was also friendly and accommodating.

title: New Year Break
review: We spent two night here in January 2016. The hotel location is very convenient to all the attractions in Granada. Walking distance to good restaurants and shopping and buses nearby if needed. We found the staff very friendly and helpful except for the bartender who was very unfriendly indeed. The buffet breakfast is well worth having with everything one could want. We also used the hotel underground car park and found this to be very convenient and secure. We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Saray and would recomment it to all who want a trouble free break

title: Good value for money
review: If you want to fully experiment the atmosphere of Granada then this hotel is perfect. While still being affordable it has good services. The breakfast is really complete as for variety. The rooms are big and the bed (huge!) incredibly comfortable. I have to say, however, the bathroom was not fully refurbished, but for the price it was acceptable.  The only issue I personally had was with the lift (it's panoramic and that's nice except for the fact that it's freezing cold inside it...not the best thing to experiment whilst going for breakfast first thing in the morning!).   All in all, highly recommended.

title: not to 4star European standard
review: 2 nights and shouldn't have paid for the breakfast it was only geared up for cold food, the only hot was scrambled eggs and almost raw streaky bacon, oh and frankfurters!!!, although 2nd day asked for a fried egg and was given one,

title: Not a great hotel if you suffer vertigo, but....
review: I would still stay here. The problem foe me being afraid of heights there is a glass elevator going up the front of the hotel only to arrive at a glass wall in the hall. I kept looking at the floor and was afraid until I got to my room. i never did open the drapes as I didn't want to find out what was there. The room was smaller than normal and WiFi did work in my room. the food was very good but it did involve a trip to get there on the stupid elevator.

title: Worth the stay, but !!!
review: The hotel was clean , and the staff were fantastic, but when I reported the aircon did not work, I was told, it was winter, and I should open the window. Now it may be November,  but the room was uncomfortably hot, and do we had to have the window open, which was unbelievably noisy, and we therefore got little sleep. I hasten to add I wore a t shirt the whole of the five days we were there, and in that time did not see one cloud. It's a shame this put a dampener on an otherwise very enjoyable stay.

title: Nice hotel with very few sunbeds
review: We stayed here with several family members this summer. The location is ok it's not that far to walk to the main area in Granada for shopping and great dining. Breakfast was not great compared to other places in Spain it was just ok. What was most Dissapointing was the pool area the space is very limited and to few an beds. Don't expect to get a sunbed if you are not a early bird or if you go out first and then return to the hotel to get some sun and swim. Did not like the price for parking either it was over priced and be aware the parking garage is very narrow and found it difficult to park there even for Spain this garage is very small and narrow won't recommend it and for the stiff price.

title: Hygiene is the main concern
review: I stayed one night at the hotel and was deeply unsatisfied with the hygiene of the room. Several hairs from previous traveler were found at the bathroom and paper shreds on the floor of the room. The pillows were so flatten that sleeping on it feels like no pillow at all. However the breakfast and dinner buffet does give the hotel a credit on it.

title: Great visit
review: Spent 3 nights at the Saray during a visit to Spain.  Very nice hotel with a good selection of amenities.  Centrally located without being right in the middle of things - a 10-15 minute walk get's you pretty much 'downtown' Granada. Only negative - quite expensive to park at the hotel, and the parking garage is very tight to drive around in.

title: Beautiful Property
review: This is a beautiful hotel. The pool area is really serine, I just wish we were able to stay longer to enjoy it. Rooms are well appointed and comfortable. There was only one problem and that was at breakfast, they have these coffee machines that if they worked faster they might be good, but in the morning the first thing I want is coffee. I DON'T like waiting for 6-7 people trying to get just a simple cup of coffee.

title: European Meeting & Training Cours
review: We stayed at this hotel while attending a European customer meeting and training course. The hotel is ideally located, 30 minutes from the airport and a short walk the centre of Granada.  Check in was quick and easy, with very helpful staff. The rooms were nicely decorated, clean and large with comfortable beds.  We ate at breakfast, lunch and dinner as part of our delegate package and all were very good. The evening meals was extremely good, with unusual and tasty dishes for each course.  Although I never got time to use the outdoor pool, it looked very tempting with a nice patio area.  All in all a very good hotel, for both business or leisure.

title: Quiet & comfortable, but be prepared to walk...
review: The Hotel Saray isn't exactly in the heart of Granada - the main shops/sights/restaurants are a good 10-15' walk away (and the Alhambra is definitely not walkable from here), but at least that means it is quiet, and car parking is not a problem (apart from trying to manoeuvre round the very tight spaces of the hotel's underground car park). The public areas are nicely designed, and our room was comfy and quiet. Breakfast was fine, with a good selection. Our only complaint was the quality of the coffee - but then this applied pretty much everywhere we went in Andalucia... The swimming pool isn't quite as warm as we expected (in shadow from the surrounding buildings too much of the day?), but at least the AC works efficiently.

title: The Saray Hotel
review: This hotel is very good. It is a four star hotel near the Congress and Exhibition Center and is very close to Alhambra, the Lorca Museum and Granada Cathedral. Our room was very clean, quiet and comfortable.

title: Great hotel
review: I stayed here whilst attending a conference nearby. The hotel is fantastic, the rooms are nice and big, breakfast could be more varied, but was good enough for me. The pool is really nice as well. All in all I had nothing to complain about and would recommend it any time.

title: Very nice hotel with lovely entrance
review: Stayed for just one night as part of a Globus tour. Very impressed with the foyer, pool and facilities. The hotel has obviously taken inspiration from the Alhambra with its decor. Rooms were comfortable with great lighting in the bathroom. I needed an extra pillow which arrived from house keeping within 5 minutes of my call. Buffet breakfast was amazing with lovely fresh fruit, good coffee and a diverse hot buffet too. The swimming pool area was spotlessly clean and gardens are well maintained.  This hotel is a short walk to the center of town so a good spot to stay.

title: Within walking distance to downtown sights
review: Nicely appointed, large rooms with small refrigerator and safe available. Breakfast was included with our package and the selection was good. Located near the city center and we were able to walk from the hotel to restaurants and tour the downtown. Lovely pool on premises.

title: High Quality Chain but not for those seeking an authentic Spanish experience
review: This large multi-storey hotel gives you a good Marriott or Hilton type experience with few surprises, neither good nor bad.   Our room was extremely comfortable with the side lounge sofa bed for our additional family accommodation requirements.  Breakfast is a large buffet and included in our rate, although could be purchased for 11 Euros. It was as you'd expect in a large chain.  The parking garage is 16 Euros per 24 hours which is a bit steep. Unless you have a small car its pretty tight negotiating the underground columns. You may favour the public parking 100 yards north.  Its around a 15 minute walk to the very centre of Granada, but theres plenty on the way including a supermarket and El Corte Ingles.  The pool area is extremely nice, with bar, loungers etc, although I…

title: A Great choise for relaxing!
review: We had a four night stay here and we loved it. The room was big enough and beds were comfatable. The pool was a nice extra for the hot days, even we werent after sunbathing. We didnt take the breakfest. There were many nice cafes around and supermarket in 500 m.   For us location was nice. A little walk (max 15min)  to centre was ok. It was relaxing to be away from the city.Taxi stop was behind the corner, so getting taxi was very easy.   Definetly would go back.

title: Nice hotel in Granada city centre
review: The hotel was pleasant check in was fast. Rooms were modern and of a fair size bathrooms were bit outdated but the whole room was extremely clean. Most of the staff were very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast buffet was okay standard but okay and restaurant was just regular or below. Waiting times at pool bar/restaurant we're extremely long. The poop was small and you will find it difficult to get a spot.  Overall good hotel and extremely clean and okay service.werewere extremely

title: Good Find in Granada!
review: Let's start with what this hotel is missing...more lounge chairs around the pool.  One of the reasons we selected this hotel was because of the pictures of the pool, and despite having a ton of chairs, it lives up to what the photos show. Great pool to escape the heat, I would just say that they could bring out more chairs. It's a beautiful setting though - and there is room to lay your towel out on the grass so you enjoy the area!  Our room was nice, actually large by most standards. The overall hotel grounds and rooms are kept clean.  We're used to walking so the 15 minute walk into the city center wasn't bad at all. I guess one of the best things you can say about a hotel is that you'd stay there again...and that's the case here!

title: Nice friendly hotel
review: We were greeted by a very friendly & helpful reception on our arrival. We had requested rooms next to each other & were given rooms with inter joining rooms. The hotel is well located for exploring Granada with just a short walk into the town. The pool area was very nice & a welcome relief after exploring the Alhambra. Overall a very pleasant hotel & would recommend.

title: Good size room - outdated bathroom
review: Room was a nice size for an overnight stay.  Bathroom was outdated but clean with a working hair dryer.  When showering the half wall allowed for water to come out onto the floor making it a bit slippery so extra towels were needed. Large breakfast buffet with many options.

title: Great City Stay
review: We stayed here as a family of 4 for 1 night.  I think I was expecting more from the rooms after looking at the photos on line, they were much lighter online, saying that, we had an amazing nights sleep. The beds were very comfortable & thats a huge plus for me.  The pool area is lovely.  I would say if you are looking for an overnight in the city, its a fab base - the city is a short walk away over the river. Breakfast was buffet style and filled us up for the day.

title: Very nice hotel, but slow wifi and check in
review: Very clean and nice hotel with lovely arabic decoration. The rooms were modern and clean. The check in however was extremly slow. We had to wait 20 minutes when there was only 3 people in front of us in the que. And the wifi was very unstable and slow. Kept falling out all the time. The water in the pool was to cold, despite 40oC in the air.

title: great place to stay
review: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel.  We wanted to end our trip to Spain in a hotel with nice pool area and central location.  This was it and we were pleased.  Accomodating staff, lovely pool and lounge chairs.

title: Average hotel in Granada.
review: I stayed here with my wife and son on a road trip of Southern Spain. Reasonably well situated within a 29 minute walk of the centre (centro). Reception staff were friendly although the main bar and restaurant were closed during our stay. Sunbeds around the pool were limited and we had to subatne on the lawn in 40 degree heat, which was OK but other guests were in the shade on their sun beds. Our family room was adequate and air con worked well :-0

title: Slightly disappointed
review: Good points - excellent air con in the rooms and large bathroom.  On the negative side the room was on the small side, the lifts were slow, it is a 20 minute walk to the centre of Granada.  There were always queues at reception so even if you just wanted to order a taxi you had to wait.  The pool area was spacious but most sun loungers were taken - there were 2 inter-connecting pools which went from shallow to deep very quickly, it was difficult to hang onto the side in the deep pool and only one set of steps.  The tiles at the side of the pool were slippery - I did slip and it could have been a bad accident.

title: Wonderful Hotel!
review: Stay Here! We stayed one night and wished we could stay longer! The hotel is Much bigger and nicer than the reviews stated! We loved the modern, clean, large hotel. Rooms were very large and staff was super nice. Breakfast was a buffet with lots of choices. The pool was large, no heat so very cold but refreshing. Definitely stay again!

title: Comfort par excellence!
review: This hotel is very stylish, clean, comfortable, centrally-located. There is a large swimming pool and a great breakfast area serving wonderful food. The beds are comfortable, there is free wifi, a safe, a desk and a mini bar. It's a beautiful place to stay when in Granada.

title: A little disappointing
review: Let me first say that this hotel was great looking and the rooms were spacious and clean.  We walked every day to the city center and it's probably about a 20-minute or so walk.  Regarding the hotel, I do have to say that I felt completely taken advantage of.  The hotel has its own parking garage but parking is 10 euros per day.  The breakfast buffet is 19 euros a person and the WiFi--only 2 devices were allowed to be connected to it.  Not realizing that, my daughter and I connected our smart phones to the WiFi and my wife wasn't able to connect any of her devices, nor was I able to connect my laptop.  It isn't a matter of disconnecting one device so that another could connect.  Whichever 2 devices are connected first will be the only 2 devices allowed to connect for the…

title: Room for Improvement
review: We stayed 3 nights in mid-June, first the good, the rooms are spacious even with an extra bed, the linen are clean and excellent quality, towels are soft and big, amenities are replenish daily, is not in the historical center, but well connected by taxi or bus. If your rate doesn't include breakfast skip the breakfast buffet there are plenty of options within walking distance and much less expensive. Now the Not so good, on arrival we were assigned a room the reeked of smoke, had to go to front desk to request a change, the staff tried to convince me that an aromatherapy filter will solve the problem, eh, no need a non-smoking room. New room had no views but smelled fine. This is a hotel that cater to large groups there is always a large bus parked at the entrance, this make…

title: Efficient modern hotel with sanitised references to moorish designs
review: We stayed two nights and could not find fault. Exceptionally comfortable rooms, selection of pillows hard and soft, air con fully adjystable, large beds everything thought of and your needs anticipated. Impressive entrance hall with lifts which have views through glass walls. Nice pool area although not huge, bar beside pool but only one poor chap running around for everyone. Reception very helpful and spoke English. Parking narrow but underneath hotel for extra 15 euro pday. Sky news tv. View from room was restricted but not unpleasant. location is near to main sights and short walk to town. Easy to get taxi anywhere. Next door is palace of congress with amazing rooftop bar and openair concert arena with views over Granada. A perfect base to explore from.

title: Perfect
review: Price was excellent and quality also, bed room was lovely,modern and clean with everything u might need. Good pool, location in town good, staff helpful and parking below although space was tight not for the faint hearted. Restaurant was closed and referred to the pool bar for food but no one around so we went out on a receptionist recommendation which was spot on. Recommend the hotel no issues

title: Fantastic service and abiance...
review: We thoroughly enjoyed our two weeks at this hotel that is centrally located with a wonderful staff, so much that we are returning in August for another two weeks. The hotel is picturesque of Moorish/Spanish architecture, yet modern on the outside next to the Congresso Convention Center and a short walk to the Science Park, not to mention all the sights to include Alhambra. Everything is within walking distance...to include the shopping areas. The pool area reflects the traditional Andalusian architecture with plenty of space. The only draw back, as others who have reported on this hotel is the free WIFI, which is slow in the rooms, but works well in all public areas, including the pool. The hotel is located within a block of the bus transportation system for Granada, so if you…

title: Nice Hotel but breakfast buffet was lacking
review: We stayed here one night during a Globus Tour. The hotel was nice with glass elevators. Some of the rooms were not ready when we arrived and did not have the opportunity to use the pool. Got to see the Alhambra Suite where all the big wigs stay and it was amazing. Not to far from the center of town. Breakfast buffet was the worse of the trip with very small selection and not presented nicely at all.

title: Nice Ambience
review: This was a pleasant stay for our tour group.  The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was fresh.  The hotel is clean and it has nice views plus the furnishings have character.  They do take good care of their guests.

title: Out of way but still well located
review: We arrived from Valencia after a long drive and were received by efficient and friendly staff, parking on site with lift to reception. Room spacious with excellent beds. Very clean and all amenities were as advertised. Very efficient wifi but only two devices per room. Pool was fantastic after the long drive and then after five hours at Alhambra which has been the highlight of our visit so far. Did not book but lined up at 8:00 and were admitted by 9:15. Access to palace at 11:00. Great access to bars and restaurants within 10 mins walk. Very efficient checkout and they even froze our cooler blocks overnight for us without any trouble.

title: Excellent
review: We were touring Spain for 7 days with hotels in Malaga, Ronda, Seville and then Granada.  This was the perfect hotel, clean, tidy, very good check-in service.  Clean swimming pool, lovely colours.  Room was spot on, all as it should be, I wish we had more time to stay at the hotel.  Location was just round the corner from the main streets with lots of cafes and restaurants not far away.  Didnt have breakfast as it was pricey at 11E per person.

title: Great hotel!
review: The hotel is 15-20 minutes walk from downtown Granada. Breakfast was included. It offers continental and hot breakfast (for Americans!!!!). Breakfast buffet offers a huge variety of food types. The pool is amazing. I did not like the carpet in the room. It is very old. I like it because most of the buses stop close-by. It is only a few minutes from Palacio de Congresos.

title: Disappointing
review: We stayed here for 3 nights and used it as a base to explore Granada. We had been staying in hostels previously and were thoroughly underwhelmed by the service of the reception staff. Our room stank of cigarette smoke, and their response was to place an air purifier in the room (even though the lady assured me this was a non smoking hotel). When we complained further they gave us another room that had just had scented air freshener sprayed and after a few hours started to smell like smoke. We spent most of the time exploring but were generally unimpressed with the attitude and friendliness of the staff. They were especially unhelpful with directions and points of interest in the city.  In the mornings the cleaners were very loud.  Our hot water didn't work on the second morning…

title: Avoid !
review: Dear Guest, First of all thank you very much for choosing our hotel for your stay in Granada. All our rooms are NON smoking but unfortunately some guest do not respect this prohibition and we have to act with the  air purifier that you mention. We would love to have the chance of receiving you back and changing your opinión. Best Regards,

title: Nice place.
review: We stayed here just one night as part of an organized tour.  Our room was clean and comfortable and included free wifi.  The morning buffet was large and offered a lot of variety.  The pool and lobby area looked really nice.  We would have liked to have spent a little more time enjoying everything this hotel has to offer.

title: Pleasantly Surprised
review: We spent three days in Granada, and used the Saray as basecamp.  The staff was very accommodating, arranging tours and making suggestions. They even helped me to recover my "lost" luggage (thanks to Iberia Air).  Our room was a reasonable size, and very clean. Our package included breakfast, which was more than adequate. The pool looked nice, but we didn't really want to take away from our sightseeing to spend time there.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent
review: This is a very nice hotel and is more upscale.  It is centrally located in Granada and tends to be for tours.  The rooms are very nice and there is a outdoor pool that you can see from the courtyard.  The food is good and the service was very good.  You have access to everything just outside the hotel.

title: Fast trip great location
review: We were on a gate 1 tour and the hotel they picked was great.  Clean with a good breakfast.  Was great for attractions, restaurants and walking distance to most.  The room was comfortable and a reasonable size for a European hotel.  I would recommend.

title: Very Professional Staff
review: We had spent the better half of the day traveling to Granada, after which we took a three-and-a-half hour tour of the Alhambra complex. I made the reservation for this hotel using the Alhambra's free WiFi at their ticket counter!  Once we arrived, the staff helped us get squared away very quickly. The room was very comfortable for two people and had all the amenities that you would expect for a short stay.   The breakfast buffet is incredible - truly one of a kind! We enjoyed a delicious all-you-can-eat Andalusian feast.  All of that being said, it was the following experience I had with Saray Hotel that really compels me to award this establishment five stars.  I realized once I got to Salamanca a few days later that I had actually left my cologne in the bathroom. I contacted…

title: Was probably nice in the '60s
review: By the looks of it, this hotel was built in the early 1960's when Lawrence of Arabia had just come out and the Arabian theme was trendy. It seems very little in the hotel has changed since then. The lobby of the hotel looks like a cheap-ish knockoff of the hotels that appeared in an early Bond movie, with typefaces to match everywhere.   The internet speed was glacial at best, and constantly disconnected. Think <1 Mbps at peak speed. I gave up trying to do even the most basic things online. If this modern convenience is important to you, I'd recommend skipping this place.   The room itself looked to have been renovated within the last decade, with leather padding behind the bed, wood veneers and mirrors abound. Can't really complain too much. The pool, while itself quite small,…

title: Nice "Diggs" in Granada
review: Thank you very much for choosing our hotel for your stay in Granada. We regret you don't like our hotel decoration as this is one of our best well known value in the city and very noted by our guests.

title: Lovely and Peaceful
review: This  is my second stay in two years at the Saray Hotel. Its architecture and brownish color pretty much reminds me of similar buildings I saw in Morocco.   The room was clean and large enough to be comfortable for two travelers. The queen bed was comfortable for sleeping and the street noise was hardly a problem. The air condition system worked well and the we didn’t encounter any problems with the free WiFi connection with my iPhone and laptop. However, once you logged in with one device, you needed to logout before being able to use a second device with the hotel’s WiFi.  The bath included most of the requisite amenities. The shower operated without problems and there even a bidet along with the toilet.  The daily buffet breakfast was more than adequate with the usual…

title: Vacation
review: My husband and I spent one night here and thought the hotel was beautiful. Our room was very nice and the bed comfy. The gardens are beautiful and the pool area was inviting. Breakfast buffet was very nice. Loved the decor and the tranquil feeling we had just wandering around. Unfortunately, we were too tired after touring the Alhambra to enjoy the swimming pool. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Nice place to stay
review: Thank you very much for your beautiful description of our hotel. We are happy you enjoy so much with us. Hope to see you again very soon. Best Regards

title: More Business Like
review: Granada is an outstanding historical city. So glad that we toured it in April. This hotel is fairly close to the historical area. Not as charming as I would prefer and offer little tourist help. The accommodations were very clean, comfortable beds, and housekeeping staff were friendly.

title: A pretty hotel
review: The hotel is far from the bus station. Actually, the bus station is far from the city centre… It is easy to get to the hotel from the bus station though. There are two lines of busses going straight from the bust station to the hotel.   The hotel is big and easy to find. The decoration and design of the hotel made it feel really luxurious. The service was mostly nice. There are lifts as well as free and functioning wifi and a restaurant. We had a room for three people and the view from the room was amazing. The room had everything we needed as well as a television. The only thing was that the beds were really hard, but this is a common thing in Spain. The rooms were modern and (as well as the bathroom), clean.   One thing that was a disappointment was that we actually booked the…

title: OK
review: I chose this hotel for its location: within walking distance of the centre and th Alhambra, but easy to reach by car from the motorway, and with secure parking.  It ticked all those boxes, but everything was OK, but nothing special.  Staff a bit detached and aloof, rooms clean and functional, but uninspiring, and soundproofing poor.  I'd probably look for somewhere else next time.

title: Good location for town centre
review: Thank you very much for choosing our hotel for your stay in Granada and for viewing favorably and pointing down our location, secure parking, accessibility and the cleanliness and functionality of our rooms. We would like to welcome you back to our hotel and change your experience to a 100 over 100.

title: Good location
review: The hotel was on a very busy road with a bus stop outside, where we had to park until we found out where to put the car. Parking was underground and secure. Got a good deal for the type of hotel and area, but still quite expensive. Lift on outside of the building didn't go down well with people with vertigo (I shut my eyes)! Large swimming pool available for use. Room comfortable and roomy. Huge bed! Great views over city. Nice receptionist who helped us use printer in business centre. Also booked us a taxi to take us to Alhambra in the morning. Very close to centre of town (10 minute walk). Restaurants and tapas bars close by. Supermarket about 5 minutes away.

title: Rude staff, old and smelly, never again
review: - Reception and bar staff is rude, does not seem to be interested in guests, does not do any effort to help you or make you feel welcome.   People in the bar do not speak English, do not want to help you, do not provide any service (Lady did not bring your lunch to the table, puts it on the bar). - Reception staff just showed us the bill while chatting with his colleague, no ´thank you´ or ´how was your stay´. - Room smelled like cigarette smoke. - Wifi did not work in the room because of very bad signal. - You need to sign a lot of papers at checkin (why??) and for everything you order.   For the breakfast they come to your table. Looks like they are collecting signatures? - Very old hotel, needs maintenance done for long time.  + Swimming pool was nice!

title: Good value for money
review: We are very sorry about your bad feeling with our hotel as we work daily hard with the target of our guest had a completely different impression. That’s is why, in order to obtain all the info regarding your comment and follow it up with every involved department we beg you send us to acampos@h-santos.es check-in and out date, room you occupied as well as every detail you consider important to mentioned. We would like to have the chance to receive you back in a future and be able to change your opinion. Best Regards.

title: Great place to stay in Granada, Spainn
review: Stayed here with friends for a night. Location is good, just near the Airport bus terminal stop. Many dining options nearby.  Quiet and serene surroundings.   Rooms are nice with ample facilities. Beds are comfortable. Lack bedside electric wall outlets. No tea and coffee facilities in room. Bathroom is good and spacious. Reception staff very helpful and courteous. A beautiful garden and open pool in the backyard.  Buffet breakfast is really good with lots of choices and served fresh.

title: Excellent value and easy to find by car
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your positive comment about our hotel. It makes us happy that you have enjoyed your stay with us in Granada and we hope that you return to our facilities.  Yours Sincerely

title: Great for 1 night but do not expect reliable WiFi
review: This hotel is old worldly and very charming. The decor has a distinct Spanish, Moorish touch in keeping with the traditions of The Ahlambra.It is also very comfortable and has an amazing buffet 3 times a day. The hotel rates and food prices are the best value for your money. Extremely reasonable for good quality.The food is great. The staff is very helpful  and if you inquire at the desk they book you an incredible authentic Flamenco show  in  a charming restaurant that over looks The Ahlambra.

title: Saray but not 4 star
review: This hotel came with twin beds though we wanted double beds; the twin beds kept rolling away when we did put them together. The cleaners must be given very short amount of time to do their job as the grouting between tiles were orange with mold; the mascara stain i accidentally created was still on the side of the sink when we left after 6 days; the bed sheets and quilt covers were not changed after the 2nd day of stay. Location wise it is 20 minutes away from the Alhambra; about 10 minutes away from the town center. Conveniently on the bus route from and to the airport.Not many restaurants around the hotel; but the cafe that is in the square 5 minutes down the road makes a decent enough food to jump start you in the morning if you don't fancy the buffet breakfast from the…

title: Modern hotel with easy access to city center
review: Thank you very much for choosing our hotel for your stay in Granada and for taking the time to share your feedback. We are pleased you enjoy our location. I beg you to apologize us regarding the cleaning mistake you mentioned. We will address your comment to our Housekeeper  to take it into account. We hope to welcome you back to our hotel soon and change your experience to a 100 over 100. Sincerely yours, Laura F.

title: Great value hotel.
review: Located next to the conference center in Granada, this hotel is an excellent place to stay particularly if you are attending a conference. The rooms are large with high ceilings and modern decor. They have an early (for Granada) breakfast service, both an express and a full buffet. This is important because many of the coffee shops do not open before 9:00AM. The bar stays open to serve food and drinks until midnight, also important because if you arrive between 4:00-6:00 or after 10:00 most restaurants are closed. The food is average hotel fare, but convenient for business travelers. Staff were all helpful and multi-lingual. The pool and patio were beautiful - even in February...It is a short walk to the city center and numerous restaurants. And walking in Granada is the only…

title: Just Average
review: We visit Granada regularly as our son lives there and we always stay at the Saray. It is a very well located hotel and we have always had good service. The rooms are clean and comfortable and free wifi is a bonus. In the warmer seasons the pool is very welcome. We do not have breakfast there so cannot comment on that.

title: Very Average
review: Good location however the rooms are very basic and bland, not much in them to write about. Reception ignored us until they had finished talking, not sure if it was business or private as they were not speaking in English (of course). The room service was poor and the food delivered not much better and wasn't eaten. Free internet included in our bus tour otherwise you had to pay for it.

title: little remote
review: internet is free only with some room types.  breakfast doesn't worth the money.  difficult to find parking around, so count in your budget the price of the hotel parking.  renovated rooms are nice.  staff is not very friendly.

title: good value
review: I spent two nights in this hotel and it's good value for money. The location is quite centric, as it is located just outside the noisy area and still walking distance to the main attractions. room was clean and modern.

title: Easy walk to Pedestrian area
review: We first checked into room #118, but it smelled of smoke so badly that we asked to change rooms.  The reception staff was apologetic, as this was supposed to be non-smoking.  We were changed to room #117 which was better, but we could even smell the smoke when we got off the elevator on the 1st floor.  I wondered why the housekeeping staff did not notice the strong smoke smell in the room and by the elevator.   We thought the location was OK.  Not a far walk to the pedestrian area across the river.

title: Lovely Hotel with good Parking Facilty
review: Found this Hotel very clean and comfortable with the added bonus of on site secure parking. The staff were very helpful and courteous. Many Tapas Bars and cafe's near by. Easy  flat walking to the attractions about 15-20 minutes tops just far enough away from the city centre to avoid the noise. Very easy to find being right beside the Congress centre . If you don't want to walk to the city centre etc the bus stops are right outside the Hotel and the Taxis are very reasonable also. Would definitely return to the Saray and would happily recommend.

title: good place
review: very reasonable hotel, not far away from all the attractions .... Food is OK, price is OK, service is OK. everything was acceptable. not a very special place but the quality / price was ok for us. it's worth tring.

title: Disappointing
review: The buthtub was dirty and there was dust on the shelves. No toilet brush in bathroom. Shower head was extremely short. Very comfortable bed but weird bed clothes. Rude housekeeping. Thin walls. The location is great though.

title: Nice hotel for very reasonable price
review: We stayed in Saray with our 10 month old son for 3 nights and it was really nice. The room was spacious and clean, the wifi access was good, although we had to request pin at the front desk. The hotel is not in the town center but it takes 20-30 minutes walking to get to main attractions so it was pretty ok and we we were outside of the center noise and crowds.

title: Perfect!
review: A friend and I stayed here for a week, it was also our first visit to Granada.  I loved the hotel, it was much much nicer than expected. Staff were very helpful and polite, rooms and common areas were extremely clean. Pool area was also lovely and private.  There was a wide range of breakfast items if you chose the €11.95 option.  The only negative (if you can call it that) was that on one of the days I wanted the larger breakfast and my friend wanted the smaller option. Each is served in separate dining rooms so we had to eat breakfast separately.  All in all, my hotel stay added to my amazing holiday. I would definitely recommend it!

title: Great hotel
review: Very nice hotel (breakfast was not included in our stay, so we opted for cafes). But the hotel was beautiful, the room was clean and comfortable and nice, the service was good, there was a computer (which we needed!), and we were able to walk to the main attractions without wasting half our day getting there.

title: Very good choice a little away from the old part of Granada
review: This high rise hotel, is across the river from the Alhambra and old city of Granada.  So if you don't mind a 30-45 minute walk or taxi ride, this hotel is an excellent choice.  The rooms are large and modern, especially for a European city center hotel.  The air conditioning works well, as it was cool this visit, but 47 deg C (about 115 F) the last time we visited Granada.  Clean rooms, comfortable beds, and pleasant staff make this a good choice.  The breakfast buffet was decent and included in our land tour.  As we were on a tour, we can not comment on value.  Based upon internet pricing, it appears like a good value.

title: Good location
review: Not too close to be in amongst the traffic, but close enough to walk to all attractions. Friendly efficient staff and very nice rooms. Food choices good and a nice pool. One slight caveat - the basement garage has some tight turns, the smaller the car the better. We managed with a Renault Megane - but only just!

title: Great value for money.
review: Stayed for one night in October 14. Hotel is just on the outskirts of the centre but within easy walking distance of all the main sights; we walked to the Alhambra Palace in about 30 minutes. Hotel is clean and staff were helpful and spoke English. Rooms spacious enough for a city hotel and overnight break. We paid for breakfast but if I was staying again I would probably look at somewhere else. It was okay, but  just that. There is a car park underneath which costs about £16 per night but it is secure so worth paying for. I would recommend this hotel for its convenience and value and will stay here again if I return to Granada.

title: Good location. Perfect for the cost
review: We stayed at the hotel for one day during our Trip to Toledo. The location is pretty close to the Alhambra along with the main stores. The hotel staff was good and even gave us an extra hour to check out. The check in was pretty smooth. The rooms are definitely GREAT for the price that you pay. They were well maintained, clean and had a fancy look to it. I definitely have no complains except the coffee tasted awful.

title: Poor 4 Star, with lack of facilities
review: We spent 2 nights here in October and had booked a double room. The hotel is fairly modern with Moorish designs throughout the hotel. The front desk staff were decidedly unhelpful - we were the only people at the desk on check-in and of the 2 staff neither seemed willing to help. On all occasions we needed front desk assistance, no-one seemed willing to rush to assist and never with a smile...... The room was clean and modern, but the rooms do suffer a little from road noise and also are not well insulated against noise in the corridor, so a quiet evening or lie-in is near impossible. The room does not have tea or coffee making facilities and has a TV which only has the news channels in English. There is a lack of dining options here - there is only the cafe which serves…

title: Excellent location & reasonably priced.
review: We only stayed here for 1 night as we were on a mini break. The hotel was clean & the staff were friendly & efficient. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice & I thought the coffee was excellent, very strong just how I like it. The air conditioning was good & the room was perfectly adequate. We  didn't have time to try out the leisure facilities, so I can't comment on them, but the pool area did look nice. The location was superb, a short walk to the centre, but in a quiet road & we used the hotel car park so parking was no problem. We paid around £60 for B & B with a double room and  car parking. We booked through Alpharooms.com.

title: Correct hotel not fancy
review: Booked this hotel last minute. Is a typical 'congres' hotel near the congres center. 5 minutes walk from historical center. Little bit old fashioned but very friendly staff and good breakfast. Not a 'charming hotel but price/quality is ok.

title: Clean, reasonable location, needs updating
review: Staff are very polite and helpful, plenty of parking under the hotel, hotel is very dated, built in 60's or 70's and while it is clean and tidy its just an average hotel. Our room was quite small but bathroom was good size and actually quite modern. Beds were ok, nothing to write home about. Our TV wasn't powering on but that was sorted quickly by hotel staff. About 10-15mins walk into city center and 30-40 mins to Alhambra (make sure you are there by 7am to buy tickets or pre-book thru ticketmaster)

title: Great location, good quality and deals through tripadvisor
review: We wrongly booked a poorly located apartment in Granada and ended up with nowhere to stay on the day we arrived. Hotel Las Almenas was unfortunately full but patron tried to hep us locate alternatives. We couldn't find anything central but used the pricing on trip advisor to narrow down to a few.  We got an exceptional deal for this clean, pleasant and well located hotel. We stayed for three nights and apart5 from the swimming pool closing in mid September everything was very good. It s mainly used by tour groups so don't expect much atmosphere but if you are just looking for a good well priced bolt hole this is the place for you.

title: Wish we could stay longer
review: Being in a tour group, we naturally cannot stray off and stay a day or more longer.  This hotel, with the Moorish decor and theme, is interesting, to say the least.  Many of the travellers in the group asked me what the electric panel was there for - trousers press.  It is so 60s.  But, I presume there is a need for it? The shower, however, is uptodate.  It took me some time to work out the control for each nozzle.  But fun, in a way.

title: Perfect
review: This hotel is Just Great! Good Value for money, confortable and spacious room, quiet ambience, quality of bed, wifi, swimming pool, customer service,etc.... Everything was above average.  Thanks!!!!!!!

title: Pretty, but not fantastic
review: It was a pretty hotel, and the rooms were comfortable.  But I don't think it's really worth it.  The lobby is pretty enough, with the moorish decoration, fountain, marble floors, and the ceiling, but I didn't find it that beautiful.  Same for the pool area - it has some fountains and a garden, but it's not spectacular.  Basically, it's a start, they are trying, but didn't go all the way.  The rooms are comfortable, spacious, and pretty, but I am not sure it's worth it.  If you're looking for a place of comfort, and don't mind paying extra, this is a good choice; but if you are in Granada to see Granada and not the hotel, better look elsewhere.

title: An Enjoyable Stay in a Comfortable Hotel
review: We had two nights in The Saray and really enjoyed ourselves. We found it to be a comfortable, well located (10 minutes walk into the town) hotel which made for a great base to explore Granada.  It does offer paid parking but we managed to find a space in a street opposite; there is lots of free parking spaces but it appears most people don't move their car once they've got one. Our room was a good side with a big, comfy bed and great bathroom / shower. No tea / coffee (seems standard in Spain) but everything else we needed was available.  We didn't have breakfast (offered to us at €4.95) so can't comment on the food; the only real negative was the weak, flaky wifi - it didn't work well at all in the room.  The pool area is lovely and makes a great place to relax after a long day…

title: Central Hotel with Swimming Pool - lovely break
review: We stayed here for 8 nights for a proper Spanish break and what a good choice. The sun shone every day so we used the lovely, clean pool which had plenty of sun loungers, a nice little bar and towels you can change every day for a deposit of 10 euros. A beer round the pool costs 2.5.euros. Breakfast was nice with a choice of hot and cold items and lots of juices/hot drinks to choose from, fresh breads, fruit and pastries. We particularly liked the black cherries and serrano ham. Check in was fine, and there was no problem changing our room after finding our first one had a really noisy air con unit. The second room was more modern but smelt a bit smoky but this smell dissipated after a couple of days so it wasn't a big problem as we really liked the room, it being very clean,…

title: Lots of strong points but some weaknesses
review: Good location, good facilities, good room. Sofa bed for the family of 4 sleeping in one room was not ideal. Mattress was too thin. Breakfast buffet provided a good range but bacon and sausages were not great quality. Everything else was v good.

title: Very comfortable
review: We stayed here (two families with children) in August 2014.  The children loved the pool, we enjoyed the breakfasts and the stroll to the city centre for dinner.  The staff were all very helpful and all in all it was a very pleasant and comfortable stay

title: Great location
review: Stayed in hotel with my 3 children and hubby.   We were only there for a 2 night stay bit wished we were there longer.   The rooms were lovely and clean and the hotel has a great location for a stroll into the city centre.   Staff were very helpful and friendly.   Lovely breakfast.

title: Nice Hotel in a Beautiful City
review: Very good experience again, was my second stay. Nice big rooms, nice staff very helpful and friendly. Location is perfekt, very close to the Congresss Center, and also to the nice city center.  Breakfast price-quality perfect.  Highly recommended.

title: the people that make the difference
review: We had a very nice experience from this hotel, especially from the personnel! In particular Mrs Maria Marquez in the reception was very effective is solving every small problem we had. She made sure all our questions were answered with a wide smile and that our requests were met and made our stay very pleasant.The hotel is very clean and nicely decorated, the swimming pool has a beutiful design and the morning buffet is rich. Its location is very convenient, much closer to the center than what we though. Small details, such as free wifi and a (free of charge) terminal and printer in the reception, made our stay more comfortable but what really makes the difference in this hotel -as I mentioned- is the people, the personnel. They really made us feel as if we were with friends and…

title: Great location to discover  the city
review: Comfortable bedrooms. Attentive staff and excellent breakfast. parking for the car included in the rate is undoubtedly an asset in a city where parking is expensive.  great location to visit the city on foot.

title: Clean and good standard
review: Pool was good and walking to central Granada was easy with supermarket close by for collecting water and other supplies. Interesting moorish decor in modern building. My 2 complaints were the poor wifi signal (bad in the bedroom and nonexistent at the pool) and too few staff at reception where there always seemed to be a queue of people waiting to be served - so often I gave up and left. BedRoom was good and bathroom facilities good too.  Breakfast was standard hotel quality - a wide range of food and fruit and drinks but hot food was very limited and never varied. Friendly dining room staff quick to help. We did not try the restaurant. Easy to walk to tourist places from the hotel. Moorish country house close by (not much remaining but interesting) and science park.

title: excellent price/quality
review: In spite not be near to the center, the hotel is excellent and it not expensive for the services provided; free parking lot to customers; excellent meals; good bedrooms; the staff is helpfull. I defenitelly recomend it.

title: Just a one-night stop
review: Our recollections are that this hotel's style was Moorish with a contemporary twist.  The hotel does not seem to be very old.  The glass elevator cars on the outside of the building up to the top floors offer some pretty nice views.  The floors in the rooms were darker hued wood laminate and nicely done.  The furnishings were clean, contemporary, and the room, while not huge, was certainly spacious enough.  The rooms were quiet at night.
