The Moorish touches were evident in the pool area, the little pools outside the main entry area, and in little lantern details, etc.      Location-wise, we never explored on our own outside (we were part of a larger tour group).  We ate our meals downstairs in one of the banquet rooms and, again, no complaints.    Staff, for as little of an…

title: Excellent value
review: While the rooms are nothing special, the outside, the reception area and especially the pool area are quite appealing. 15' walk to the cathedral, 15' cab ride (8 euros) to the Alhambra. At $70/night, a bargain.

title: On paper, good, reality somewhat different
review: I echo some other reviews by saying that this hotel has all the makings of a really good place but it falls short. We were given 2 rooms that stank of smoke, were dreary and had broken furniture in them.The staff at reception could care less, just handed over another room key. I finally paid to upgrade and that room was fine. However, on using the shower, water went everywhere, leaking into the bedroom. At the pool, we requested towels & were asked for the ticket...I traipsed back to reception, paid €10 deposit for towels and got said ticket. Why was this information not given at check-in? WiFi coverage was brutal & I was just annoyed by this point. It all sounds so small and inconsequential but I would have made light of this in reviewing, had the response been different. I…

title: Could be a nice Place.
review: The front desk personnel were rude.  I got a room and when I was walking down the hall, I could smell the strong odor of smoke.  I open my room door and you can smell that someone had smoked in the room and the cleaning staff had spray a strong perfume to cover it up.  I asked for another room and was told that the hotel was full.  I tried to stay in the room but was gettting a headache.  Waiting till the front desk personnel switch and walk up and asked for another room, it took four more rooms before I got a smoke free room.  The pool is great but its next to a bus stop so you can hear the bus pull up and people being loud when they get out of the bus and while waiting for the bus.  A/C gets cold and the bathroom are nice.

title: Well recommended
review: I spent three nights in this hotel and all I can say it's really good value for money. The location is perfect, as it is located just outside the noisy area and still walking distance to the main attractions.  All clean, lovely pool, beautiful lift and modern rooms.  All in all it gave us a wonderful experience in Granada. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be back!

title: Lovely hotel
review: Visiting Granada for the first time on our way to Seville stopped overnight at this hotel which was excellent price included on site parking, easy to get around the city, rooms were excellent with comfortable bed, power shower. breakfast not so good very basic could have been better. Staff very helpful and polite.

title: Great location for car drivers, comfy spacious room - breakfast not great
review: Visiting Granada for a couple of days and travelling from the Cost-Del-Sol by car we had three main requirements 1) on site car park; 2) walking distance to the city centre; 3) outdoor swimming pool.The Hotel Saray seemed to tick all the boxes, looked good from the photos and had reasonable reviews on TP so we booked 2 nights (Mon & Tue) incl free parking and breakfast for £57/night.  The sat nav took us right there and with the new toll road only took about an hour from Malaga and had very light traffic and beautiful scenery for most of the trip. On arriving we parked in the underground car park (plenty of spaces but a little tight so watch out if you have a big car!) and caught the lift to the reception where we were met with a large, cool and well furnished reception area.…

title: Great place, friendly staff
review: Spent 2 weeks here, staff friendly and helpful even is you don't speak the language. Away from the center of the city but fun to walk different routes to get to center.  Food is great and nice place to watch the locals celebrate weddings.  Great place!

title: Really cool place
review: This hotel is a little walking distance from the main area but a must stay at! They had the best bed/pillows that I have ever slept on! We had a suite with a queen size bed and the shower was amazing! We also spent time at the pool which was very pretty and refreshing(water was a touch cold). It also had parking which came in handy seeing we rented a car. I would stay again in a heartbeat!

title: A bit more effort would make it very good.
review: The hotel looks so impressive.  It's in a great location, not far from the old town (walking distance).  It has a good pool, very reasonably sized rooms, comfy beds, good bathrooms.  The food isn't great but the bar staff are very attentive and make some good cocktails.  Unfortunately, though, the hotel (not just the rooms) has no ironing board or iron, which just seems daft in a 4 star hotel.  In the rooms, there's no bottled water (it was very difficult just to order a bottle of water in the hotel for some reason) and no tea or coffee making facilities.  This makes for good business for the hotel as you need to pay for laundry or for drinks, but it doesn't really make for an attentive, accommodating hotel.  Finally, the breakfasts, whilst good, were let down by one waiter who…

title: Interesting and  nice
review: We were there when they had a party on the plaza a block away and could not hear it when we got back to our room. This is a nice place to stay, good housekeeping and a professional staff, we really enjoied our stay.

title: A REAL FIND
review: The Saray was much better than I expected,  starting with very helpful reception staff. I had a big well set up room.  It rained heavily so I could not use the pool.  Bugger! It is not in the old city but close enough and quiet and safe.

title: The little extras would go a long way
review: Lovely hotel very clean and staff helpful location not directly in the hub but easy safe walking to shops and restaurants. The only complaint is the was no iron or ironing board or tea and coffee making facilities in the room. When traveling for weeks these little extras make a big difference.

title: Great hotel !
review: This is a great hotel, nearby the center of Granada - busses stop nearby, but by foot only a 5 minute walk.  Friendly staff, clean room, clean bathroom, wifi, safe, aso ...  Only : swimming pool is closed till mid June - and sometimes one of the 3 elevators might fail.

title: An enjoyable stay! Good option for accommodation in Granada.
review: We stayed at the Saray hotel in Granada for a night as part of our Globus guided tour, the “Iberian Vacation”. We travelled as a group of four and had two rooms booked. Our experience overall at the hotel was a pleasant one.  The Saray is part of a small chain of hotels, the Hoteles Santos chain. We had previously stayed at another member hotel of the chain, the Agumar in Madrid and were expecting the Saray to be fairly similar; not overly chic or luxurious, but perfectly functional. The hotel is fairly centrally located, a couple of minutes walk from the river which runs through town. Cross the river and on the other side you will find many of Granada’s biggest attractions as well as plenty of shopping and dining opportunities. There certainly are more centrally located options…

title: A little above average
review: Nice room, very clean. Staff not real friendly but I suppose they might get tired of dumb tourists questions. Hotel has a nice modern look from the front.Breakfast bar was good Only spent one night in Granada but would have liked to spent more.

title: Beautiful rooms and views!
review: This was the best hotel we stayed in while spending 3 weeks in Europe! It was very well located within walking distance to the city center and many attractions. This is important as Granada is hard to navigate via car. The views of the mountains and city from our hotel room were amazing! The room was clean and well kept. The bathroom was quite large for Europe and very nice! Our room was labeled non smoking but smelled very strongly of smoke, which was the only major downside.   Breakfast is expensive (there are two options), but was worth it for us since we had early plans and didn't want risk finding a place. Parking also is somewhat pricey, but again worth it for us to just park and not waste time looking for something less expensive.

title: Hotel Saray
review: I understand this is the only hotel in Grenada with a pool (?) and for us it made a serious difference. Grenada is very much a city and while I loved it the weather was beautiful and warm, (we travelled early May some days in the 30's others high 20's) so having the pool to relax by was a huge plus. Otherwise the feel of the hotel was one you would use for a work trip but large clean rooms and bedrooms. For me the pool made all the difference.. a visit to the Alhambra is a MUST... if you are driving yourself the one way system in Grenada is a nightmare and road signs are not the best in Europe.

title: Nice and Comfortable.
review: The Saray is well located with a comfortable frontage welcoming its guests.  Since we only spent one night in Granada, the hotel suited us very well since we were able to walk the proximity and had a good feel of the town.  Within the lobby of the hotel, the furnitures were well place to accommodate different small groups without interfering with each other.  There were also a comfortable bar which servicing the whole day.  The room was comfortable.  The only minor issue had to be the limitation and size of the elevators which tense to be bid slow in rush hours.

title: Saitsfactory hotel
review: For a 4-Star hotel we found the infrastructure quite sufficient. the rooms were large enough and the beds were comfortable. However try to ask for a room in the back of the building, not facing the street, for obvious reasons, especially if you like to open the windows during a hot night and not using the AC. The glass lift was very unusual, but quite exciting .....you had a nice view to the outside whilst going up or down. The breakfast was reasonably good, I appreciated the hot food, especially since we experienced in Spain lots of lukewarm food, if you had a buffet breakfast. if you are lucky, you will not eat with large bus groups, which sometimes (if not often) occupy the hotel for a day or two. However these are usually early risers and leave prior to 8 am. The staff was…

title: Good location
review: Just returned from a 4 day break staying at the Saray.  Would have given this a higher rating but sadly the young girl at the Reception was sour faced and unwelcoming, she gave us no  information on breakfast, information on the area maps etc in comparison to her colleague who was more than enthusiastic, after a long plane journey this was a little disappointing. The hotel itself was pleasant a little tired  in decor but very clean, and conveniently located with just a short 10 minute walk into the centre. Breakfast was the usual buffet fayre and plenty of it.  The glass elevators were a nice touch overlooking the pretty pools and tinkling fountains.  The bedroom was spacious well equipped with bathrobes, toiletries and hairdryer, maids were brilliant and thorough. We were told…

title: Great stay at The Saray
review: Dear Customer  I very much regret that attention by one of our receptionists may not have been a desired. In particular the attention of our personnel is one of the most highly valued aspects in our quality manual.  Furthermore we appreciate your positive comments about cleaning and quality of our installations.  Yours sincerely

title: Very good location & comfortable rooms
review: We were really impressed with this hotel. It's in a great location, close to the centre but not quite in it. The rooms were nice with a good bathroom. There is a really nice pool area, which is nice to lie around after a hard mornings sightseeing. The pool water was freezing, but refreshing! Staff also were very helpful and informative. If you are coming from the airport, it is about a two minute walk from the bus stop at the Plaza de Congress where the airport bus stops. It only costs 3 euros, which is a bargain.

title: Great Value and Location!
review: Really enjoyed our stay at the Saray - everything you need. You do need strong nerves to park in the car park but then parking seems to be a big issue in Granada. Gave up on trying to find street parking.

title: good value
review: I'm surprised with the extremely negative reviews, I didn't have any problems at this hotel. I liked the pretty quiet location and outside elevator, beautiful pools. I didn't find it far from the center of town, took me ten minutes or less to the park. I didn't have much interaction with the staff other than the front desk but they were friendly. I rated the hotel a five but lower five.

title: Comfortable stay
review: Dear Customer,  I appreciate your comments. We are pleased that the location and comfort of our facilities have been to your liking.  Yours faithfully

title: Definitely not a 4 star hotel!
review: Stayed here for one night on March 30th this year with my wife. Although it does look old, the room was spacious, clean, quiet and has a very cool comfortable temperature for sleeping. They do offer a good breakfast buffet. The lobby is spacious and the City Centre is not far away.

title: Unreasonable
review: The hotel website claims it is a 4 star hotel that is 5 min walk from city center but it is not! It is 15-20 min walk to the city center. Overall, the hotel looked old, lobby was ok, the rooms' size were good but no AC provided in March!! The response we got it is in the 40s at night...but the fact is the room get stuffy, we tried opening the windows but it is noisy outside because it is located on a busy street and the rooms overlook other buildings no privacy whatsoever. ..so that didn't work! No iron and ironing board in the room...but they will do it for a fee!! The free WiFi is horrible and you wait for ever to load. ..ended up using our data plan to make some reservations. ..beds very uncomfortable and stiff...can't comment on their food bec we didn't eat there. Paid…

title: Great Hotel, clean and good value for money
review: Dear Customer  firstly please accept my sincere apology in view of the dissatisfaction reflecting your comments   I regret that the situation of our hotel may not have been what you expected, because is just  a few minutes from the shopping center of the city (5-10 minutes) but there is effectively a long walk to the Alhambra, because,  as you were able to  verify the Alhambra is not located in the city center but rather on a hillside, it is recommended to go up in public transport   Our hotel has a centralized system of air conditioning and heating, and during the month of March and because of the night temperature does not exceed 10-15 degrees it is only available heating system. However, please accept my apology if the temperature in your room it was not the required for you   Our hotel has not Advertise or disposal to the customers and ironing  board as it appears you expected.   The WIFI system is complimentary and we are working to provide a premium wifi system, with a small cost for those customers who need a higher speed  One of the aspects most highly valued by our customers is the comfort and convenience of our beds and mattresses therefore I am sorry that your opinion is other  Remain, but rather thank you for your comments, because will definitely helping to improve the service and the attention to all our clients  Yours sincerely

title: Lack of customer service
review: the hotel is nice inside and well situated. The customer service however does not match the surroundings. It seems as though the management are more interested in instant profit than treating their clients well so that they return in the future. I am very dissappointed.

title: Good value for money
review: Dear Customer  I very much regret your comments about the service provided during your satay in our hotel  I would like to know what was the cause of your comments, for which I remain at your disposal in my mail: acampos@h-santos.es  Please accept my sincere apologies once again  Yours sincerely

title: Good hotel and close to the city!
review: Good value for money, though the stay was in February, so lower than usual rates were on offer. At the price there was nothing to complain about. The hotel has secure car parking at a reasonable price, the parking is very tight for a large car.

title: Perfect Hotel for business trip
review: The hotel is quite good situated, just 5 minutes walk, near to the city center. The hotel is fresh and clean and the staff friendly and speaks good English. The rooms are big and nice decorated with a lot of space, the bed was really nice to sleep in.

title: Very good well priced hotel
review: I stayed on Saray for 6 nights during my business trip to Spain. This is a 4 star property with beautiful rooms which are lit by natural light. The staff is very helpful and the rooms are very clean.  I made the booking from booking.com and the breakfast offered on the website was around 20 euros per day however it was available at 11 euros, not sure why? The breakfast was primarily american style and had ample options  Overall it was a nice stay at the hotel

title: Okay but remember the free parking
review: We have stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, not saying that I am forgetful but I booked the parking included in the price. Forgot about this so when I rushed into the hotel to ask where to park the car they told me it was 16 euros only to realise a day late that the parking is included.. Whoops. The rooms are clean and big, the breakfast is basic but if you are an avid tea British drinker ask for a jug of hot water.  The staff are fine and everything is easy to walk to.  Thanks

title: The horse Nightmare
review: The Hotel Saray has a bad location, the rooms were very dirty and very, but very noise. I couldn't sleep for two nights. The view was to tho this horrible project homes in Granada and the bed very unconfortable. The wi-fi they say they offer wasn't working for two day, the staff was very rude and the servant Sonia was a very rude and rough person. The hotel is very expensive and it entitle itself a 4 star, but in fact it should be only 1. The breakfast was a total disgrace. Bread, bread and more bread. TV was awful and the channels didn't work. I asked to change rooms and they said I couldn't change because they were too busy. The noise was everywhere. I do not recommend this hotel.

title: Very disappointing
review: Bit tired looking - parking garage from hell, which nevertheless costs a fortune - double bed was two singles pushed together. Continental breakfast is served in a separate little room with no sign, and if you go in the main dining room by mistake you get charged full hit. Horrible. Give this one a miss.

title: Very Attractive
review: We used this hotel as a springboard to visit  the Alhambra Palace.  Although staying only one night at this hotel with a tour group, I found this hotel very appealing as the grounds and gardens were most attractive and well kept.  Our rooms were well appointed.

title: Good value, comfortable hotel in good location if you have a car
review: We had a spacious, well equipped comfortable room and bathroom - very good value for money.  The hotel is a good 15 minute walk from the town centre but it's a good place to stay if you have a car because the parking is relatively cheap.  We tried the express breakfast which seemed like good value at first - but we feel that you are probably better off buying breakfast from one of the cafes outside the hotel.  We did eat dinner at the restaurant one night and while the food was reasonable, the drinks were expensive and you are better off eating outside.

title: Don't expect 4**** experience
review: Decent stay but far from a proper 4* star hotel. Not so top notch as it is presented on the photos, poor shower power, really terrible bed that caused me back pain, busy reception desk and general shabbiness all over. The architecture of the building is that of H letter so most of the rooms overlook parts of the building. Quite far from the town centre although a walk is not that bad -20-25 mins. We had parking included so that was convenient indeed as parking on the streets is quite a challenge. Ok for the cheap price, just don't expect it to be a proper 4 star as it's not.

title: Decent but not perfect
review: We chose this hotel, because from my search it seemed to be in a quiet area and it was one of the cheapest out of the 4 star hotels out there. It is in fact located in a quiet residential area and has some flaws that I expected from the low price tag.   Although I thought the walking distance from the hotel to the city center was a bit longer than I expected, I liked the location after all. The new years eve was absolutely quiet, to my surprise. Didn't hear a single shot of fireworks.  The room itself seemed to have been recently renovated, but the bathroom wasn't. It looked aged with a plenty of age spots. The towels were clean, but again old. Oddly, the maid didn't change our towels or empty the trash cans on the second day. I understand the towel part if it was to conserve…

title: Best value for money and very honest hotel
review: We checked in for two nights in Saray hotel so that we could spend a day visiting the Alhambra Palace in Granada. The hotel car park was very narrow and challenging to maneuver in, but we were comforted that it was almost fully packed with cars. Check-in was efficiently done; we had a little difficulty logging into the internet initially, but the receptionist was very helpful to get us connected. The room was small but clean and adequate, and I loved the 5 different types of pillows made available for our use. Having just come from a much more expensive hotel, I really appreciate the fact that for 50 Euro a night, we had a comfortable room so close to Granada town centre. I accidentally forgot to lock my safe into whichever I left quite a bit of cash, but returning after a full…

title: Unpleasant stay
review: My wife and I stayed here for one night as part of an Insight Vacations group tour. There was no air conditioning and the room temperature was around 26 degrees Celsius from the afternoon sun. Hotels in Spain should adjust to global climate change and leave their central air conditioning on in November.  The room we had, was small, old and needs refurbishment (see photos). Opening the window meant that the apartment dwellers next door (around 20 metres away) could see into our room. The included breakfast was mediocre.

title: Mixed feelings - fine for a quick stay but don't expect much
review: I'll admit there are some very nice things about this hotel, but equally there are bad things. The room itself was larger than expected and very clean. Our air-con worked fine, however my parent's room was overly hot the entire stay. Breakfast was a war zone - there were coaches of people arriving and departing during the busy breakfast period. Coffee was sometimes served by staff and other times you had to get your own - and queue for 15 minutes. The breakfast buffet was not very good, there was not even fresh Orange Juice in n area where orange trees are everywhere. The pool was freezing but that was expected, however the staff were not very friendly when asking for a towel... and this took 20 minutes to arrive. We also experienced a power outage one night at 3am which again…

title: A warm unpleasant stay
review: We were part of a tour group ...  Nice hotel, at first glance.  The lobby was very nice and had the Moorish feel to it.   But, when you got to the room things changed from a positive impression.  There was no air conditioning.  A technician came up and advised that there was a problem but that we should leave on the fan and open the window for ventilation.  Later we found out that Spanish law that allows hotels to turn off aid conditioning after mid-Oct.  Since it was a very warm day, no air was a problem.   Some of Australians in our group, indicated that they had trouble sleeping due to the lack of air conditioning or circulation of any level of air.  The short glass wall on the tub was not sufficient to keep water off the floor during shower which made for slip/trip hazards…

title: Reasonable hotel
review: Very reasonable hotel, not far away from all the attractions .... Food is OK, price is OK, service is OK.  Not a romantic place, but reasonable. For the romance just leave the hotel head to the Alhambra, the old city - and there are lots of charming little restaurants in between.

title: Glad we returned!
review: This was our second visit to Granada, and we decided to stay at the Saray again. We were not disappointed. We had a very comfortable and pleasant time at this hotel, just like the first time. The room was clean and free wifi was available. The pool was great, but don't forget to get a ticket from the reception area first if you wish to use a towel! The hotel is close to the city center and tourist attractions. Breakfast was good, compared with other hotels in Spain.

title: Good Hotel - Breakfast less so......
review: We stayed just one night in Granada at this hotel which we booked online.  We were offered breakfast as our booking was room only - there were 2 types Express (around 4.95 euros) and Buffet (around 11.95 euros) the difference was the hot service.  We opted for the buffet but were very disappointed as the 'hot' food was cold by the time you got it to your table, cold sausages, egg etc.  Top Tip - opt for the Express breakfast as that was what we ended up eating the most! Apart from breakfast the hotel is lovely - you do pay to park in the underground car park - around 16 euros but that seems fairly standard for Spain.

title: Good Room
review: We stayed here for one night as part of a coach tour and were generally very happy with hotel, particularly the well appointed room.  Our meals were included and proved to be be excellent with the only negative being the staff who could do with some people skills. Location was excellent and was within walking distance of all major attractions, bars and restaurants. WiFi was free but intermittent and all other amenities were good.

title: Good hotel
review: We stayed there one night while visiting La alhambra at Granada. Fairly new hotel with great lobby and lifts. Room was clean and neat. Sleep quality was good. Good and free wifi available in rooms. Good and friendly staff. Breakfast was good.

title: Good one night stay
review: Stayed for one night as part of coach tour and, although brief, it was a nice hotel, good clean room and fitted the bill very well. Good selection at breakfast and staff friendly and efficient. As mentioned by other reviewers, it does seem to be a popular hotel with coach tours.

title: good location, let down by reception and bar staff
review: Stayed here early September for 8 days half time business half time holiday.Rooms good size , kept very clean like the public areas of the hotel. Breakfast good and plenty of variety. Great pool area which is used for weddings & business receptions.  However, apart from 1 female receptionist who was pleasant the other receptionists and bar staff were unfriendly, unhelpful and down right rude for even the most basic requests , 9pm at the bar asked for 2 beers please barman very grumpy , after this happened several times over first few days we just gave up and went out. We do speak some Spanish ,The distinct impression is that the guests are a nuisance, not just us but other people as well. Shame because hotel generally good  Lots of overnight coach parties so banging door early…

title: good hotel just let down by one thing.
review: This hotel was really very good. Very clean, the bedrooms were a good size. The city centre was 15 minutes walk away but there were buses and taxis which were cheap enough if you didn't want to walk. The pool area was lovely but unfortunately it was raining so we didn't get chance to use it. The breakfast was good, plenty of everything.  The only downside we found was the lack of helpfulness in the restaurant at night. The first night we were there we got so tired of waiting to be served that we left and went to a restaurant down the road. Apart from that the hotel was very comfortable and I would definitely stay there again.

title: Location good, very busy hotel
review: Nice Moorish architecture. Not much English understood. Lots of bus groups are in and out overnight, so busy turnover at breakfast.  About a 10-15 minute walk into town.  I was here for business and it was a little noisy at night.  There is no insulation between rooms and very hard beds.  I will stay across the river next time closer to town centre.

title: Cracking Hotel
review: We got an excellent deal on Booking.com for a 2 night stay and were very impressed with the hotel.  It has an impressive frontage and the reception area is smart and stylish.  We had a room on the third floor and had no problems with the size, comfort and cleanliness.  The pool area is very attractive and nicely enclosed, in fact you would not think that you were in a major city.  Express breakfast is available for a small charge and would be adequate for most people.  We had lunch at the hotel on the final day and that was excellent.  The hotel is ideally located, only a short walk to the main centre of Granada and the sightseeing bus stops a few minutes away.  The hotel also has an underground car park which is reasonably priced.  Overall, thoroughly recommended.

title: Loved to have stayed longer
review: Checked in as part of tour group and left early following morning. Loved to have stayed longer but not so unfortunately. So review based on short duration stay. Very palatial, modern amenities hotel, exterior glass lift looking down into swimming pool. Very nice room. Wifi ( most important for me) worked well. Breakfast was lavish and wide range of pastries, breads and hot foods. Staff were very pleasant.

title: Good property, poor service
review: Had a great room for an overnight stay on a bus tour here. Room was all functional with very good air conditioning. Pool was great in the afternoon heat but their towel collection system needs work. To actually find the pool only to be told to go back to reception to get a ticket for the towel that is right in front of you is an unnecessary pain. Either staff  have no idea of service in the pool area or management is not worried about quality control in this area. Very slow and unaccommodating service. Buffet breakfast was fine.

title: Very comfortable (but quiet)
review: We stayed at the end of August for two nights (visiting the Alhambra) - got a reasonable deal through Booking.com. It's a very comfortable hotel with a Moorish feel. Nice swimming pool although somewhat surrounded by orangey-coloured hi-rise buildings of which this hotel is one.  The rooms were fine - comfy beds, annoyingly laboursome TV selection process (but no BBC! Only a Chinese news channel extolling the many virtues of the country).  Breakfast was poor - two choices at 5 and 11 euros (wioth little to choose between them) -nasty orange juice.  It was very very quiet - hardly anyone in the lobby or at breakfast.  No gym much to the disgust of my sons.  It's about 10 minutes walk to the town centre. Book car parking beforehand - one of those stressful foundation lots... …

title: Nice hotel
review: I am staying here for two weeks, being enrolled in a language course. I saw a recent review, and do not really understand. To me the staff seems to fulfill exactly what I would or could expect. My room is a classic hotel room. I had to tell the lady not to change all my towels every day. The swimming pool is exactly what you expect it to be. The food? Breakfast(included for me) is just good, not excellent. Here, I would expect fresh orange juice, and, sorry, their bacon is not like what you would get in London. Had two evening meals here...and will look outside for a nicer experience. But really not expensive . Situation? A 10 minute walk to my school, or to the shopping areas. Maybe the previous person commenting on this hotel did not try a "buenas Dias" or "que tal" when…

title: Do NOT stay here...
review: First and foremost the staff are incredibly rude and unhelpful, they make you feel as though you should be grateful to be allowed to stay there. They clearly have no training in customer service or hospitality of any description. The WIFI does not work (a shoulder shrug was the only explanation given), the lift rarely works (hotel has 7 floors), and the room service finishes extremely early. The bar man nearly had a fit when I requested a coffee to take up to my room, promptly swiping the jug of milk away in fear I might try use it all. Please go elsewhere for your money's worth, there are some wonderful, less expensive hotels in Granada.

title: Lovely hotel
review: We visited Granada in 2011 for a week and this hotel was great. Rooms were modern and stylish, big beds, flatscreen TV, and a clean and spacious en-suite. The pool was definitely the best feature of this hotel, situated in a lovely outdoor area, and perfect for cooling off after a morning of sightseeing in the Spanish sun. The hotel is located just outside the immediate centre of Granada, it was around a 10-15 minute walk down a straight road to all of the major squares, restaurants, and attractions. Would gladly visit again.

title: Great hotel and pool.
review: We stayed for 7 nights at the Saray hotel and had a wonderful visit. The hotel is close enough to town to be able to access all of the great bars and restaurants but far enough away to avoid the hustle and bustle of the city. The pool is excellent and not too over-crowded with lots of space in the sun or shade. The weather in August is extremely hot so it makes it difficult to do the sightseeing so the pool was a great facility to have! Loved Granada and the hotel - would recommend both thoroughly.

title: A very good hotel.
review: First of all it is easy to find and we were ale to park underground to keep the car cool. Secondly the stifling heat outside was relieved by the cool hotel's lobby with moorish details and the very kind staff. We took the amusing outdoor elevators to our floor and changed and rested. We had a quick lunch at a tapas bar on the Tapas route of Granada (yes there is!) and then came back to cool down in the pool and siesta. The beds are comfortable and you have a choice of pillows. Much appreciated! The blackout curtains were useful in the 38 degrees Celsius sun. The breakfast was very plentiful and varied. We loved Granada and the Hotel Saray helped greatly.

title: Nice but could really do better
review: This is my third stay at the Hotel Saray, based on a combination of previous visits (great location with parking) and consistently good reviews.  The hotel is, in itself, very nice; it is modern but with with traditional decor, reasonable sized rooms (although not to accommodate more than two adults and a baby at a push - personal experience) and a nice pool and bar.  However I think the staff really need to look into its service, especially when it comes to the pool. Why, after 4 years is there the same rude man dealing (or not dealing with) towels and drinks (certainly NOT safety)? Why is it so ridiculously complicated to get a towel that actually many hotel guests go out and buy their own towels to save the grief they get in trying to do something that most other decent…

title: Splendid!
review: Our family stayed there for two nights in July, for visiting Granada and Alhambra. The hotel is brilliant for families with small children, travelling through. Pool-area very good (kids can swim). Pool-restaurant is not worth visiting however - the food is not good. The hotel as a perfect location, when you both want a bit of Granada down-town, easy access to transport and short (taxi) distrance to Alhambra. The hotel has an alternative breakfast-concept that more hotels should offer as well - the express-breakfast. Low cost, some coffee and pastries and chilled drinks. We don't have a grand appetite in the morning, and value this breakfast-option very much. For those who wants big breakfast, they serve this as well. Finally; we forgot an item in our hotel-room-safe upon…

title: Loved Saray
review: We traveled with Insight Tours.  The rooms were assigned to us.  my wife and I were very happy with the room .  the location of the hotel was fabulous.  ll staff were most accommodating.  English was spoken at the desk which was important for getting directions and assistance.

title: holiday
review: We stayed 2 nights in this excellent 4star hotel we found the hotel ataf very freindly and helpfull  and every thing was good for my  wife who is diabled food was good the parking you had to pay for but it is underground and card controled which makes the car safe and secure, a taxi ride to the alhambra palace ect was cheap and swift and conveniant , so all mod cons including a good swimming pool.

title: Nice hotel, great location
review: There are not many hotels with pools in Granada, this is clean, neat and well looked after. The rooms are large enough and well appointed and the pool area is nice with a bar and a pretty good value lunchtime menu. You are only a 5 mins walk from some fantastic bars and restaurants in town and really I can not find anything wrong with this place. The only think I would say is that we paid 16 euros a day for parking but it looks like you can leave the car on the street outside if you wanted to save some money

title: Nice hotel - would stay here again.
review: Stayed here for one night - no problems at reception with check in/out.  We had a rental car so parked it in the underground hotel parking.  The  parking cost about 16 euros for the day.  When we checked out the next morning, we asked if we could leave the car in the parking lot until late afternoon (so we could continue sight seeing)  and they had no problems with this and didn't charge us which was great!  If you are from Canada or the U.S., you might find parking to be a little bit tricky as the spots are quite tight ..  The Saray is located in a quiet residential area, about a 15 minute walk to the town centre.  Our room was a nice size and clean.  We didn't get to use the pool but it looked inviting.

title: Great atmosphere and wonderful hotel design
review: This is an exquisite hotel. Your ride to the room is an outside glass enclosed elevator. Although I did not have time to use the pool it looked extremely inviting, the design and layout is so intriguing. No face cloth, hair conditioner, or lotion is provided and like most European hotels you must use the card to obtain electricity. One of my issues is that they use a TV alarm to wake you up, as I would prefer a telephone call.  Free WiFi in the hotel room with your own equipment.  Another problem was, you have to get in the shower to turn on the water and I would prefer to test the temperature of water prior to entering the shower. The air-conditioning system had an extremely loud fan all night long. However dinner at this hotel was very well presented and tasty.  Breakfast,…

title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review: We spent two nights here while visiting Granada.  The room was very nice, clean, and modern.  The staff was very helpful with local information.  They had a nice pool with a bar.  As others have stated, this is very similar to an American hotel with it's amenities.  I would compare it to an Embassy Suites.  We had dinner and breakfast, and both meals were very good.  I would definitely stay here again!

title: Good choice
review: Hotel looked nice with glass elevators and good views when riding up. There was also a pool which we didn't have time to use. Looked inviting. Within walking distance to downtown.  The room itself was a decent size with good beds. Free wifi was included but didn't work in our room. We had to go out to the elevator and sit on the chairs there before we had reception. It also worked in the lobby downstairs. It would have been nice to have worked in our room.  The insulation seemed especially thin at this hotel. We could hear everything in adjoining rooms including every time someone turned the water on or flushed a toilet. It was annoying and worse than any other hotel we stayed in.  The breakfast buffet was ok, not great, but the coffee was the worst we encountered. There was a…

title: Nice hotel
review: Very easy to reach with a car. Nicely decorated rooms and great pool area. Good service. We hadn't booked breakfast in advance. They had an offer for booking breakfast for three days and paying for two so the breakfast was only 16€/day for a gamily of four. Wifi was often very slow and the bacon was raw in breakfast buffet. Other than those two things, great place to stay. Tip: if you have a car. Drive to sierra nevada. Awesome views. Restaurant tip: Il Gondoliere

title: trip
review: We stayed at the Saray on our first trip to Granada, we had booked the hotel through our travel agent who didnt actually know the hotel, we were very impressed with it, the room was excellent, with WiFi and kingsize bed a lrage room and bathroom we couldnt fault it, the a/c was first rate. The hotel had car parking and a pool which as the temperature was 37c was most welcome. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was a buffet and very good with lots of choice including hot, we will definately stay again.

title: Clean and comfortable
review: We stayed here for one night while on a tour.   Our room was very clean with a wooden floor, a desk, fridge, lots of mirrors & a very comfortable king size bed.  The bathtub was small with a shower over the bath and no shower curtain or screen so there was no way to stop the floor getting wet a bit wet while showering.    The breakfast was reasonable although quite crowded with tour groups.

title: Better then I expected
review: This is a modernized moorish themed Hotel. Our room was very modern with twin beds that actually had sheets that fitted and were tucked in and did not come out. The Wifi works by the desk, but is not very strong. The Bathroom had all of the good amenities. My only complaint is that the wood floors felt doldrums so some area rugs would have been nice. Overall I was happy with the experience after 18 days of very mediocre Hotels that over promised and under delivered.

title: Beautiful Hotel, central and good facilites
review: Ok so i should point out that we have given 4 and not less because we understand that sometimes theres never a good time to do things - other travellers may not have been as understanding to wake up on their first morning to see the pool being drained and then under repair for the entirety of our stay. Regardless the moorish inspired hotel is beautiful and in keeping with its history has running water as a central focus.  The high ceilings further the moorish feel.  Staff are friendly and helpful.  This caters for corporate groups during the week and tourists and locals from region on weekends.  This means the pool is usually free all day during the week which is great particularly as rates can fall during start of the week.

title: Pleasant stay at Arabic influenced Spanish hotel in Granada.
review: Not a bad stay- decent location and professional courteous service. Great pool and outdoor lounge area. Glass elevators were on the slow side, but otherwise no complaints. Went as part of a tour group and not a far drive from the city of Toledo. Walking distance to restaurants and open park, public transportation.

title: Great option if travelling by car! Nice hotel however you get there
review: We like to stay in places that reflect a location & at first our pick was a "self-catering" place in Sacramonte - something I'm going to try another time. But after reading reviews of how bad parking is in that area, we decided to go with the Saray which was offering an excellent hotel-web page special on room + parking. Our concern that it was "outside the historical town" proved groundless.  It is a quick 10 minute walk to the Cathedral on either of two major (and pleasant) streets (one takes you past three beautiful fountains, the other past some good options for breakfast or dinner). Getting to the hotel from the main road is not difficult at all with GPS. Frankly, when I actually saw the other hotels I had considered for Granada, I was very thankful we'd picked the Saray! …

title: agree with all the TA excellent reviews
review: We stayed here with a tour group.  The front desk service was pleasant and efficient, rooms clean and comfortable, breakfast buffet very good.  The most memorable features are the glass elevators with the neat views of surrounding town and mountains.  Taxi service in Granada is excellent and reasonable.

title: Comfortable rooms and good service
review: I stayed here for just one night while visiting Alhambra. The rooms are quite comfortable and some offer a great views of the Sierra Nevada. Service at reception and at the bar was also good. Pool was welcome as daytime temp was about 30 Celsius. 10 min stroll to downtown. Overall a good choice for staying in Granada.

title: Nice hotel, good service
review: I was very impressed with the Hotel Saray. Very nice rooms, pretty Moorish influenced decor and nice rooms. I was most impressed because the first room we were placed in smelled of cigarette smoke (I'm allergic) and they were wonderful and prompt in getting into a nicer room. The rooms were quiet and well appointed and the food at their cafeteria was good. Yes, I would stay there again!

title: OK but location not so great for the Al Hambra
review: Room was hot but bed was comfortable. Reception not too helpful.  Breakfast uninspiring. Some problems with Internet. Longish cab ride to Albacin area and Al Hambra. Difficult to charge electronics - no outlets near the bed.

title: Moorish Styled Luxury
review: The architecture of the hotel and interior decoration has Moorish influence.  Exterior facing glass-walled elevators would take you up to your floor.  The room was reasonably spacious and modern, dominated by a large mirror.  The bathroom was plain, not big but quite alright.    The hotel lobby is very large leading down to the impressive grounds and pool facilities.  Located about 20 minutes walk from town centre.  Would definitely be happy to stay here again

title: Spacious and luxury
review: The reception area is very impressive. Glass fronted elevators. The rooms have high quality furniture extremely comfortable beds. Comfy pillows and extra pillows in the wardrobe. Location wise it was a 15 minute walk to the centre    I have to say this was are ally impressive hotel. I could not fault anything about it. Good value also

title: Excellent and interesting hotel. But is it going down a bit?
review: Very nice and special hotel, in nice Moorish style. All quite spacious. Very good service e.g. at the reception. Good restaurant; some interesting bars and restaurants nearby too. Spacious underground parking, which is a bit expensive. This hotel has been my favourite in Granada for many years. But I have the impression it gets in need some minor renovation or refreshing now.

title: Easy to reach friendly hotel
review: This hotel was easy to find, with parking. It was really convenient to walk into the centre of Granada, whilst my friends went Skiing. The staff were all friendly and happy to help. The hotel had central heating, which came as a very welcome surprise. The rooms were snug and cosy.

title: nice relaxing and not to far far away from the center
review: we have stayed for just a night and it was very comfortable, we came just a tick before the normal check in time but where able  to access the room strait away. we had one little problem with the safe in the room but that was sorted very quickly by a  friendly maintenance staff member. the room it self was spacious nice and modern with free wifi. the reception staff at check in and check out had been very friendly and professional and could have not helped any more during our stay.

title: Sarah hotel
review: Greeting at reception less than warm, room only had 3 single beds though had booked a family room clearly with 2 adults and 2 kids. Told at reception there was no option for a fourth bed of any kind. Phone in room didn't work, though they did fix it. Room was incredibly hot (February ) and the air conditioning didn't work at all. Woken at 5.00 am by noisy guests in a nearby room. The general decor and cleanliness was good but disappointing compared to four star hotels I have stayed in previously.

title: Acceptable hotel but nothing to crow about
review: I stayed at this hotel for one night as part of a tour group.  The hotel room is good sized and clean, although the hotel appears a bit run down and can do with some refurbishment. It is located about 15 mins walk to the town center so it's not the most convenient.  Overall, I would rate it as an acceptable hotel for a short stay.

title: Fantastic Hotel
review: Loved it! Excellent, peaceful & big clean rooms. Location is walking distance to town (10 min) Helpful and friendly staff, nice pool and relaxing area – pool closes at 8pm if I remember correct and opens at 8am. Breakfast was great with full buffet which we liked and not expensive at all. Internet access is free and to get access details speak to reception staff. Short trip to Alhambra Palace

title: Full satisfaction
review: This hotel is almost a 5 - really good. The location is walking distance to downtown (10-15 min), but not directly there; one must be aware - next to the hotel, it's just the convention center + a residential area. We found friendly staff. A good alternative to the reasonably priced full breakfast buffet is the small continental breakfast (rolls + butter + coffee)  at the bar/cafeteria for the people who like to sleep in, starting from 10 am . We liked that.  The internet access is free but fidgety to get it to work, and not very stable. You must get access details at  the reception. Parking is narrow but convenient, at a solid price (EUR 18,- / night) Great, quiet, very clean rooms.

title: excellent hotel
review: stayed 3 nights at the hotel booking in was fine parking under the hotel was good but needs to be pre booked if not booking with the hotel direct. We found the staff friendly and efficient. The room was well equipped clean and comfortable. Breakfast was a good hot and cold buffet. The position is well situated near but not too near the centre. we stayed  over the three kings period and caught the procession at the bottom of the road. Over all a very enjoable stay

title: Acceptable room but very poor service
review: I agree with many of the less favourable reviews. Parking was very difficult. Reception was poorly organised and we were left feeling the staff were rude. Be warned - they insist on scanning your passport on check in. We did not have ours as left them with relatives in another city -I hadn'trealised you need a passport to travel within Spain. Receptionist was not helpful at all on this issue and threatened to call the police. You can easily walk to the city centre. Breakfast is normal hot and cold buffet. Room was clean and modern.

title: Pleasant stay
review: A nice hotel, albeit a bit far from the center. The first room we got was a bit dark (#308) and not sufficiently ventillated, but the next day we got a room with a view, which worked much better. The hotel offers a buffet lunch and dinner  for 14.90 euros, which is a fair deal as well as convenient, though not a culinary highlight. The staff is helpful, though I wouldn't take their offer for a guided tour to the Alhambra; it is fairly easy to do it on one's own, and third the price.

title: Gorgeous and close to town
review: This hotel is absolutely gorgeous from the street, and the lobby is also lovely with Moorish architecture.  We stayed as part of a Globus tour and were quite impressed.  We were only here for 1 night and would have liked to stay longer.   Our room was nice and clean.  The beds were comfortable, and the room was nicely sized. The hotel was walking distance to groceries and to many restaurants in town.  The breakfast was nice.  Eggs, meat, cheese, bread, pastries, cereal, yogurt, fruit, etc.  We didn't use the pool but it looked very nice.

title: A modern take on moorish architecture
review: We booked a room for one night, and loved the hotel (and Granada ) so much that we stayed three. A modern take on the Alahmbra - Moorish architectural influences with fountains everywhere. helpful front sesk staff helped us with a few problems of our own making, and organised secure on-site  car parking - most necessary in Spain.  A large  sparkling clean, sunny room with all the necessary features plus free wi-fi. Excellent vast bathroom.The pool area was very good with a small bar, and a friendly barman. Breakfast was the only disppointment - not particularly interesting and expensive.  The location is excellent ; a ten minute walk to the centre of town and the stop for the open-top tourist bus. Highly recommended.

title: Surly staff
review: Beautiful building and great location just a shame about the staff.  Surly and unhelpful.  If you are female don't even try to get the barman to serve you. Breakfast prices and arrangements very complicated so make sure you know what you are paying for. If you can avoid the staff and don't use the catering facilities it's great.

title: Could do with a revamp of our room
review: Hotel can at best be described as only average due to the need for a revamp of the bathroom. The grout was missing in many places and in others was quite discoloured with age.  We were in room 608 . This is unfortunate that I have to rate this hotel as average as I have never had such a choice of pillows available in the room itself, and the breakfast was lovely. The scrambled eggs were the best I had tasted in Spain.  Bed was comfortable, window opened allowing good supply of fresh air.  Free wifi worked well in the room.

title: Granada - Moorish influences
review: We stayed at this hotel for only one night as part of a group tour. The lobby has a very Moorish influence about it as does the landscaping and pool area which is exactly what I was hoping to see. Our room was quiet and comfortable, safe was working well and appreciated, bathroom was fine. The pool area looked very inviting and I was longing to spend some time there, however the many attractions of Granada and the short time we had meant that I missed this. We ate at the hotel buffet in the evening as it was convenient as we had already done a lot of walking that afternoon, however you could easily walk about ten minutes to the city for other choices. A group of musicians entertained guests in the dining area in the evening, playing well known Spanish tunes, including, of…

title: Beautiful pool area
review: We stayed at this hotel as we were with a tour group. The room was nice and the air conditioning worked well. It was clean and comfortable but not overly memorable.  It is in a good location to get into the town and walk to find restaurants.  The pool is very nice as is the Lobby bar. The summers are very hot in Seville so it is nice to have a cooling dip! We liked the Morrish feel to the place. We found the Lobby Bar staff did not want to take cash so we had to sign on our room. Also, the tv sets are the alarm clocks and many people in our tour group could not find how to turn off the alarm and ended up unplugging the set to stop it!

title: Good Location
review: The location of this hotel is ideal, close to the centre, but quiet area, stayed in a very modern double room, very clean, breakfast good but a liitle over priced, we were on motorcycles and the hotel charged us for 2 parking although we only took up one space.  Did not eat in the hotel because of the location to the centre. make sure you visit the Ski resort in the mountians even if its summer, the views are outstanding.  booked using Booking.com fantastic price paid for a very good hotel in the centre of town. although, the reception did not spaek much english, and i not much spanish we maganged.   would stay again,

title: Great Pool and ambiance
review: We stayed for a night at this place. Pretty comfortable rooms. Lobby is nice. Pool is really nice with the sandwich/quick snack shop. Hotel has its own garage for parking. There is charge for parking in the garage but its safer than parking on the street. From the hotel you can either take a quick cab ride or bus to the Al-Hambra palace.  Family friendly lodging option.

title: Lovely hotel, wonderful staff, great value!
review: My friend and I just got back from an awesome 4 night stay at the Hotel Saray.  We booked this hotel as it's one of the few in Granada with a pool, as we knew we would need to cool down after being out in the sun each day. The staff were always really friendly and kind to us. They helped us on numerous occasions with directions and ordering taxis for us. Our room was cleaned every day.   The only thing which might have improved our stay was if the pool was heated, so we could go in it in the morning. (It was not heated so we were only brave enough to go in after 12 noon each day once the sun had heated it). The reception staff were really great at helping us, e.g for booking things to do. From their reception, we booked the Al Hamman arab baths (highly recommended), and an…

title: Very poor service
review: The hotel is very average and the staff are hopeless - verging on rude. Would not advise that anyone stay here. Without doubt the worst hotel I stayed in while I was in Spain for 16 days. I wish i could think of at least one thing I liked about the hotel - my stay here nearly ruined my visit to Granada.

title: did not like it at all
review: I stayed here just for one night with a group and was very happy to leave.Reception staff was unhelpul and rather indifferent.Clerk on duty did not pay any attention to us, happily chatting away with someone else who did not look like a client, when we tried to ask a question. When we asked for a recommendation, we never got one.  Half of our group's keys did not work and had to be reprogrammed, sometimes more than once.My non-smoking room REEKED of tobacco. After complaints we were moved to another room, however it still was kind of smelly. Several of my group companions also suffered from strong smells in their rooms. While there is a lovely pool on premises, it's ladders were shaky and did not feel safe. Breakfest food was not impressive.

title: A bit dated but generally OK
review: The hotel is not particularly central so expect a 10/15 minute walk to the bars and restaurants.After a nightmare drive negotiating major roadworks in the centre of Granada it was a huge relief to be able to park in the hotel car park(50 euros for 3 nights)The hotel is a bit tired looking but was basically OK.We were told that pool towels were available for a 20 euro a towel deposit,however they were freely available in the pool area when we visited.We did not eat in the hotel so we are unable to comment on food standards.

title: A good option for a stay in Granada
review: Stayed for a couple of nights whilst visiting friends. The location of the hotel on the outskirts of the city centre is very convenient and much of what you want to see, including the famous Alhambra, is within reasonable walking distance. The room we stayed in, although not luxurious, was perfectly acceptable and well equipped with minibar and combination safe. The air conditioning was perhaps not as effective as it could have been though, and there were a couple of maintenance issues (broken light fitting and power socket) which should have been noted during regular housekeeping. Bedding and towels were changed daily. The pool area is really nicely done and a very pleasant place to sit and relax, and there are echoes of the Moorish style of the Alhambra throughout the garden…

title: Awful service, dated hotel.
review: We definitely echo previous comments about unhelpful and rude staff. In order to get pool towels we first went to an unmanned pool bar that gave an extension to call for assistance but no phone in sight, went to reception who told us there was a 20 euro deposit, went back to our room for the money, went back to reception and was given two vouchers for towels and was told to go back to the pool bar to get towels despite my insistence there was nobody there, went back to the empty pool bar, went back to reception who still told me I was wrong and that somebody should be there, reception subsequently told me to go to the main indoor bar to ask for towels, there the bartender told me he did not have towels and to go back to the pool bar, went back to the empty pool bar and listened…

title: Nice hotel, good value although a little out of the way.
review: We stayed here for 4 nights in August. The hotel was really nice. Reception staff were helpful, rooms were cleaned every day, breakfast was nice. The pool area was greatly appreciated in the 44 degree heat, although may be in need of updating. The hotel wasn't quite as central as we thought it would be, it was a good 10-15 min walk to the centre, however the walk to the plaza neuva is well worth it with lots of bars, restaurants and little Moroccan style shops.

title: Good room, good pool, awful service
review: We stayed here for 5 nights and the room and pool area were always clean and what we wanted. The location is also good, maybe 10minute walk from the centre. However the only negative was the attitude of reception staff (only one not all) who was incredibly rude and disinterested.  Otherwise perfectly fine hotel.

title: Great night in Granada thanks to booking.com and the receptionists
review: We stayed in this hotel for a night before going on a trip on my husband's birthday. We booked the room at booking.com and we got an excellent price.  When we arrived at the hotel, we mentioned that would appreciate a room in a higher floor (to have views to the mountains and be able to get fresh air at night), a spacious room because of the suitcases far away from lifts or other sources of noise. The receptionists were great and they gave us a couple of rooms to choose from. We saw them and decided on the one we liked the most!  For those of you who don't know Granada, from this place (next to Palacio de Congresos, you can get buses to the city centre without any problem).  It was great because of the great price we got online and the kind receptionists!

title: Poor service
review: We were welcomed with a que at reception & an incorrect booking that was of little interest to staff. The hotel had a 4 star rating but that must have been least 10 years ago. The rooms are dated, the complex is plain & the processes are antiquated.

title: Excellent value
review: A lovely hotel, beautifully decorated with great rooms and wifi throughout . The staff were extremely helpful, especially with some documents we had to scan and send by fax - they could not have been kinder! Great situation, easy to walk to the centre in about 10 minutes but also 2 bus routes to the centre almost on the doorstep. Lovely swimming pool too. We have been to Granada several times before in different hotels but would certainly recommend this one. We loved it.

title: Accetable room but very bad reception staff
review: Room was small and ok, their dining bad. But breakfast was very good. Staff very unhelpful in the reception!! They demanded us to show our passport, we think it;s enough with identity cards like a driving license.  Not much more more to say, the place seemed to be very short in staff.

title: Great hotel!
review: We stayed at the Saray with two children (ages 7 and 4).  The room was fine for the 4 of us - a little tight but we didn't spend much time in the room!  The pool was a so refreshing considering how hot it was in Granada while we were there, but very deep for little children.    Lots of tours do come through here, but we weren't bothered by any noise or crowding at the pool.  The location is great.  We walked to everything from here and if we got too tired by the end of the day we just hopped in a taxi to get back.  The only thing we wished we had was a balcony, but no complaints at all.  Even the breakfast was quite good - the only time we were give a big pot of coffee to share!

title: One night special
review: Service is. It up to 4 stars Xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx                                        Old infrastructure                                        xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx                                                                                    Great WIFI.                                        xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxdxxxxxxxdxddddd Terrible check in and terrible garage.  Xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

title: big hotel
review: It is good hotel with big rooms, clean, comfortable, good breakfasts and nice persons on the reception. But we where when in Granada was childrens sammet. There were a lot of children and touristic groups there. It was impossible to sweem in the swimming pool (which was nice), becouse children jumped in it (I was afraid that they brake my bag). At the same time there were 56 children in the pool and more than 56 around it!!!! In all the ways ranada is very nice city there a lot af places to go (not only Alhambra, also Monastery of St. Jerome, Monastery Kartuha, caves ....)

title: Great Value
review: Top hotel with a fantastic pool considering its location and the paucity of such luxuries in the immediate area. Very pricey if you can't find a good deal: but as we did it was fabulous value. (There's always an additional pleasure to know that you paid less than 25% of the rack rate).

title: Well located, very nice hotel
review: We had a one night stay in Granada and enjoyed our evening in this hotel.  We booked the day before as we had done throughout Spain, only reserving ahead in our starting and ending cities (Madrid and Barcelona).  The grounds and pools are lovely, the room was very comfortable and looked to be newer than some of the photos we've seen posted by other travelers.  The food was entirely average or worse so we ate elsewhere since downtown was a five minute walk.

title: Good Value Hotel
review: Saray Hotel is located about 500m away from Granada's main avenue, and a walking distance from city centre. For european standard is a big hotel. Therefore, there are frequent groups of numerous tourists (USA, Asia) staying there, making breakfast, cheching in and out, activities that you should plan in advance. The hotel has nice and comfortable rooms and bathrooms, but sometimes you can have your dreams disturbed by the arrival of noisy tourists groups buses early in the morning.

title: A good hotel with a Great Breakfast Good Service But Dinner was Awful
review: This is a very good hotel & it might have been that we were in a big group with a tour  that  our dinner was so bad  The men in our party were still hungry as the fish that they ordered came with no vegetables or chips  I had chicken which was terrible hard & overcooked & they also forget me so had to wait extra 10 /15 minutes  & I could not eat it when it came    Our first course was great Salad of avocado & salmon        Rooms at this hotel were very good  Service & Staff were good

title: So so...
review: Water pressure was non-existent.  Toilet did not flush completely even after 4 tries.  Pool looked nice but are you really in Granada for a pool?

title: Mixed views
review: A good location next to the Palacio de Congresos. Slightly out of town but nothing to worry about. Simply head for the Carrera del Genil for a pleasant walk into the city centre - about 15 minutes in total.  We found the receptionists quite cold but the porter was very friendly and helpful when I asked him if I could use a computer to print out my boarding cards for the journey home.  We had e-mailed the hotel before departure to ask if the pool would be open. We received no reply whatsoever and discovered that the pool was closed on arrival. However, temperatures started to soar and I suspect other guests began complaining about the lack of pool facilities too. Within a day of our arrival, the pool was being scrubbed and filled and we were more than happy with the finished…

title: Comfortable hotel
review: We stayed at the Saray with a tour group and were very pleased.  The hotel is modern and very clean and our room was comfortable.  It's not in the city center and there are not a lot of places to eat within walking distance, but we enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate to stay there again.

title: Nothing special but good value for price, check if amenities are open
review: An unexceptional, but entirely adequate hotel for the price.    Check in was painful - I had only booked the room 2 hours before, but it still took them nearly 20 minutes to sort it out, and then provided us with a twin room, despite being assured of a double (this was quickly resolved however).  They also required to see our passports, citing that a (British/EU) driving licence was not acceptable (despite being Government issued ID), although ultimately relented on this.  We stayed at the beginning of June, and were extremely suprised to find that the swimming pool was empty and under maintenance, despite this being the start of summer.  There was no mention of why, so I can only assume that their definition of summer starts later than mine (it has been hot and sunny in this…

title: Not a 4 star hotel
review: The hotel was somewhat adequate but definitely not a 4 star property.  Our bed had graffiti on it which really soured our stay.  The rest of the hotel was just ok.  Not very impressed.

title: good hotel!
review: spend 2 nights with my wife very nice city the hotel is outside the historic center but you can walk 20 minutes and its a nice walk the good thing is that you have a free parking in the street near the hotel rooms looks relatively new and fresh comfy beds good value  tip - in the evening go to the Albayzín

title: Not bad, not great.
review: Stayed for 1 night. Hotel itself is clean if a bit dated. Underground parking a bonus BUT only if you drive a car made for Papa Smurf, very, very tight parking. Rooms where spacious enough. Pay per view was 12€ a film I.e. safe house not porn, although I believe that was the same price.... Pool was good and decent space for children. Desk staff were very helpful and friendly, I speak no spanish other than 'beer please' but they spoke good English. however, Bed was very very firm and on wheels!!!!

title: Disappointing stay
review: The common areas were nice and clean but our first room's A/C did not work and the temperatures rose into the 30'sC.  Also, there was no ice trays in the in room refrigerator. The front desk personnel was not particularly friendly. Breakfast was hit-and-miss; at times there was a full complement of dishes, and other times numerous dishes were absent.

title: Lovely decor with unpleasant odor
review: The public area of the Saray is absolutely gorgeous, with Arab-influenced decor.  The pool? Spectacular. However, we all remarked on the unpleasant, almost fertilizer-type odor that was in the lobby for our 24-hour stay. Really took away from the ambiance. The room was fine and luckily that 'aroma' did not float upward.

title: beautiful hotel
review: Very nice hotel, beautiful interiors. Free WiFi. Rooms are good size, beautifully decorated, clean and many amenities. Bathroom is nice and clean. Staff are friendly and attentive to your needs. Location of hotel is quite a walk to the city center, shopping areas and city attractions, but it's ok for us, we like to walk. Food is very good and many choices. We only had 1 night but we enjoyed our stay.

title: Just what we needed
review: Great hotel, not that close to central area but not so far away that it was annoying. Max 10min walk. Clean, tidy, good value and was perfect for our 2 night stay to laze about town and take in the Alhambra. Service desk very helpful booking taxis for us to get up there early in the morning. Just what we needed.

title: Hooray for Saray!
review: Just got back from Granada...great hotel for the price we paid.  Extremely clean..very few hotels in Spain allowed for 2 adults and 2 kids to sleep in one room comfortably but this one did.  Other hotels required two rooms.  It was a bit out of the way maybe a 10 min walk from central area but worth it for the price and cleanliness.  Quiet, breakfast was a bit pricey so we ate out or went to cafeteria around the corner and for the less than 10 Euros got coffee, juice and tostadas for all 4. Pool was outdoors and not heated so we couldn't use it as it is still too cold in Granada - an indoor pool would have made it perfect!

title: good for what we wanted
review: The rooms were very large for Europe.  The hotel was VERY hard to locate finally someone drove ahead of us to show us the way!  Confusion around breakfast offerings - a pleasant walk to downtown and back from Alhambra but on advice of hotel we took a taxi to the top.  The hotel itself seemed run down but in the rooms it was fine

title: OK hotel, but be careful you're booking for a family
review: The hotel is standard and perfectly adequate.  It's located just across the river from the main commercial centre of Granada.  A 10-minute taxi ride (around 10 euro for 4 of us) will deliver you to the Alhambra.  Our real reservation was with the room.  We'd booked a room with 3 beds for a family of four.  We'd naively assumed that 3 beds meant one double and two singles, but we were given a small room with two singles pushed together for the adults and our two children (aged 8 and 9) were supposed to share a single bed!  We had to upgrade to a junior suite (an extra 60 euro per night) to ensure we all had space to sleep.  Not sure who's more to blame here: venere.com through whom we booked (and who requested the children's ages) or the hotel who were so inflexible.  Hotel…

title: Good Hotel with well appointed rooms
review: Stayed at this hotel for one night and had a very nice well appointed modern room. Came to this hotel after my reservation was cancelled by their sister property for no fault of myself and they were trying to fix the problem by finding me a room during a very busy long weekend in spain.I was greeted by Mrs. Maria Marquez Moreno front desk manager who was very kind and professional. She informed me that she had a room for me but because there was a wedding that night, she wanted to let me know that there was a possibility of hearing some noise at night because of that. The room happened to be on the 3rd floor and I had no problems hearing any noise whatsoever. I did appreciate her communication and honesty and was happy for not having problems of that sort. Breakfast was good by…

title: Best choice for location, amenities and price
review: We stayed here during a trip along southern Spain and it was our first destination. We used Tripadvisor to filter the best place by price, with a pool, near the city centre. And this is where Tripadvisor pointed us to. It's excellent. The pool was amazing with a bar and a sheltered area to get out of the heat in midday. The location leaves you with a 15 minute walk into the city centre or 5 mins by taxi, and when we arrived there we were upgraded to a junior suite free of charge! The staff are extremely friendly and helpful with perfect English if you need it, and the price was for nothing given our surroundings. The hotel itself is like a palace when you walk inside, marble surroundings and beautiful decor. You can always tell a lot from a hotel reception! If you are going to…

title: A good place, but...
review: God place, good rooms, but staff doesn't really care.  When we checkedin, we were first directed to a "non-smoking" room with a heavy smell of tobacco.  The stuff learned about that from us and started opening windows.  The maid didn't refill toiletries because "stock expired".  Claims to front desk helped.  But the greatest inconvenience was presence of a Fire Brigade next door to the hotel.  Every night they had to go twice at least with a great noise.  Our room looked at the opposite street, but it was impossible not wakeup.  From any other point, it was a very good hotel, indeed.

title: Good for a weekend break
review: We  spent a couple of nights at this hotel when visiting Granada for the weekend. Although it is not in the city center, you can easily walk towards the "tapas" area, which  is just at a  20  minutes nice walk. The hotel has been renovated recently as I had also been there about twelve years ago and rooms decoration and comfort has been significantly increased. Rooms  only issue could be the lack of light with really very few points that do not allow reading at all. Breakfast is fine for a Spanish four stars city hotel.

title: Great Value!
review: We stayed here for two nights when we were travelling around andalucia. It was really good value and about 10-15mins walk from the shops and the main sights in Granada. The pool was a great way to cool down after a day of sight seeing!  We booked room only so i didn't try the breakfast, It's a nice hotel and they seemed to have pretty reasonable offers for dinner. As we only stayed in Granada for two nights we ate out, It's a great city and the Alahambra is beautiful...make sure you book in advance if you're thinking of going!  We parked in the hotel's underground car park and it cost 16.50 euros per day, which is very expensive but it seems to be pretty similar throughout Granada.

title: nice hotel but truly exceptional restaurnat
review: Unfortunately, when my friend and I traveled to Granada, there was some construction going on near the hotel. Nevertheless, it still was pretty easy to find the hotel. We got there late so did not have much time to check out the local restaurants. Decided to have a dinner at the hotel restaurant. Absolutely loved it! truly 5 stars! The room we had was nice and the hotel itself is pretty. I believe my friend favoried Saray over all other hotels we stayed in while in Spain. The room cardkey was not working - we had to drag a real key everywhere around us. However, it's a small thing to complain about. Net-net, it's a great hotel!

title: Superb Hotel in Granada
review: Summary : Superb Hotel in an excellent location.  I often find reviews on web-sites (inc. Tripadvisor) very confusing and somewhat frustrating. It's amazing how people can have such differing views on a hotel and the reviews for Saray were no different, ranging from excellent to awful.  This is a genuine 4-star hotel and is very clean, efficient and modern. The staff were very friendly (even at 2am when we arrived!). The room was very nice, well appointed and getting a cot for our baby was no problem (it was already a triple room but it fitted OK).  The WiFi was free and worked OK.  The location was very good indeed, being a 10 min walk to the centre/main shopping area and shops and restaurants lined the whole route. There was also a supermarket only 2 mins walk away from the…

title: Privileged location to shopping
