review: Saray Hotel is a block away to the Convention Center and across a river bridge to shopping mall and stores in an "for pedestrians" side of the town. Night life is very warm for a close to winter time. At 10pm, the area is full of people (families, couples...) walking around. The hotel has a nice small playground, pool, pub (attached, but not included) and concierge. The room is clean with a nice partial view of Sierra Nevada. TV is digital and wireless works. The only problem is the small bathing area for a larger person... but might have other rooms, needed to ask for.

title: great place to stay in Granada
review: This place excelled in terms of quality and price. Very clean, very comfortable and very good rates!  The bed was gorgeous to sleep on, lovely good quality bedding.  Some people told us it was really far from the city centre but its actually a 5 min walk to the main street. I would definitely reccommend it.  its more of a business hotel, but it had a little bit of granada in the decor.

title: Good Location
review: After a lot of thinking we finally planned to stay in this hotel for a night. The location is  a bit far away from the centre. The taxi takes around 4 -4.5 € to get to the centre. The rooms were fine, but the drinks in the mini bar are really expensive. For any soft drink it was 3.5 for a can and for a small bottle of wine it was 8 euros. So i think that was a bit dear. We could see that the hotel was not really very busy so i think they can be a bit considerate for car parking charges. Instead of around 16 euros , i think they should have gone for 10 or 12 euros. The whole parking lot was empty. Next time we might look for some more better options.

title: Below expectations, a 3 star
review: Advantages: This hotel has a good location, only 5 minutes to walk to the main shopping area. The concierge is excellent. The rooms are of 4 star standard as they have been recently upgraded.  Disadvantages: The bathrooms have not been upgraded and are very outdated and not at all luxurious enough to be even in a 3 star. The towels are old and not enough. The hotel reception is outdated as well. The service is poor with no irons available in the rooms - you are forced to pay for hotel laundry service. There is also no kettle, I had to order hot water at a charge everytime I wanted to make baby formula milk. The breakfast is a disgrace and is unedible with stale pastries. The basement parking is narrow, dark and scary with a lift so tiny only 2 people can fit at any one time.  I…

title: Clean, comfortable albeit rooms on the small side
review: Good hotel, the glass elevators and the water features and plants are quite attractive.  Enjoyed our walk to the city centre and to a cozy restaurant downtown.  Great breakfast buffet and a lovely pool.  Lobby is lovey and spacious and inviting.  More of a business stay though as opposed for family/vacation

title: Good hotel with good facilities
review: We spent two nights in Saray Hotel in September. The hotel is well maintained and looks quite inviting from the outside, with water features, plants and glass lifts. It’s about 15 minutes’ walk to the city centre and 25 minutes to Alhambra.  Our room was clean and spacious.  The staff were relaxed, in a sort of a manana style, and friendly. We found this to be quite a common characteristic amongst the hotel receptionists in Andalucia. We had a sink problem (water not draining away), which did take a couple of attempts to get fixed.  The pool area was a reasonable size but overlooked by tall buildings. The pool was small but big enough for a quick swim in rather chilled water which was welcoming after a day’s sightseeing in a sunny hot weather. We parked the car in the hotel…

title: Close to convention centre & a short walk to shopping area
review: POSITIVES: *Clean functional rooms *Free Wi-fi  *Decent swimming pool *Has a nice well stocked bar *Within walking distance to shopping area and convention centre. *Breakfast buffet was great, it had a nice selection of fresh fruits, hot dishes and salads.  NEGATIVES: *Air con didn't work well in the room I stayed in. *Reception staff weren't helpful when I needed an adapter. *Internet expensive if you have to use hotel computers. *Dinner buffet was mediocre: there was a fried rice dish and the rice was crunchy, it wasn't cooked properly.

title: good hotel in Granada
review: Clean and comfortable modern hotel, steps away from the convention center and a 15-min walk from central Granada. Excellent breakfast buffet. I was in town on business and would recommend this hotel for that purpose with no hesitation. For vacation travel, I would probably look for something with a bit more character and a more memorable location, perhaps in Albayzin, the beautiful medieval district of Granada.

title: Good hotel and only a block and a half from the shopping district.
review: Room was OK and included free wireless internet. The hotel was quite modern and had a great pool area. The only downside to the room was that the A/C seemed a bit ordinary. Buffet dinner was good as was the breakfast next morning. Staff were helpful and friendly and there money changing service was the only half reasonable one I encountered throughout Europe!!

title: Absolutely wonderful!
review: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a short honeymoon and it really was the right choice to have made. My first impression of the customer service when I popped in to find out how to access the car park was really good.  The location is ideal, just 15 minutes walk to the area around Plaza Nueva, easily manageable even though I was 8 months pregnant!  The rooms are spacious, have stocked mini-bar, independent heating and air conditioning controls.  Breakfast was a reasonable buffet, though I have had better elsewhere.  Though we didn't eat an evening meal at the hotel, we once popped down to have a look at the restaurant and it looked like buffet again which put us off.  I would usually expect the option to have an A la carte meal in a hotel of this standard, and in a…

title: Tour company picked a winner
review: As part of our Spain/Portugal tour package, we stayed at this hotel and were very pleased. The rooms were large and modern; very friendly service, lovely lobby and public areas.  Our included buffet dinner was very good and they accommodated an earlier dinner time compared with the normal 8:30 pm, or later, Spanish dinner hour.  Our breakfast was also very good and, I'm happy to say, the hot items were all HOT!

title: Great hotel, excellent value
review: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the beginning of September and it was perfect for sightseeing in Granada plus relaxing by the pool in siesta! Our room was huge, with a Queen sized bed and good choice of TV channels which my partner liked as he could watch US Open tennis in the evenings! Only criticism is it would have been nice to have complementary water in the room as it was 36 degrees! Ladies the hairdryer was also a bit iffy so bring your own if you are bothered about blowdrying! The room was very cool and had windows you could open as well which was nice.   The pool was lovely, water is cold but when it's 36 outside you don't care! It is very pure water so beautiful to swim in as I don't normally like pool water. The gardens surrounding the pool are also really nice…

title: Nice hotel in Granada
review: Nice hotel, with a good pool facility. Large, modern room with very effective aircon. Breafkast was very expensive, so we had breakfast at a local restaurant in stead.  We booked a family room and had an extra single bed + crib in the room without feeling too cramped.

title: Good hotel with nice pool area
review: We flew into the airport in Granada and immediately outside the exit - it is a very small airport - the bus was waiting to take us into the city. It costs just 3 euro's and the Saray Hotel is a 2-3 minute walk from the buses last stop.   Our first impressions were positive - nice reception area and view of the pool - and our room, though not available when we arrived - was also decorated to a high standard. The highlight of the hotel is that there is a really nice pool area with sunshine until 8.30pm.  In terms of location, its not bad either. It is a 10 minute walk to start of the shopping area and there is a fantastic supermarket - Mercadona - nearby too. It takes about 20 minutes to walk to the centre of the city/cathedral area, but 45 mins to the Alhambra, though there are…

title: Very mixed, avoid breakfast for sure
review: This is a very attractive hotel that is near the convention center, a long walk or a short cab ride form the center and old Arab quarter.   It's an odd place where it looks like distant management has had some great ideas, but the local people just don't want to follow up.  A couple examples:  about 10 days before arrival, I get a nice email asking me to tell them anything they might do to help make my stay more enjoyable.  Well, I took them at their word and sent them a note with a problem and got absolutely no response (when I got there, the person at their activities desk was able to do what I needed, but why ask if you are going to ignore people?)   Breakfast was truly awful with some odd, almost funny examples of what I'm talking about.  Both mornings, water was kept in a…

title: not bad ....
review: Its  a 4* hotel ,arabian style,with large saloon and nice gardens with small swimming pool. the rooms are not very specius.the parking its expensive!!!! better to find a place around the hotel.the breakf

title: A lovely suprise!
review: Hotel Saray is convenient, has style and character, and made our stay in Granada even more enjoyable. The staff are helpful, friendly, speak english and they have a sense of humour! Our room was neat, clean, and spacious - we had a large flat-screen TV, a work desk and mini-bar with suprisingly reasonable prices. Wifi was free for the duration of our stay, and we could both log in (in the past we've found that free wifi is only accessible from one device). The pool area is charming, with outdoor sun loungers, an undercover gazebo area with cushioned seating, a pool bar and complimentary towels. The pool is open from midday until 10pm and we stayed one night until sundown, sipping drinks and reading by the pool. As the location is just at the edge the commercial part of town, it…

title: Nice place, clean and good value
review: The hotel is nicely located and with plenty of choices around to eat. Rooms are a bit small but well decorated and clean. There is a very nice tapas bar in the corner to right that offer breakfast and was open until late. I think is called " Las tapas de Valenzuela". Granada is an amazing city and would come back to this hotel. They charge 15€ for parking and the parking is quite small but I suppose is ok in a city like this. In Granada is normal to give you free tapas when you order a drink and people go on a "Tapas bar crawl" . The local wine is quite nice so don´t  be afraid to try. The Alhambra palace is great and be prepared to walk a lot. If you want to visit the inside you have to book in advance. At least 2 weeks. You can get the tickets on the net or they have a contact…

title: Nice hotel with some flaws
review: Stayed at Hotel Saray in a  for three nights in July.  Good and fast check in. The reception was helpfull with maps, questions etc   Room had a good size, but the it was a bit dark, which was a shame. Good bathroom.  Breakfast was average considering it's a 4-star hotel. The meat and dairy products was seemed like they had been put up in the beginning of the morning, so when we got there around 9.30 the cheese and milk was no longer cold. Not so good.   The pool was excellent considering it is a city hotel. However beware that the pool is between 1.5-2.2 meters deep and really not suited for non-swimmers. There is no life guard on duty, and we actually saw a man almost drowning his friend before being pullet out of the water by his friend.

title: Fantastic Hotel
review: Very good hotel within walking distance of the city sites. Rooms very spacious and plenty of character. Staff very helpful. The hotel has a great Spanish character.Food very good although there are plenty of restaurants to choose from.in Grenada. Quite prepared to return here for another visit.If you like Spanish food and wine then Grenada is ideal. The locals are polite and friendly.

title: Close to conference centre
review: Staff were not terribly friendly at reception, prices for rooms are per person so beware!! Doesn't say that on website..... Never get a packed breakfast if leaving before  the breakfast starts (7am) it was dreadful and had to be thrown away.Tried to query bill and poor service but no reply to 2 emails. The  very coldest swimming pool I have ever used. Visited during a sunny June.

title: Great break in Granada
review: The hotel was such good value for money. Great location, easy to get to from the main bus station, just hop on city bus no.3 and its the last stop by the Palacio de Congress (bus €1.30 one way). 5/10 minute walk to the main plaza areas of Granada. 15 minute walk to Alhambra and Albayzin (which is a must area to browse around cobbled streets and 'aladin cave' style boutiques with African influence...). Hotel was very comfortable, rooms clean and beds comfortable. The pool was great and there was always enough beds and towels and the food was equally lovely. Staff were helpful with local knowledge. Only complaint of the whole time was that the internet was painfully slow and not worth the €7 for 24 hours use in the rooms... I would definately rexommend this hotel and would go…

title: Nice hotel with a pool
review: We visited Granada to see Alhambre. The hotel is close but not at the center of town. We liked the pool. Parking is not free - but its difficult to drive and park in Granada - so i would recommend that you pay if you have a car. The staff could be more friendly and forthcoming.  The rooms were nice and the pool is really nice.

title: Disappointing
review: Hotel is nice but is becoming to feel a little outdated. Breakfast was adequate but again was not the best we have experienced and some foods were stale especially the pastries. It is also a shame that the breakfast room is situated where it is with no natural light or windows. Hairdryer in bathroom was very archaic with not much power and was impossible to hold after a few minutes as got too hot, felt this was quite dangerous however staff did lend us another hairdryer. Room was ok with big flat screen T.V, a fridge and plenty of storage space. Hotel seems to cater for international coach parties and on some days, the pool was very crowded. Felt pool was too small and not enough sun-beds for number of guests they cater for. Emailed hotel beforehand to request a top floor room…

title: Nice hotel if a tad out of the way.
review: Stayed here because of the pool, guess what, I never used the pool.   My fault, I got slightly ill and didn't want to risk getting worse . Pool seemed very nice though a lap swimmer might have trouble navigating around all the kids playing there.  Location was about an 8 Euro Taxi ride from train and bus stations, lobby was fine and clean.  We had Room 326 which was quiet but had nearly no view.  The bed had many pillows which we ended up putting on chairs and just keeping one.  WI-FI worked well and was free, the hotels business center charged an obscene 1.50 Euros for :30 minutes and 3 for an hour.  The refrigerator in the room charged very high prices (4.50 Euros for a can of Heineken for example).  Staff was friendly except for one crabbie lady behind the check in desk. …

title: A perfect stay - a walk away from the never sleeping city of Granada
review: We - Family with 2 children 8 and 11 - found and booked the hotel online and were a little nervous about what we would find. The reception was very friendly and helpful and English speaking! As the hotel offers only one additional bed in the room - what we didn't know - we were short of one bed in the room. The staff helped us to find a room with a king size bed which was good for 3 of us. The hotel is located about 20min walk or 10min by bus from down town, which is convinient and enough distance to enjoy pleasant and undisturbed nights. The air con also helped. Free WiFi enabled us to organise all trips in and around Granada. Last but not least I like to mention the pool area which is nice and was not crowded. A perfect place to recover after hours walking through the city…

title: Reasonable hotel but car parking is a rip off
review: Clean and tidy rooms. Modern decor. Staff not very helpful. As above car parking is 16 euros per night!! No tea and coffee in rooms. Not badly priced though.

title: delightfull
review: Cant be better.Beautifull,comfortable,excellent location,good value,reasonable rates.,nice breakfast,very clean,quick service.Puts one in the mood of Granada.4+ stars.we stayed in 5 hotels in Spain in 11 days.we are 5 adults in our family.We all agree this was the best comprehensive all round value and comfort.

title: We would stay there again - clean, spacious, reasonable price
review: We didn't know what to expect.  The hotel room was spacious.  The two beds pushed together made up a nice king size bed.  We stayed in hotels in Madrid and Barcelona as well and this one by far had the best flat screen tv.

title: Close to things and clean hotel
review: Nice clean hotel, lovely pool area, walking distance to everything.

title: One of the best
review: This was our second stay in this hotel.  The room was well appointed and beautifully designed in a very modern style.  The bed was one of the most comfortable anywhere!  The hotel is well situated for all visits to Granada.  It was one of the cheapest we stayed at in Andalucia this last week , but far higher quality than the others.  It was well staffed and staff were very helpful and efficient.  Breakfast was good.  We like what we've seen so far with this hotel and a sister hotel in Murcia ( The Nelva) of the Santos chain of hotels with its good value for money and its very modern designs.

title: Fantastic hotel with one caveat
review: If it were not for one slight problem, I would reccommend this hotel unreservedly. Unlike previous comments we found the staff pleasant enough - their limited English was far better than our poor Spanish and they were helpful. The hotel is lovely and quite amazingly good value for the deal we got with expedia. The pool area is again very lovely - although there is no pool service til June, the pool was able to be used in a very hot April and the whole area was delightful for sitting around in after a hard day's sightseeing.  Although not exactly in the heart of the city, it is really only a short walk to the main areas - perhaps 10 minutes and is on the same side of the city as the Alhambra. The only real problem we had was with our booking - we did ask for a family room for 4…

title: an Industry - not a caring hotel
review: We had a real urgent problem at midnight. We called from the room to all points: desk, housekeeping, switchboard - no answers for 15 min. Went down to the desk to get help. Desk attendant had a couple of check-ins to deal with - which was his prefered activity over hearing our problem. He could not care less. If you choose this hoteland have a problem better call city help or the police but not the hotel. I am a world traveler for 35 years now and never came across such hotel attitude..

title: Beautiful hotel - nice quiet location
review: The hotel staff were accommodating, the hotel is lovely and the rooms were very nice.

title: Lower then normal Granada standards
review: Positives: Clean and modern. Pool looked good but didn't use it unfortunately as it was winter.  This hotel is one of the poorer ones we have stayed in Granada. We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. My girlfriend and I weren't very pleased overall. Staff are very very rude. Didn't feel welcome at all when we checked in. The gentlemen at the front desk looked very bothered at having to check me in. I almost felt I had to apologise for making him have to type in my details into his computer! The room was far too warm. We had to open the window as the air conditioning only heats up the room not cool, even if u set it to 10C. When I told the gentleman at reception he explained that in winter, they set all air cons to warm up the room. I explained to him that this is ridiculous, as…

title: Disappointed
review: I reccently travelled to Granada in february 2011 and stayed in this hotel. I thought i was getting a 4 star hotel but to my disappointment it felt like i was staying in a 2 star hotel, the staff were very unwelcoming on arrival. The first night i stayed in the hotel i went to the reidents bar and found that the bar staff were very ignorent and would not deal with my complaint. I found that this was a disappointment to my holiday and felt very uncomfortable during the rest of my stay. I booked out early due to this. The staff were not concerned of my early departure. I feel that i should be compensated for this.

title: Nice hotel with pool, walking distance from the city
review: Location, location, location!  Fairly easy walking distance from the centre of Granada.  Good bars and cafés nearby.  The hotel's underground garage parking worked well.    Good service on the front desk.  They seemed to be plugged into a local taxi firm's radio frequency.  Always easy to get a taxi especially for the day we visited the Alhambra.  (If you are visiting the Alhambra -- you must pre book tickets.  In 2010, we got ours from a La Caixa bank ATM ).    Rooms comfortable to a very high standard with good air-conditioning.  Internet signal not quite good enough in the room but worked very well in the public places off reception.    Breakfast was good with individual coffee and tea pots at your table.  That was nice because it's so inconvenient when you have to flag down…

title: Why double price for Saturday night?
review: Through booking.com we paid (2+3+4 Dec.2010) for Thursday and Friday 78 euros (double,breakfast included) but for Saturday 152 ! This is a 5 stars hotel price and Saray is 4 stars! Avoid staying there on Saturdays and Sundays! Rooms spacious, with all amenities. Breakfast ok. Parking around the hotel extremely difficult. More than 5 kms away from the railway station. Position excellent, close to city center, on foot around 5 min. Buses close by. I would suggest the hotel only for the weekdays.

title: Big Commercial Hotel, full of busloads of Tourists
review: Check in was pleasant enough, no complaints. Room lock didn't work neither did the airconditioning. They fixed the lock, but their answer to the airconditioning was to open the window and it was hot. Room was clean and came with all the necessary mod cons.The hotel is poorly located from just about everything and unless you are part of a tour or have your own car, this is not a great hotel to stay at while in Granada.

title: Great Location - pity about the staff
review: Stayed there for a week in Nov 10 - on business.  Room very clean & spacious - but no iron or trouser press.  Great en-suite.  Room way too hot as air con converts to heating at that time of year - had to keep it switched off & open windows all night.  Breakfast was very average with grumpy staff who gave the impression that you were an inconvenience.  Reception staff not much better.  Superb location - 100 yards from conference centre and 5 minutes walk to town center.  Bit noisy with traffic in small hours.

title: Helpful and comfortable. Excellent room.
review: I suspect prices are high here when there's a conference next door, but we managed to get a reasonable rate. There's underground parking that easy to find (for a fee) and the staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel's location is very good.  Unfortunately the pool was closed.  Granada itself is undergoing a great deal of road construction which can at times be a huge problem.

title: Great hotel with very bad staff
review: The hotel is not at the city center, but for small city like Granada it will take you 5 minutes to reach the center. the hotel it self is a great hotel, parking is available inside the hotel and around it. but the hotel services is not good. the receptionist is so rude

title: Charged even though cancelled!
review: I booked this hotel in September, then emailed them - replying to my confirmation email, to cancel.  They replied telling me to cancel online, which I did.   I have now been charged for half of the first night and when complained was told I did not cancel - which I did!  I want my money back!  Be warned.. seems like a scam to me.

title: Business type hotel with very new rooms
review: The hotel looks unimpressive but the rooms are very new as if recently renovated and very big. However, we couldn't sleep as the air-con/heater system was not responsive.   The reception was helpful in getting the tickets and tour to alhambra, which we couldn't book in advance by ourselves but the reception desk is understaffed so you have to wait to be attended to. Breakfast is good, offers a large variety though.   The parking lot underground is ok but if you car is bigger than a VW golf you will have a hard time finding a spot to fit in. The walk into town is quite long about 15 minutes and it is a bit quiet at  night ( not recommended for solo travellers).   Overall, if you want a quiet stay in a standard large hotel with spacious modern rooms and a parking lot this is the…

title: Modern,spacious and peaceful hotel with great pool area.
review: We stayed at Hotel Saray for 3 nights in Oct 2001. It is situated just around the corner from the Palace of Congress. Beware the roadworks,diversions and one way systems in the centre of Granada - they are a nightmare! Follow the signs for the Palace of Congress then turn right and you won't get lost ( like we did on our first day!)  It is a big modern hotel with very spacious modern rooms and excellent facilities including free wifi in rooms. The hotel is a good 20 mins walk  south of the main tourist area ( around  Plaza Nueva/ Plaza Real )  but very easy to get a taxi there and back ( approx 5 euros/trip). We caught a taxi up to the Mirador San Nicolas ( 9 euros)  and after admiring the amazing view strolled down to explore the Albaicin. One advantage of the hotel location is…

title: nice place
review: We spent one night here. Pleasant staff, rooms are clean. Walking distance to the center. Parking available.

title: excellent venue for sightseeing
review: Before we went to Granada I read several reviews about this hotel and assumed that it might be some distance from the centre. It is not. It took us half an hour to walk through town to Alhambra, the other places of interest were also not far away. The bonus is not getting involved in traffic and being able to park the car either in the underground garage or in the street.If one follows the signs for Palaccio de Congressos, it is opposite. The hotel itself is modern,clean, staff very pleasent and helpful. We only stayed one night and had no time for breakfast.

title: Great Value
review: the Saray is a short walk from the city centre with plenty of bars and places to eat nearby. The hotel is large and spotlessly clean with a large underground car park. Staff are friendly and efficient, rooms are large and comfortable. An ideal, value hotel from which to explore. We all said that we would stay here again.

title: Good clean comfortable hotel but lacking atmosphere
review: Modern clean rooms, excellent pool area all within walking distance of the city centre. Seemed to cater for coach trips and there wasn't much help for loan tourists seeking information.  I felt more like I was on a business trip than on holiday, compounded by only CNN being available on the TV without extra charge.  But a good hotel.

title: Large & luxurious
review: A good, large 4 star city hotel. The rooms were large, with a definite business executive feel. The pool and garden area was lovely (so much so that there was a wedding there, during our stay). The reception is very nice in the Moorish Alhambra style, and the reception is open 24 hrs. The breakfast in the hotel was the best we experienced during our trip with so much variety you couldn’t try everything. The hotel is a 15-20 min walk in to the town for dinner or tapas etc. or a 5 min taxi ride. The hotel also has a car park for guests (at an additional charge of about €17 per day). While out and about the tourist information booth in the square behind the cathedral had the most helpful tourist information person that I’ve ever encountered – she gave us great advise about where to…

title: Excellent 4* Hotel
review: This hotel was a great place to stay to see the City of Granada and Alhambra Palace.  We only stayed here for one night on our way to Malaga.  It is a lovely 4 star hotel, with a great pool area.  It is about a 10 min walk into the centre of Granada.  Parking was fine.  We reserved a space which costs 16.65 euros per night.  You can park on the road outside for free if you can get a space.  Granada itself is difficult to drive round as it is full of one way streets, and at the moment, roadworks.  Make sure you print off a decent map on how to get to the hotel, We didn't and had to ask at another hotel where it was.  They gave us a map which was handy. The room looked recently refurbished to a high standard and very pleasent.  Very comfortable beds and plenty of room for us and a…

title: Pretty hotel, great pool, weird dining..
review: I was in this hotel 4 nights with some colleagues.. The rooms are quite ok.. Nothing fancy, but quite allright..  The pool area are very pretty, but the pool is very small.. Breakfeast is very good! Lots to choose from and very nice! We had lunch two times at the hotel.. Of a group of 20 people all of us agreed, that the food had a weird taste (including the spanish people in the group).. The meeting room we had were in the basement, with a window towards the downramp to the parking basement..  But Granada is an exciting city, with lots of good restaurants!

title: Great room, pool and ideal location
review: We stayed at this hotel in August and got a great deal. We drove from Seville to Granada and the hotel was easy to find and although it has it's own carpark it was free to park on the road outside the hotel as we did.  Upon we were welcomed by a friendly and helpful member of reception staff and the room we were given was large and very modern and all the facilities were good.   There is a nice pool area and pool bar for chilling out after all the sightseeing around town. The hotel is within easy walking distance to the town centre (10 minutes) stopping off on the Tapas trail as you go. Would recommend this hotel for couples or families

title: Excellent value for money, bit out of the way
review: Stayed here for 2 nights in August to visit the Alhambra. Lovely pool area but it does get very busy during the day - as you can imagine in 40 degree heat! Friendly helpful staff, nice spacious rooms. Only drawback is that its quite a walk to the centre of Granada where the restaurants are, which is not a lot of fun in the heat. Would recommend this hotel for its value for money!

title: Great base for a few days in a wonderful city
review: Faced with paying the standard rates for this hotel, we wouldn't have bothered. However, as with many of these large business chain hotels, we got a decent online deal, and even with the rather expensive breakfast (11 euros per head) the price made it worthwhile.  The location is great, just south of the river, and therefore a 10 minute walk to central Granada (and only about a 20 minute walk from the Alhambra). Being in a suburban area, it's quite quiet, too. The pool is small, but a pleasant place to cool off after some serious sightseeing. Inside, it's typical of the decent-quality business-style hotel, with large rooms, plenty of TV channels and a horribly overpriced minibar (you don't need that when you're in the city of free tapas!)  In this day and age, it's a shame…

title: Great price & rooms with parking
review: We drove in from Marbella and were happy to have easy, on-site parking (garage below hotel.  Service was helpful and answered all questions.  The hotel is located about a 20 min walk from Plaza Nueva but it was definitely worth it since there is a pool.  Rooms were spacious and clean.  The pool was very nice but not enough chairs to sit on (I know it is not a resort, but it was enjoyable to come back to the pool after spending the day touring the city in the heat).  We had to sit on the grass by the pool since there were only enough chairs/lounges for about 20 people.  Instead of taking the bus or walking to Plaza Neuva to pick up another bus to get to the Alhambra, we took a cab straight from the hotel (the front desk called it for us) and it was only 6 euro! Definitely…

title: Lovely Hotel
review: I thought this hotel was great. We arrived after a long drive from Gibraltar and was able to park in the underground car park straight away. We checked in and was extremely happy with the room. LCD TV, gorgeous decor and very clean. There is also free Wi-Fi in the hotel, which works in the room and by the pool.  Great location if you want to be close to the centre of things. The main shopping/tourist area is a 5 minute walk away. The pool area is well maintained and clean with plenty of soft seating areas I cannot fault this hotel and I would say it's great value for money

title: Well run, modern and comfortable.
review: This hotel was very modern with excellent facilities. We had a standard double room which was clean and comfortable, and very well-presented, as I would expect from a 4-star hotel. Location was about a 10 to 15 minute walk to the city centre. Parking is available on-site for a daily fee, or you can park on the streets around the area.

title: Hotel is very nice, rooms are nice and...
review: Hotel is very nice, rooms are nice and clean.  The bathroom is ok.  The pool area is nice also, location is not near the shopping areas but you can walk 15-20 minutes to busy areas.   Breakfast was very good, and they have room service.    Overall we liked the hotel.

title: Fantastic price, with comfort and style
review: We reached the hotel in the afternoon after a hairy journey through to the centre of Granada and were over the moon when we saw the hotel.  It is situated just behind the Palacio de Congressos,  The entrance is done in Moorish style with a trickllng fountain at the entrance and also one in the centre of the reception.  We had booked through Booking.com the day before and got an exceptional rate.  Check-in was very painless and the staff were very helpful and pleasant (in fact we found all of the people we met in Granada very friendly and helpful).  The rooms were spacious and modern and well-designed, with very comfortable beds.  In fact, there was a "pillow menu", with a choice of about 8 different pillows and you could choose which one you would like.  We, in fact, stuck with…

title: Fabulous Management!!!
review: When management is as good as it is at this hotel I have to mention it. The night manager was ubiquitous. His staff obviously highly respected him and the fact that he recognized that every job was important. It reflected through the hotel and how we were treated and the attention paid to the care of the hotel.    Great value for the dollar. Located directly beside the congress centre. Not the best spot for tourists though as not in the middle of things. BUT the view of the mountains from our windows was amazing.   Very very clean and well attended.

title: Superb location and rooms
review: We stayed as a family for one night whilst  visiting the Science Park (Parque de Ciencia)and the Sierra Nevada.  The big plus to this Hotel is its location. It's not "too central" making it accessable and easy to locate from the motorway, but then a short walk up Calle San Anton sees you right in the heart of the city.   We had two rooms with interconnecting doors which were very well equipped with mini bar, pillow menu, free wi fi, bathtub, mirrors everywhere and flat screen T.V. Some previous reviewers have perhaps misunderstood things, the charges for the T.V. are only for the movies, you can watch normal channels for free.  Only downpoint was that the room was a little stuffy, but a few minutes with the window open soon put this right. The nearby Science Park is excellent…

title: great location with parking
review: We stayed for 3 nights in that hotel in September and loved it. For the car drivers the location is extremelly convenient just outside of the center (15mn stoll) and the paying car park was a plus in a town that is notorious for its parking and traffic problems.  The rooms were spotless with all modcom needed. And we slept in total quietness. The staff was incredibly helpful and funny despite a very grumpy Front house Manager that seemed to make their life hell. Despite our lack of vocabulary we ended up having many laughs with them. For the less mobile a bus is just around the corner 1 stop from the Centre.  Breakfast was typical of spanish buffet that will have something for all nationalities.  It was also great to go for a deep after walking in the heat all day. For the price…

title: Good room and service
review: Stayed here with my wife and baby daughter in October 2009. Friendly service, convenient parking under the hotel, beautiful room with loads of mirrors, and space for the baby cot that was provided. Location wise, it's a nice and not inconvenient 20 minutes walk from dead center. Breakfast in the basement was decent, with adequate choice. The pool was fine, though we didn't use it much. Great food and wine in the center at Taberna Salinas.

title: Very good hotel
review: My husband and I stayed in Saray for 4 days and we really enjoyed stay. A bit of the confusion upon the arrival because the reception couldn't find our reservation (booked thru Hotels.com) after 15 minutes' wait we finally found our reservation, apparently wrong spelling! Anyway...  The room was big and modern with a flat screen TV. Free WIFI in the room, the pool, though small abut very nice, could be a bit jammed if you get there late you won't have the chair and will have to sunbath with your towel on the yard.  If you travel from the airport is very easy to get to the hotel as the bus terminal is just 5 minutes walk from a roundabout near the hotel. 15 minutes on foot to the city centre.  We enjoyed our stay and  would recommend the hotel to our friends.  Enjoy Alhambra,…

title: a fine new and spacious hotel in a pleasant location
review: This is a fine new and spacious hotel in a pleasant location. It's a nice 15' stroll into the city center, via the Carrera del Genil. Can recommend the Casa Ysla for breakfast on that avenue. The hotel is only 200m from the airport-bus stop, which is very convenient. Only negative point was that the swimming pool was closed during our stay in early October and the pool was one of the reasons for choosing this hotel. So better to check next time. If you want to dine out without walking too far, the Ventorillo restaurant right beside the airport-bus stop is not bad at all, although it doesn't look too good.

title: Nice hotel - location got me down
review: We chose the hotel as it was easy to drive to and it was. However, we had to pay for parking 16 euros a day (and we went out of season but we could not find any spaces around the hotel). Also, I found the location annoying as it is a good 30 min walk into Granada. Yes there are restaurants near to the hotel but not any we wanted to go to. Alambra is 60 min walk.  Room was lovely. We couldn't use the pool as it rained whilst we were there - early Sept. This probably had a big effect on my experience.   All in all nice hotel, good to drive to but I didn't enjoy our stay and apart for the Alambra I didn't think much of Granada - so much traffic.  We went out of season and the Alambra was still very busy. I would advise that you prebook your tickets. Go to the below to book  your…

title: Medium experience
review: For a 4* hotel, the breakfast was extremely mediocre, it was very difficult for my husband who has cholesterol problems to find vegetables or any other fatfree products to eat in the mornings. We stayed at the Fuerte Hotels in Marbella right before and the choices were significantly better. The room was clean and nice. Around the pool (which is really tiny) you do not find anybody to serve you a drink.

title: Affordable excellent hotel with great staff, rooms, and pool area
review: We had planned to stay here one night and ended up staying three!  Even though it was not right in the city center, it was very accessible to restaurants and attractions, but quiet and relaxing as well..  We especially enjoyed the pool area in the afternoons.  Nice grounds and pool for a city hotel.  Very comfortable, spacious, and updated room. The staff was great, very friendly, spoke English and other languages, and were genuinely helpful.  I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Started off Rocky but ended up great!
review: We went during Holy week and the hotel was located on the procession trail so it was a rough first night of sleep. However, the hotel room itself was very clean and the maid staff was very friendly. I left 2 shirts in the closet of our room and I was able to email the hotel and Maria Marquez and Sonia L were very helpful and they were able to get my shirts back to me all the way in the United States in 2 weeks! This left a lasting impression on me and I would definitely recommend this hotel!

title: A really nice hotel
review: From the outside the hotel is not that impressive, but inside the hotel is modeled after The Alhambra and the architcture is beautiful.  The room was comfortable, The staff helpful, and the included buffet dinner and breakfast were good.  The hotel is a 10-15 minute walk from the center of Granada, in a residential area.  There were a number of banks/ATM's and restaurants within a few blocks.

title: Lovely Hotel with a sense of style
review: A thoroughly enjoyable stay at this Hotel in the wonderful city of Granada. This is a well priced hotel with the rooms being spacious and modern. The Pool area is great for lazing about during the warm afternoons if you need to take a break from the sight seeing. We did not try the breakfast so cannot comment on it.   It is a 10 minute walk into the very heart of the city but the walk is fine and it is great to walk through the town centre and experience all the wonderful squares on the way. There is a taxi rank and bus stop no more than 1 minute walk if you want to get a cab to other destinations (the alhambra will set you back 5 euro from the hotel taxi rank).   If back in town we would stay at this establishment again.

title: Charming, luxurious hotel!
review: We stayed for  4 nights in this hotel and were amazed by how wonderful it was!! The rooms were spacious and modern with the included option of choosing your preferred pillow type. The pool was welcomely cold, and all the staff were extremely helpful and friendly, would return without hesitation.  It was a flat 10 minute walk from town but the city is very safe and taxis were reasonable.

title: No personality or atmosphere
review: My husband and myself stayed here in July,  Rooms were clean and modern.  We stayed for a week as a city break but found the hotel had absolutely no atmosphere at all, the bar was always completely empty all the time reception/ bar area had the overwhelming smell of stale smoke. The hotel pool was a welcomed break from the 36deg heat (and was open every day of our stay) The guy who tends the pool bar area was always very pleasant but the  breakfast staff were unapproachable and not very polite or friendly. Overall a very mixed review. One thing I would mention is that it is on the outskirts of the city and is a 10-15 walk to city centre. Granada was fantastic and I would visit again.

title: A real bargain
review: A good quality hotel with a nice pool for the afternoons  / early evenings.  About 15 minutes walk into the centre but there is a taxi rank 100m away.  Occasional noise from the fire station nearby but no real problem.

title: Should be rated higher.
review: Excellent location for the rate we paid. Literally 5 mins walk from the city centre, which is route to Alahambra (about a twenty min walk away, but via shops cafés etc.). Hotel is definitley 4 star, nice big rooms, good bathrooms, all very modern. Nice pool. Two things - One, staff don't exactly advertise this, but parking is free 24 / 7 directly outside the hotel, whereas parking in hotel carpark is €16 per day. Two, although vert goood and comfortable, you may need to specifically request an actual double bed, as oppossed to the two singles made up as one that we got. No irons available either. Overall thought, great for a city break.

title: Amazing
review: The outlook of the hotel isn't half as impressive as the lobby. You walk in and its this majestic feeling. We loved, loved, loved the Alhambra-esque decor. The pool and the surrounding area is absolutely charming. We had two rooms, one faced the pool while the other faced another building (boo!). But we only used to room to sleep-in, so it was rather alright. We sometimes walked to the the central part of the city, even once at night around 12am, and it was absolutely fine. The breakfast they serve for €3 is fantastic. We used to look forward to that part of the meal daily!!!! Granada has such a great feel to it. I loved the city and this hotel was certainly playing the part in the grandeur experience.

title: A lovely experience
review: My husband, 11 and 13 year old and Spanish friend stayed one night so that we could go to the Alhambra.  The hotel gave us an early checkin, had lovely rooms and gave us a late checkout (to 8PM!) the next day for 30 Euros.  The double room was 60 Euros, and the triple was 80.  The pool was lovely, the beds were comfortable and we enjoyed ourselves thoroughly.   Town was about a 15 minute walk.  Don't get the breakfast for 10 Euros; it is a generous continental, but it is a continental cold breakfast. The people could not have been nicer or more helpful.

title: Spacious, clean hotel, convenient location
review: We stayed four nights while exploring Granada and Alhambra.  PROS: Excellent location halfway in between the city center and Alhambra. Taxi costs about Euro 5 either way. Several bus stops next to the hotel, public transport in Granada is excellent and user-friendly. Supermarket 'Mercadona" is about 10 minutes walk from the hotel, "El Corte Ingles" is about 20 minutes walk away or an easy ride on the bus. Rooms are spacious and comfortable, with excellent bath facilities and LCD TV. AC and safe in the room. Small, but nice pool area. Full breakfast from 7 to 10 AM at Euro 10 per person. Also, limited breakfast available after 10 AM at the bar for Euro 3 or Euro 5 per person.  CONS: The hotel website is not user-friendly, better use other booking sites. No queen or king beds even…

title: Nice spacious hotel with pool in a quieter part of Granada
review: We stayed at the Hotel Saray for two nights with two small children (2 and 6 years old). We used to hotel to visit the Alhambra (get your tickets via the Internet in advance) and downtown Granada. The hotel is located somewhat away from the central downtown of Granada and has newly furnished rooms in a modern style. It has a nice entrance, glass elevators, and a large pool.   Getting to the hotel was relatively straightforward, following the in-car GPS. The hotel does have parking for an extra fee but we opted to find free street parking. It is not plentiful but is possible to find if you circle around a few times. It is about a twenty minute walk to the usual tourist sites of downtown Granada. Don't bother trying to drive there from the hotel- it will take at least that long…

title: Fantastic Granada Hotel
review: Brilliant hotel with fantastic rooms and service.  We stayed for 5 nights and found that this was the perfect base for our visit.  The rooms were spacious and very clean with a huge bed.  We are non smokers, we requested a non smoking room and thats exactly what we got. The rooms also have free wifi. Not being in the city centre was perfect as the hotel was quiet when we wanted to sleep but town was only a ten minute walk.  It is also right by the last stop of the airport bus which is a bargin at 3 euros.  We would stay there again in a hearbeat and recommend it to anyone.

title: Luxurious hotel close to the city centre
review: The hotel was quite luxurious, we had a nice, newly renovated room. Around the hotel we could find free parking along the streets, it was in a safe area, so we did not have to worry about our rental car being damaged or broken into. The city centre is a 10-15min walk. Hotel and room was very clean and the hotel staff was friendly too.

title: stay away
review: We had a similar experience to another reviewer.  We booked a non-smoking room, and the room reeked of smoke.  We tried to open the window, but it was broken.  We were awakened during the night by smoking such that we had to put towels under the door.  When we tried to speak to the desk about this, they were completely unreceptive and not helpful at all.  We also had a confirmation that said breakfast was included and the front desk refused to honor this.  There is a good breakfast, but it is very expensive 13 euro per person.  If you want just a continental breakfast, you cannot get that until 10 am.  The location is ok.  It is not that far from the center of town, but the walk is not easy--requires crossing a highway.

title: Not quite value for money.......
review: We stayed here for 4 nights in May, the temp was 35c so the pool was much needed after a few hours in the city heat...........only it was closed for the first 3 days for repairs. Who schedules repair work for a a week in May?? We only booked this hotel as it is a fair step from the centre for its pool so this was a major disappointment.   The hotel  seems to market itself as a business rather than leisure hotel, no problem with this other than the 24 euro per day charge for TV/Internet combined. Nearly a 100 quid to watch the news/ film if you are staying 4 days. No thanks......  Other than those two things you can't complain. Its very clean and the breakfast if all inclusive is very good value. The service at the desk is a little relaxed and on our visit, not much English…

title: Wonderful value for the money
review: This is an elegant and luxurious hotel.  A little outside the main sightseeing part of the city but within an easy half hour walk of the Cathedral.  The room was well-appointed and roomy for three adults.  The staff was helpful and professional.  The breakfast was well worth the money.  The parking on site was steep but covered and the spaces were larger than expected in Spain.

title: Good Value for Money
review: I stayed at the Saray Hotel in Granada in March 2009 together with my parents. We booked two rooms. When we arrived the hotel was almost full and we were upgraded to Junior Suites, which were excellent. They were large, modern and clean. The hotel was refurbished in 2008. We booked on the web directly with the hotel and the room rates were very good. The hotel is located near the Congress Palace and is within walking distance from the city centre (my parents who are over seventy years old could walk with no problems). There is a bus stop nearby with regular buses to the City Centre. The airport bus also stops very close to the hotel. I had dinner on the first evening in the restaurant - food was ok, but too expensive in my view. Stayed at the bar every night and enjoyed a drink.…

title: some thin buthere us about this hotel ?!
review: Our room was facing another building's windows. Even though it is a walking distance to the center, there was nothing around the hotel, restaurants, shops or anything. Finding a free parking in the street was difficult. I felt the hotel had no sole! Travel tour companies like insight vacation and globus use this hotel.  Tickets for the Alhamra Castle was sold out for two days?!

title: great stay in Granada
review: great value hotel- near last stop of airport bus- also bus to bus station stops just around corner- allow at least an hour if you are going there as traffic can be slow. We stayed twice in one week as we went to seville for three days. The last night of our stay there had been a mix up with our booking. When we got back from Seville I complained about this and the girl on the desk gave us a room at the agreed price with no quibble. She also upgraded us to a junior suite.Thanks!  Breakfast was excellent- plenty of choice. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel- good value, good rooms, convenient position- what more could you want for a city break!

title: Great Location - Average Hotel
review: The Saray is in a great location in Granada. A very short walk from the airport bus stop. The bus leaves the stop hourly and costs 3 euros. The journey took us 1 hour 15 mins on the way in on Thursday and 45 mins on Sunday afternoon. It takes about 10-15 minutes to walk to the Cathedral which is across the river and 15-20 minutes to the tourist office close to the bus stop for the Alhambra.   The rooms in the hotel are large, but there is no tea and coffee making materials. The beds are singles pushed together. The bathroom was clean and modern. I would have thought that slippers and robes would have been provided at a 4 star hotel such as this one. I think it is really only 3 star and suppose the extra star is there because of the small pool complex. It was much too cold to use…

title: Confirming previous good experience
review: I have been again, after my first stay one year ago, to this 4* Hotel in Granada. I have to confirm my previous good experience: the hotel is very clean, rooms are large, it is very easy to find it if you are arriving to Granada by car. The only changes, for the bad, were: that staff at the desk has been reduced so this time we had to wait several minutes each time we need something from the desk; amenities in the room have also been reduced (shaving set and dental kit only on demand....something it shouldn't happen in a 4* hotel). On the other hand the good thing is that this time we profited from a extremely convenient offer so we pay just 60 euros per night for a triple room vat included(without breakfast, but it is much cheaper to have it at the bars in the city)

title: Lovely hotel in a good location
review: Stayed at the Saray for two nights at the begining of February. I had taken the advice of other people on the TA website about booking an hotel outside the city centre if one had a hire car. This proved to be excellent advice as driving in the city centre is difficult and parking near on impossible. The hotel has a parking garage underground for Euro 16 per day.  The hotel reception is very nice and the staff at reception helpful. Our room was lovely, very modern with comfortable bed and pillows, spotlessly clean, and a nice bathroom. As mentioned in other reviews the rooms are very spacious in comparison to other Spanish hotels I have stayed at.  We had an excellent deal off the internet Euro 65 per night which was brilliant value for the standard of hotel and with the £1 being…

title: Very nice hotel in Granada
review: This was a lovely hotel with a beautiful pool (closed while I was there as it was December and much too cold) and nice lobby.  Nice room with the usual amenities (no hair conditioner in Spain)  and a pillow menu--nice touch.  Location was pretty good, but a bit of a walk to the cathedral and the old city shopping areas.

title: EXCELLENT CHOICE
review: We stayed at the beautiful Saray Hotel for 5 nights. The staff spoke very good English and were very helpful to us as to bus routes. The room was kept very clean and tidy, the beds were very comfortable. The breakfast buffet had a large incredible choice selection: assorted cereals/milk/yogurt, hard boiled eggs, stuffed tomatoes, spiced  mushrooms, bacon, sausages and scrambled eggs. Hot coffee and assorted juices. A large range of fresh fruit especially juicy persimmons and cherimoyas which was quite a treat. Cheeses and  several types of rolls and pastries. We had to leave for the Airport very early in the morning and asked if the kitchen could pack a breakfast for us to take to eat on the way. They did a beautiful job in a very gracious presentation of what we take back of…

title: Great rooms and public spaces
review: Our double room at the Saray Hotel was spacious for a European 4-star hotel, clean, with a nice workspace and excellent bathroom facilities.  The room came with a 32 inch LCD tv and free internet service (just ask for a password at the front desk).  Room decor is quite modern.  Public spaces have a very well done Arabic theme.  And the price during the November off-season was excellent, about 75 Euros for two including breakfast.   The hotel is quite a hike from the Alhambra and Cathedral, so you'll need to take a  bus or taxi.  We found on-street parking, but the hotel has a pay garage.  The breakfast buffet is diverse and filling.  At dinner we took the buffet, which also had a good variety, but the hot dishes had suffered from too much time on the steam table.  The kitchen…

title: Easily Accessible
review: Nice Hotel.  We stayed here on our honeymoon and loved the room.  It is very modern with an interactive TV.  We were able to check e-mail and I strongly reccomend getting the whole TV package for 24 euros.  The hotel is within walking distance to the Alhambra and the city centre.  The Hop on Hop off bus stops about 0.5 km from the hotel.

title: Very good hotel for an October city break in Granada
review: The hotel has a great location on a quiet street just 5 minutes walk from the hustle and bustle of the city's main streets.  Good standard of cleanliness and modern, well equiped rooms.  All cleaning, waiting on, and bar staff very helpful and pleasant.  The reception staff slightly less so but I had no administrative problems during my 4 night stay so didn't really have to test them very much.  Good, well stocked breakfast and evening buffets.  In summary, an ideal city break hotel and I would certainly book another hotel in the same chain elsewhere in Spain.

title: So hot we had to move hotels
review: We should have listened to other reviews, but as our visit was in October we really didn't think it would still be hot.  It was, in fact,  absolutely unbearable!  We complained at the front desk and they were not in the slightest bit interested.  "It's winter!" was the only explanation I was given for the aircon being switched off!  After 2 nights of complaining they eventually brought us a rickety old fan which didn't help much.  We were instructed to leave the window open, but it opened widely and there were no safety bars at all and we were on the 5th floor with two children so  that wasn't really an option.  In any case the incredible noise from the street would have been deafening!    On the first night they expected the four of us (two adults and two children) to share…

title: Good Value
review: Stayed for one night in September 2008. Room was modern,spacoius and clean, Excellent bathroom facilities.  Had no problems with front desk - however one of our group spoke Spanish which may have helped. Convenient location for a pleasant stroll to the town centre. We booked a tour of the Alhambra - picked up and dropped off at the hotel. The rate of 94 euros included a good buffet breakfast. Altogether a very good experience and good value. The weather was not too hot so we did not have to deal with the air-conditioning issue mentioned by several reviewers.

title: great hotel
review: Stayed at the saray for 2 nights whilst on holiday for 3 wks in andalucia.  Slightly apprehensive due to some less than positive reviews.  Was very happy with the service, standards and location of the hotel, although if you are visiting granada just to see the alhambra you may be better staying nearer to it. -We got a taxi early in the morning that cost 6 euros's. The staff were really helpful on numerous different occaisions and all spoke good english.  Breakfast very good, room very nice ,small pool that does get crowded and you cant get a sunbed - but most people wouldnt visit this type of hotel in ts city if all they wanted to do was sunbathe - ?? 10 minute walk into town centre. All in all very enjoyable. One last thing look around the surrounding side streets for parking…

title: go for the rooms only
review: Our room was far better than anticipated and cost just £55 per night without breakfast. It was modern and clean and well appointed. Good air con. The hotel is really only ten minutes walk to the centre of town and far better than staying in the noisy town centre. It is also very near to the buses, so handy for day trips and a bus to the airport. The pool area is nice although there are at times not enough loungers to go round and the pools are bit on the small side. There were quite a few large sized people around too.  There is a kiosk selling a limited number of drinks staffed by a moany old man and it is very basic. This should be a way of the hotel making good money by providing a good choice and a good service but not here. The bar area inside the hotel is very depressing,…

title: Good hotel in a reasonable location
review: Modern hotel situated in a residential area off the main tourist area. If you are taking the airport bus, get off at the last stop (Palace Congresso or something like that), and hotel is just 2 min walk up the street.  It is a 10 min walk to the edge of the main tourist area, 20 min walk to the centre of the tourist area eg. Cathedral, 30-40 min walk to Alhamabra (remember the upslope battle though!).   Supermarket is 5min walk away - just ask the staff how to get there. Cafeteria selling burgers and such are just around the corner. Few restaurants next to Palace Congresso - also within 5 min of hotel. One pizzaria (name escapes me for now) along that main street sells really tasty pizza and pasta in good size serves at reasonable price, and even make to order your flavour. But…

title: So near yet so far
review: This hotel is undoubtedly very clean and well apointed however sadly the surly and unhelpful attituide of it's reception staff let it down. Although not right in the centre of town it is only two minutes from the edge of the central area at San Anton and there are a number of buses that stop very near by  - the number 8 bus literally stops on the hotel door step. The hotel itself does little to engage it's guests and certainly could not be described as a 'holiday' hotel - we got the impression that it was more geared to catering for delegates at the adjacent Congress Centre. Rooms are decorated in a a 'modern' style which some might like but some will loathe. The pool , although availble for use when we there in late May, does not open unitl June 15th so don't expect any…

title: Fancy but not comfortable
review: Many reviews of this hotel said the same thing.  The rooms are too hot !!!!!!!!!    Can't sleep comfortably.  The temperature is centrally controlled. (As in most hotels in Spain etc.). The control unit in your room lets you  set your own desired temperature, but its just for show!! This hotel in particular, no matter what we did, the a/c kept blowing warm air into the room.  I complained to front desk twice and was told to "open a window"...  Which I did and it opened 3-4 inches at the top. No help!!   I couldn't sleep and got up at 2 am to go out for a smoke and to cool off.   Went outside and found myself locked out.  They "closed" at midnite.  Lucky I had my room  card(key) with me.  The hotel staff did not care that the room is too hot.  They were not helpful and could…

title: Moorish Paradise, Las Vegas style
review: No, there is no casino in the hotel, but the Moorish style decoration we saw everywhere in the public areas and in the courtyard reminded us of some of the themed resorts in Las Vegas. You will find coffered ceilings, marble fountains and arabesque stucco works, all of them inspired by the famous Nashrid palaces. You can even sit down next to (a copy of) the fountain of the Generalife gardens in the courtyard. Is it nice? Yes, it is. Does it feel strange to come back to it after visiting the original less than 30 minutes walk away? Just a bit…   The rooms, in contrast, have modern, black furnishing with simple, strait lines. There are huge mirrors on the walls and a slick LCD television. The bathroom is spotless, all marble and chrome. It all feels brand new and luxurious. We…

title: In a quiet neighbourhood about 15 mins from centre
review: GOOD: Hotel Saray is next to the Palacio de Congresos. It’s a smart hotel, the public areas are traditionally decorated with fountains and Moorish patterns. The reception staff are helpful and polite.  The rooms look like they have been newly refurbished with laminated wood floors, flatscreen TVs, dark wood furniture and new bathrooms (with a decent shower and a bathtub). One thing you must do is browse the hard-backed book that is on the table in the room – we thought it was an advert book but it’s actually a good guide to Granada and its surroundings. BAD (for May): The hotel has a very inviting swimming pool on the ground floor but it is only open from 15th June (to 15th September?) something that is not clear in the hotel information online. But we did get to sit by it to…

title: nice enough hotel but some significant problems
review: GOOD: Smart spotless rooms (if a little small) with widescreen TV.  The barman is very friendly and pours the most excellent measures. A bit out of town but a 15 minute walk brings you to the centre and there are a selection of basic restaurants in the immediate area. The Alhambra is 30 mins walk. NOT GOOD: THE AIRCON DOESN'T COOL BELOW 24 DEGREES. Despite moving rooms and numerous handymen looking at our aircon unit, we couldn't cool either enough to get a comfortable night's sleep. If you like a cold bedroom, beware! The pool doesn't open till June (it's 27 degrees outside?!!!!!) and during our stay there was constant noise from the pool area cleaners. If you can't sleep during the night and relax during the day it kind of defeats the oject, really.

title: Definatly above expectations
review: Upon booking this hotel through Lastminute for my weekend break to Granada I expected the Saray to be a functional hotel along the standard of say a 'Holiday Inn'. However i was very much mistaken.   On arrival it was evident that the hotel was smart and well kept, with an inpressive entrance area which bettered most of the hotels in the region. Once inside I found the rececption area very smart and tastyfully decreated. With a very good hotel bar downstairs.   The staff were extremely helpful and freindly behind reception and were able to upgrade our room upon arrival due to us having extra people than we expected with no fuss whatsoever.   I know people have criticised the hotel for its location, but basically unless you are disabled this should not be a problem given that you…

title: fine, but not well situated
review: My first tip is to check the Saray Hotel website directly: we ended up paying more on Expedia, so be sure to check the Saray site before committing elsewhere.  This hotel was perfectly fine in terms of the hotel itself:  the bed was comfortable, although the requested matrimonial bed ended up being 2 single beds pushed together (ask for a "cama italiana" in this case...they'll at least try to improve this by adding a mattress pad and king sized sheet).  There was a flat screen television, a nice desk area, lots of good lighting, good curtains for those of us who like the dark in the morning, a wide selection of pillows, a very good shower, and overall, we found the room to be quite comfortable.  The hotel lobby is also non-smoking, a real bonus.  We did find, though, that folks…

title: Great Hotel
review: The hotel is located about a 10 minute walk from the town center which was a nice walk because of the parks and city streets. We were by the river which is where we spent many nights at the small tapa bars. The locals eat there which means that they are not over priced and the servers were very friendly (even if you don't speak spanish). The only bad part of our trip was that my camera was stolen. Be careful when you are approached by locals trying to distract you from your valuables. We went the first week of June which is the feast of Corpus Criste. There are parades and the locals dress up in traditional Spanish atire. It was beautiful. See the Alhambra at dusk to get the light. There is an observation point across the hill.

title: OK But dont expect too much
review: I stayed at this hotel in October 2007. My rate was 82 euro / night.  Overall its OK, but I didn't it find it to be anything special.  The good:    The lobby, pool and fountains are very nice and inviting. The glass elevators are a nice touch and give it a more modern look.   The not so good:    The rooms are pretty basic, after seeing the lobby you will be disappointed with the rooms. There is no work-out facility. They claim to offer high speed internet, but the signal is so weak you have to be in the lobby to use it.  Reception is efficient but far from friendly. They still allow smoking in some areas and the smell is  evident through out. There is a nice breakfast buffet, but its offered in a windowless room  with overworked wait staff.
